original: 'ong ba dang med par 'du shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes nas ring po ma lon pa rnams ni 'ong bar 'du shes pa'i phyir la skyes nas ring du lon pa rnams ni med par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang med par 'du shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes nas ring po ma lon pa rnams ni 'ong bar 'du shes pa'i phyir la skyes nas ring du lon pa rnams ni med par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the ideation of coming and the ideation of nonexistence. Those who have not long been born have the ideation of coming, while those who have long been born have the ideation of nonexistence.

original: skrag pa dang mi skrag par 'du shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du skyes nas ring po ma lon pa dang ring du lon pa ste des na 'du shes tha dad pa dag yin gyi /
analyzed: skrag pa dang mi skrag par 'du shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du skyes nas ring po ma lon pa dang ring du lon pa ste des na 'du shes tha dad pa dag yin gyi /
translated: Because they have the ideation of fear and the ideation of no fear. Those who have not long been born have the ideation of fear, while those who have long been born have the ideation of no fear.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis ji skad bshad pa lta bu bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis ji skad bshad pa lta bu bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: They have different ideations because of that, but not because they have the ideation of pleasure and the ideation of neither pleasure nor pain, as the Vaibhasikas explain.

original: bsam gtan dang po na ni nyon mongs pa can gyi 'du shes su zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na ni nyon mongs pa can gyi 'du shes su zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: In the first absorption, there is afflicted ideation.

original: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one adheres to a cause as a cause.

original: gnyis pa na ni dge ba'i 'du shes su zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsngogs dang dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa na ni dge ba'i 'du shes su zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsngogs dang dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the second, one has the notion of virtue, because it is included in the preparatory and actual stages.

original: gsum pa na ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes su zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa na ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes su zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the third, one has the notion of the result of evolution, because it is associated with the pleasure that is the result of evolution.🔽In the three formless states, it is as stated in the sutra.

original: gzugs med pa gsum na ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba ste zhes bya ba ni sems can gzugs can ma yin pa gang dag rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes dag las yang dag par 'das te nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha'
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum na ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba ste zhes bya ba ni sems can gzugs can ma yin pa gang dag rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes dag las yang dag par 'das te nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha'
translated: There are sentient beings who, in every way, transcend the perceptions of form, and thinking, “space is infinite,”

original: mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa yang yod de 'di lta ste nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha dag go //
analyzed: mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa yang yod de 'di lta ste nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha dag go //
translated: attain and abide in the sphere of infinite space.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth abode of consciousness.

original: sems can gzugs can ma yin pa gang dag rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can ma yin pa gang dag rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: There are also beings who are formless, who have transcended all perceptions of form,

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes @251b mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes @251b mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa yang yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: and who, having the perception of infinite space, have become absorbed in the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha dag go //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha dag go //
translated: They are the gods who have gone to the sphere of infinite space.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa drug pa yin no //🔽sems can gzugs can ma yin pa gang dag rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa drug pa yin no // sems can gzugs can ma yin pa gang dag rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: This is the sixth abode of consciousness.🔽There are also beings who are formless, who have transcended all perceptions of the sphere of infinite space,

original: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag kyang yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag kyang yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: and who, having the perception of infinite consciousness, have become absorbed in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha dag go //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha dag go //
translated: They are the gods who have gone to the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the seventh abode of consciousness.🔽The four aggregates and five aggregates are associated with these abodes, respectively, as appropriate.

original: ci rigs par de dag dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga dang bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni phung po bzhi yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs par de dag dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga dang bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni phung po bzhi yin no //
translated: Those associated with the base of infinite space and so on are the four aggregates.

original: gzhan dag dang ldan pa ni phung po lnga yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag dang ldan pa ni phung po lnga yin no //
translated: Those associated with the others are the five aggregates.🔽The remaining are associated with the destroyer.

original: lhag ma de 'joms byed ldan zhes bya ba ni 'dis yongs su 'joms par byed pas na 'joms byed do //
analyzed: lhag ma de 'joms byed ldan zhes bya ba ni 'dis yongs su 'joms par byed pas na 'joms byed do //
translated: The destroyer is that which completely destroys consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa de yongs su 'joms pa ni de'i 'joms byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yongs su 'joms pa ni de'i 'joms byed do //
translated: The destroyer of that consciousness is the destroyer of consciousness.

original: de 'di la yod pas na de'i 'joms byed ldan no /🔽// / bam po nyi shu gsum pa /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na de'i 'joms byed ldan no / // / bam po nyi shu gsum pa /
translated: Since it exists here, it is associated with the destroyer.

original: lhag ma ni ngan 'gro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ngan 'gro la sogs pa'o //
translated: The remaining are the unfortunate realms and so on.🔽Both do not exist in the unfortunate realms.

original: ngan song dag na ni gnyi ga med do zhes bya ba ni 'di na gnas pa rnams kyang 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid med la /
analyzed: ngan song dag na ni gnyi ga med do zhes bya ba ni 'di na gnas pa rnams kyang 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid med la /
translated: Those who abide here do not desire to go there.

original: de na gnas pa rnams kyang skyod par mi 'dod pa nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de na gnas pa rnams kyang skyod par mi 'dod pa nyid med pa'o //
translated: And those who dwell there do not wish to move.

original: rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu ba nyam chung ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa stobs dang ldan pa gnas so zhes bya bar brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu ba nyam chung ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa stobs dang ldan pa gnas so zhes bya bar brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the movement of the mind and mental factors is not clear there, it is not reasonable to say that consciousness is powerful.

original: srid rtse dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams //🔽sems can gyi ni gnas dgur bshad //
analyzed: srid rtse dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams // sems can gyi ni gnas dgur bshad //
translated: The Peak of Existence and the Beings of the Formless Realm🔽are the nine abodes of sentient beings.

original: ces bya ba ni mdo las sems can gyi gnas dgu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mdo las sems can gyi gnas dgu bshad pa ste /
translated: The sutras explain that there are nine abodes of sentient beings.

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine?

original: sems can gzugs can la lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can la lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who have different bodies and different ideations.

original: 'di lta ste mi rnams dang lha kha cig lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi rnams dang lha kha cig lta bu'o //
translated: This refers to humans and some gods.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first abode of sentient beings.

original: gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag tu ji skad bshad pa de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //🔽khyad @252a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag tu ji skad bshad pa de bzhin du brjod par bya'o // khyad @252a * //
translated: The difference is that the second abode of consciousness is the sentient beings who are formless, who have not attained the attainments of the formless realm.🔽The third abode of consciousness is the sentient beings who are formless, who have attained the first two attainments of the formless realm but have not attained the third.

original: par ni 'di yod de sems can gzugs can dag la 'du shes med cing so sor 'du shes med pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽sems can 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams te /
analyzed: par ni 'di yod de sems can gzugs can dag la 'du shes med cing so sor 'du shes med pa ni 'di lta ste / sems can 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams te /
translated: The fourth abode of consciousness is the sentient beings who are formless, who have attained the first three attainments of the formless realm but have not attained the fourth.

original: 'di sems can gyi gnas pa lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di sems can gyi gnas pa lnga pa yin no //
translated: The fifth abode of consciousness is the sentient beings who are formless, who have attained the fourth attainment of the formless realm.

original: sems can gyi gnas gzugs med pa rnams las kyang rnam par shes pa gnas pa gsum brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi gnas gzugs med pa rnams las kyang rnam par shes pa gnas pa gsum brjod par bya'o //
translated: The abodes of consciousness in the formless realm should be explained in the same way as the abodes of consciousness in the form realm.🔽The fourth formless realm is the sentient beings who are formless, who have completely transcended the sphere of nothingness and are abiding having attained and being absorbed in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: gzugs med pa bzhi pa ni sems can gzugs can ma yin pa dag la rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa yod do //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa bzhi pa ni sems can gzugs can ma yin pa dag la rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa yod do //🔽'di lta ste /
translated: The fifth formless realm is the sentient beings who are formless, who have completely transcended the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception and are abiding having attained and being absorbed in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams lta bu'o //
translated: The gods who are in the perception-sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas dgu pa yin no //
translated: This is the ninth abode of beings.

original: bsam gtan bzhi par nye bar 'gro ba 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag las gzhan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ci sems can gyi gnas yin nam /🔽'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi par nye bar 'gro ba 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag las gzhan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ci sems can gyi gnas yin nam / 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Are the gods of the fourth meditation who are not included in the class of beings without ideation an abode of beings or not?

original: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re ma yin no zhes zer ro //🔽ci'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'di skad du gzhan gang dag ce na /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re ma yin no zhes zer ro // ci'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'di skad du gzhan gang dag ce na /
translated: The Master Saṃghabhadra says that they are not.🔽Why does the Master Vasubandhu say: “What are the others? The unfortunate destinies”?

original: ngan song rnams te zhes bshad ce na 'di ni sgo tsam zhig bshad par zad de /
analyzed: ngan song rnams te zhes bshad ce na 'di ni sgo tsam zhig bshad par zad de /
translated: He is speaking from a certain point of view.

original: bsam gtan bzhi par nye bar 'gro ba 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyis ma bsdus pa rnams kyang brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi par nye bar 'gro ba 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyis ma bsdus pa rnams kyang brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: The gods of the fourth meditation who are not included in the class of beings without ideation should also be mentioned.

original: 'dir yang gtan tshigs ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag la bshad pa gang yin pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang gtan tshigs ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag la bshad pa gang yin pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, the reason should be stated as it was stated in the discussion of the abodes of consciousness.

original: 'di na gnas pa rnams ni ngan song du 'gro ba don du gnyer ba med la /
analyzed: 'di na gnas pa rnams ni ngan song du 'gro ba don du gnyer ba med la /
translated: Beings who live here do not seek to go to the lower rebirths.

original: de na gnas pa rnams kyang gnas par 'gro ba med pa nyid pas de dag ni sems can gyi gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de na gnas pa rnams kyang gnas par 'gro ba med pa nyid pas de dag ni sems can gyi gnas ma yin no //
translated: And those who live there do not seek to go to the higher rebirths.

original: 'bras bu che ba 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyis ma bsdus pa dag tu yang 'di na gnas pa rnams 'gro ba don du gnyer ba yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyis ma bsdus pa dag tu yang 'di na gnas pa rnams 'gro ba don du gnyer ba yod mod kyi /
translated: Beings who live here do seek to go to the great resultants and to the beings devoid of discernment.

original: de na gnas pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'du shes med pa la 'jug par 'dod do //
analyzed: de na gnas pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'du shes med pa la 'jug par 'dod do //
translated: But ordinary beings who live there seek to enter the state of non-discernment.

original: 'phags pa ni sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dag na gnas pa rnams kyang gnas gtsang ma dang gzugs med par 'jug 'dod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dag na gnas pa rnams kyang gnas gtsang ma dang gzugs med par 'jug 'dod do //
translated: Āryas who live in the Abhasvara and Śubhakṛtsna heavens seek to enter the pure abodes and the formless realm.

original: gnas gtsang ma rnams kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa @252b nyid pas de dag ni de na gnas pa'i blo med de /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa @252b nyid pas de dag ni de na gnas pa'i blo med de /
translated: But those who live in the pure abodes do not seek to enter the formless realm because they seek to attain nirvāṇa.

original: de de'i phyir de dag ni sems can gyi gnas ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de de'i phyir de dag ni sems can gyi gnas ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore they are not abodes of sentient beings.

original: yang gzhan dag na re gzhan gang zhe na ngan song rnams te zhes ngan song rnams kho na sems pa'i phyir slob dpon ni sprin med la sogs pa sems can gyi gnas yin par bzhed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re gzhan gang zhe na ngan song rnams te zhes ngan song rnams kho na sems pa'i phyir slob dpon ni sprin med la sogs pa sems can gyi gnas yin par bzhed do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Master believes that the Anabhraka and other stages are the abodes of sentient beings.

original: de dag gis ni rigs pa btsal dgos so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rigs pa btsal dgos so //
translated: We must examine this point.

original: btson ra bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mi 'dod bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir btson ra dag sems can gyi gnas ma yin pa ltar ngan song rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: btson ra bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mi 'dod bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir btson ra dag sems can gyi gnas ma yin pa ltar ngan song rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The unfortunate planes of existence are not abodes of sentient beings, like prisons, because sentient beings are there against their will.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la rnam par shes pa gnas pas rnam par shes pa gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la rnam par shes pa gnas pas rnam par shes pa gnas pa'o //
translated: The expression “abode of consciousness” means that consciousness resides there.

original: nye bar 'gro bas na nye bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar 'gro bas na nye bar 'gro ba ste /
translated: The expression “those who go there” means those who go to the abodes of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di dang nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di dang nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression “those who are associated with consciousness” means those who are associated with the consciousness of this realm.

original: de ni gzugs kyang yin la de ni nye bar 'gro ba yang yin pas gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba ste de bzhin du de dag ni 'du byed kyi bar du yang srid pas 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya'o //🔽skal ldan khyad par can na re rnam par shes pa gnas pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba nas /
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyang yin la de ni nye bar 'gro ba yang yin pas gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba ste de bzhin du de dag ni 'du byed kyi bar du yang srid pas 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya'o // skal ldan khyad par can na re rnam par shes pa gnas pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba nas /
translated: Similarly, it is a destination of formations because it is possible to have a destination of formations up to and including formations.

original: 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i bar ni mdo sde pa rnams kyi lugs su bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i bar ni mdo sde pa rnams kyi lugs su bshad pa yin te /
translated: Bhadanta Dharmasubhuti says that the explanation of the destinations of consciousness from a destination of form up to a destination of formations is the Sautrantika system.

original: de la rnam par shes pa gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ma chad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ma chad pa yin no //
translated: The continuum of consciousness is the destination of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa 'di la gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba yod pas 'di ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa 'di la gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba yod pas 'di ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Because there is a destination of form in this destination of consciousness, it is a destination of form.

original: nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni de bdag nyid kyi yin par khas len pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni de bdag nyid kyi yin par khas len pa'o //
translated: The term destination is accepted to be the nature of that.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa gnas pa 'di la 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba yod pas 'di ni 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa gnas pa 'di la 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba yod pas 'di ni 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Likewise, since the formation of consciousness is present in this station of consciousness, it is called the station of the formation of consciousness.

original: yang na gnas pa ni srid pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gnas pa ni srid pa yin te /
translated: Or else, station means existence.

original: 'dis yang srid pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis yang srid pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness is the station of consciousness because it causes the continuity of consciousness to remain through the continuity of existence.

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa ste /
translated: The station of consciousness is the station of consciousness.

original: de de la mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas gzugs su nye bar 'gro bas na gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de de la mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas gzugs su nye bar 'gro bas na gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba ste /
translated: Since one is attached to it, one is drawn to form, up to one is drawn to formations.

original: 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: This is what they say.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lugs ltar byed pa po'i don du sbyar bar ni mi @253a * //🔽nus pas de ni sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lugs ltar byed pa po'i don du sbyar bar ni mi @253a * //🔽nus pas de ni sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: But since it is not possible to apply the meaning of agent to the Vaibhāṣika system, that is refuted.

original: 'dir bshad pa rnam pa 'di gnyi ga yang rnam par shes pa gnas pa gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan par bshad de de ni /

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par shes pa gnas pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer te //

analyzed: gnas pa po yongs su spangs nas zhes bya ba ni gnas pa po ma gtogs par te /

translated: Joy is mental satisfaction.🔽The seven abodes of consciousness have the nature of the five aggregates.🔽How is that? If you accept that the seven abodes of consciousness have the nature of the five aggregates,

translated: If that is so, then the consciousness that delights in and delights to engage the aggregates of form and so on, which are subsumed as one undifferentiated entity, is called the consciousness that is the seventh abidance of consciousness.🔽This is asserted by the Vaibhasikas because the aggregates subsumed by the birth āyatana are subsumed by the class of humans and so on.

analyzed: so sor dbye na ste phung po re rer dbye na ni ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rten dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang lhan cig byung ba'i ngo bor nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa yin pa ltar rnam
translated: If the consciousness is classified separately, that is, if the aggregates are classified separately, then just as form and so on are afflicted by consciousness because they are its basis, concomitant states and coemergent states, then consciousness is also afflicted by form and so on.

original: par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni logs shig tu de lta ma yin te ci zhe na /
analyzed: par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni logs shig tu de lta ma yin te ci zhe na /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de dag gi nang na rdzus te skye ba rnams ni rab yin no //

analyzed: des ni 'gro ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba'i 'gro ba dang lha'i 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Two destinies” means the destiny of hell beings and the destiny of gods.

analyzed: gsum gyi phyogs zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro dang // yi dags dang / mi'i 'gro ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: “The part of three” means the destinies of animals, ghosts, and humans.

analyzed: 'gro ba bar ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gnyis kyi bar ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is an intermediate destiny, it is an intermediate existence.

analyzed: 'gro ba go lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin par 'dod pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa ni gcig tu nyon mongs pa can yin la /

analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa yang res 'ga' dge ba'am nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the state of death is sometimes virtuous or afflicted.

analyzed: 'gro ba ma yin na ji ltar de gnyis la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar btags nas 'gro ba'i bar ma yin no zhes bya zhe na / 'di ni nyes pa med de / de'i tshe 'chi ba dang skye ba dag gi srid pa dag ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po dang skye ba la sogs pa 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang yod pa'i phyir la 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi
translated: If it is not a reincarnating being, how can it be designated by the term reincarnating being and called an intermediate being?

analyzed: khams na ni lus kyi dbang po yang gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault because at that time the states of death and birth are unobscured neutral states, they exist as the nature of reincarnating beings, such as the homogeneous type, the faculty of life force and birth and so on and they exist in the desire realm and the form realm.

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa yang skye ba'i srid pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa can du nges pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa yang skye ba'i srid pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa can du nges pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The state of death is not definitely afflicted, like the state of birth,

original: dge bar nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dge bar nges pa yang ma yin te /

original: de lta bas na de dag la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar btags nas 'gro ba'i bar ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar btags nas 'gro ba'i bar ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is said that they are called “going” because they are in the middle of going.

original: srid pa bar ma byung ba min //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma byung ba min //
translated: The intermediate existence does not arise.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: What is it then?🔽It is called “arising” because it is manifest and complete.

original: mngon zhing rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyis ni ris mthun pa mngon la rdzogs par byed pa dag gis ni rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon zhing rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyis ni ris mthun pa mngon la rdzogs par byed pa dag gis ni rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: The projecting karma projects the class affiliation, and the completing karma completes it.

original: skye ba gcig ni gcig gis 'phen //
analyzed: skye ba gcig ni gcig gis 'phen //
translated: One projects one birth.

original: rdzogs par byed @256b pa du ma yin //
analyzed: rdzogs par byed @256b pa du ma yin //

analyzed: zhes 'byung bas skye ba thams cad la las gnyis bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two karmas function in all births.

original: yul gang du ming dang gzugs las kyis ji ltar 'phangs pa bzhin 'byung zhing mngon la skye mched drug tshang zhing rdzogs pa de ni bgrod par bya ba'i yul yin no //

translated: The place where name and form arise, manifest, and are complete due to karma is the place to be traversed.

original: 'bru yi rgyun dang chos mthun phyir //
analyzed: 'bru yi rgyun dang chos mthun phyir //
translated: Because it is similar to a stream of grain.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'brel zhing 'phel ba ni rgyun to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'brel zhing 'phel ba ni rgyun to //
translated: The term “continuum” means a series.

original: 'bru'i rgyun ni 'bru'i rgyun te /
analyzed: 'bru'i rgyun ni 'bru'i rgyun te /
translated: The continuum of rice is the continuum of rice.

original: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir srid pa chad pa las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir srid pa chad pa las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Because it is similar to that, existence is not severed and then arises again.

original: skye ba'i srid pa'i gzugs ni gang dang 'bral ba dang gang du 'byung ba de dag gi bar ma'i rgyun la yod pa'i gzugs sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa'i gzugs ni gang dang 'bral ba dang gang du 'byung ba de dag gi bar ma'i rgyun la yod pa'i gzugs sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: The form of the birth existence is preceded by the form that exists in the continuum between the time of the separation from the prior existence and the time of arising in the new existence.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa gzugs kyi rgyun gyi ngo bo'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa gzugs kyi rgyun gyi ngo bo'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the form of the birth existence is the essence of the continuum of form that is its own appropriated aggregates.

original: 'bru'i rgyun phyis 'byung ba'i gzugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bru'i rgyun phyis 'byung ba'i gzugs lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the form that occurs later in the continuum of rice.

original: rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i sgo nas yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i sgo nas yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba mthong ste /
translated: It is seen that phenomena that arise by means of a continuum arise in other places without being severed,

original: dper na 'bru'i rgyun lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bru'i rgyun lta bu'o //
translated: like the continuum of rice.

original: 'bru'i rgyun phyis 'byung ba'i gzugs ni yul gzhan gang dang 'bral ba dang yul gzhan gang du 'byung ba de dag gi par ma'i rgyun la yod pa'i gzugs sngon du 'gro ba can du 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'bru'i rgyun phyis 'byung ba'i gzugs ni yul gzhan gang dang 'bral ba dang yul gzhan gang du 'byung ba de dag gi par ma'i rgyun la yod pa'i gzugs sngon du 'gro ba can du 'byung ste /
translated: The form of the later part of the stream of rice is preceded by the form existing in the stream of the seed, since it arises in another place without separating from that place.

original: 'di ni kho bo cag skad cig mar smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni kho bo cag skad cig mar smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: This is the tenet of those who advocate momentariness.

original: gang gi tshe 'bru grong nas grong gzhan du khyer ba na 'bru de grong snga mar 'gags nas grong de gnyis kyi bar du mi 'byung bar dpag tshad du mas bcad pa'i grong gzhan du 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bru grong nas grong gzhan du khyer ba na 'bru de grong snga mar 'gags nas grong de gnyis kyi bar du mi 'byung bar dpag tshad du mas bcad pa'i grong gzhan du 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: When rice is carried from one village to another, the rice does not cease in the former village and arise in the latter village without being interrupted by many yojanas between the two villages.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: nam mkha'i phyogs su skye ba dang 'gag pa bar ma pa'i rim gyis grong gzhan du 'byung la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i phyogs su skye ba dang 'gag pa bar ma pa'i rim gyis grong gzhan du 'byung la /
translated: It arises in the other village through the process of arising and ceasing in the direction of space.

original: de yang rang gi nye bar len pa gzugs kyi rgyun gyi ngo bo'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa ltar skye ba'i srid pa'i ngo bo yang de dang 'dra bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang rang gi nye bar len pa gzugs kyi rgyun gyi ngo bo'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa ltar skye ba'i srid pa'i ngo bo yang de dang 'dra bar 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as the nature of the continuum of form that is its appropriated is its nature, so too the nature of the existence at birth is its nature.

original: 'di la slob dpon yon tan blo gros ni slob ma slob dpon dbyig bshes dang bcas te /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon yon tan blo gros ni slob ma slob dpon dbyig bshes dang bcas te /
translated: On this point, Master Guṇamati and his student, Master Vasumitra,

original: rang gi sde pa la blo zhen cing goms pas rnam par 'chad pa'i las btang ste rgol ba lhur len pa 'ba' zhig la 'jug go //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa la blo zhen cing goms pas rnam par 'chad pa'i las btang ste rgol ba lhur len pa 'ba' zhig la 'jug go //
translated: were attached to and habituated to their own school, so they abandoned the work of exposition and engaged only in the work of refuting others.

original: bdag ni 'di la bstan bcos kyi don dpyad pa 'ba' zhig la @257a * //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di la bstan bcos kyi don dpyad pa 'ba' zhig la @257a * //
translated: I will strive only to analyze the meaning of the treatise here.

original: 'bad kyi ched mi che ba'i phyir dang / tshig mangs su dogs pa'i phyir de sun 'byin pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bad kyi ched mi che ba'i phyir dang / tshig mangs su dogs pa'i phyir de sun 'byin pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: I will not refute them because it is not the main point and because I fear too many words.

original: tshul can ni ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: tshul can ni ngang tshul can no //
translated: Those who are disciplined are those who have good character.

original: chad nas 'byung ba yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la me long la sogs pa dag gi nang du gzugs las gzugs brnyan lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni me long la sogs pa'i nang du gzugs gdong las gzugs brnyan gdong 'dra ba'i ngo bo chad nas🔽'byung ba mthong ste /
analyzed: chad nas 'byung ba yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la me long la sogs pa dag gi nang du gzugs las gzugs brnyan lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni me long la sogs pa'i nang du gzugs gdong las gzugs brnyan gdong 'dra ba'i ngo bo chad nas 'byung ba mthong ste /
translated: A reflection is seen in a mirror, etc., that is like the face from which it arises.

original: 'dis ni ma nges pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma nges pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the reason is not included in the predicate.

original: yang na phyir sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na phyir sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Or, it is a proof by the method of agreement.

original: skye ba srid pa'i gzugs ni gang dang 'brel ba dang / gang du 'byung ba de dag gi bar ma'i rgyun la yod pa'i gzugs sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba srid pa'i gzugs ni gang dang 'brel ba dang / gang du 'byung ba de dag gi bar ma'i rgyun la yod pa'i gzugs sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
translated: The form of an existent that arises does not precede the form that exists in the continuum between the form that is related to the cause and the form that arises,

original: rang gi nye bar len pa gzugs kyi rgyun gyi ngo bo'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa gzugs kyi rgyun gyi ngo bo'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because it has the nature of the continuum of its own appropriated form, like the form of a reflection.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba kha dog gi khyad par gzhan kho na zhig 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba kha dog gi khyad par gzhan kho na zhig 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement A reflection is a distinct color that arises is not established.

original: slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni me long la sogs pa de la gzugs kyi mthu kho nas 'khrul pa'i shes pa gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa can skye'i de la gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni chung zad kyang med do snyam pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni me long la sogs pa de la gzugs kyi mthu kho nas 'khrul pa'i shes pa gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa can skye'i de la gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni chung zad kyang med do snyam pa yin te /
translated: The master’s intention is that a consciousness having the aspect of a reflection arises due to the power of form alone in that mirror, etc., and that not even the slightest so-called reflection exists there.

original: 'dis ni dpe'i skyon chos can ma grub pa zhes bya ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni dpe'i skyon chos can ma grub pa zhes bya ba ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the example is faulty in that the subject is not established.

original: de lta bas na ma nges pa nyid kyang med la phyir bsgrub pa de yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma nges pa nyid kyang med la phyir bsgrub pa de yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example is not good, since it is not even ascertained.🔽Even if it were established, it is not similar, so it is not an example.

original: grub tu zin kyang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub tu zin kyang dngos dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin te /
analyzed: grub tu zin kyang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub tu zin kyang dngos dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin te /
translated: Even if the existence of a reflection as a substance were established, it is not similar to the case of the example, so it is not an example.

original: dper brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable as an example.

original: re zhig ji ltar na ma grub ce na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar na ma grub ce na zhes bya ba la /
translated: First, how is it not established?

original: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim mo //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim mo //
translated: The word “first” has the sense of sequence.

original: re zhig ma grub pa nyid kyi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig ma grub pa nyid kyi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reasoning of nonestablishment, he says:

original: gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir //🔽zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir // zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Because two things do not exist together in one place.

original: me long gi yul de nyid na blo na 'dug pas ni me long gi gzugs mthong gi gzugs brnyan ma yin la de nyid na mdun na 'dug pas ni gzugs brnyan mthong gi me long gi gzugs ma yin te /
analyzed: me long gi yul de nyid na blo na 'dug pas ni me long gi gzugs mthong gi gzugs brnyan ma yin la de nyid na mdun na 'dug pas ni gzugs brnyan mthong gi me long gi gzugs ma yin te /
translated: Because the cognition that is located in the mirror sees the form of the mirror, not the reflection, and because the cognition that is located in front sees the reflection, not the form of the mirror,

original: yul gcig na rgyur byas @257b pa'i gzugs gnyis lhan cig 'dug pa med do //
analyzed: yul gcig na rgyur byas @257b pa'i gzugs gnyis lhan cig 'dug pa med do //
translated: two derivative forms do not exist together in one place.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na rten gyi 'byung ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na rten gyi 'byung ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is this? Because the primary elements that are their supports are different.

original: de gnyis kyis rten gyi 'byung ba rnams tha dad pas me long gi gzugs brnyan gyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams kyis non pa'i yul der gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs kyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams kyi go skabs med de /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis rten gyi 'byung ba rnams tha dad pas me long gi gzugs brnyan gyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams kyis non pa'i yul der gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs kyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams kyi go skabs med de /
translated: Since the elements that are the basis of the two images are different, the elements that are the basis of the image of the form in the mirror do not have an opportunity in the place occupied by the elements that are the basis of the reflection.

original: de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis 'byung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the two derivative forms do not occur in the same place.

original: de lta bas na de ltar rnam par shes pa cig car med pa'i phyir dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis kyang gcig tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir de ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar rnam par shes pa cig car med pa'i phyir dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis kyang gcig tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir de ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Thus, since consciousness does not occur simultaneously and since the two derivative forms do not occur in the same place, it is shown that the reflection does not exist in the least.

original: gal te yul gang na me long gi gzugs snang ba de nyid na gzugs brnyan yang snang gi gzhan na ni ma yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na smras pa /
analyzed: gal te yul gang na me long gi gzugs snang ba de nyid na gzugs brnyan yang snang gi gzhan na ni ma yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na smras pa /
translated: If the reflection of a form appears in a mirror in one place and not elsewhere, what is the error?

original: gcig na gzugs gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba ni med do zhes snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig na gzugs gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba ni med do zhes snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: We would reply that two forms do not occur in the same place, as was previously explained.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: In one sense,

original: gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir //
analyzed: gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir //
translated: If they were one, they would not be two, because they would be devoid of difference.

original: zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this sutra is as follows:

original: gzugs gcig la lta ba po skyes bu gnyis kyis lhan cig mthong ba med pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan ma grub pa'o zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs gcig la lta ba po skyes bu gnyis kyis lhan cig mthong ba med pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan ma grub pa'o zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //
translated: Since two people looking at one form do not see it simultaneously, the reflection is not established.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: smras pa phyogs tha dad pa na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa phyogs tha dad pa na gnas pa ste /
translated: They are located in different directions.

original: kha cig byang phyogs na gnas pa rnams dang / kha cig lho phyogs na gnas pa'i mi rnams kyis mtshe'u'i chu'i yul gcig na ste /
analyzed: kha cig byang phyogs na gnas pa rnams dang / kha cig lho phyogs na gnas pa'i mi rnams kyis mtshe'u'i chu'i yul gcig na ste /
translated: Some people in the north and some people in the south see the same object, the water of a lake.

original: mtshe'u'i nang gi phyogs gcig na rang gi mdun rol gyi yul na gnas pa'i gzugs lho phyogs kyi ngogs kyi kha na 'dug pa'i gzugs rnams ni byang phyogs kyi ngogs na 'dug pa'i skyes bu'i rang gi mdun rol na gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: mtshe'u'i nang gi phyogs gcig na rang gi mdun rol gyi yul na gnas pa'i gzugs lho phyogs kyi ngogs kyi kha na 'dug pa'i gzugs rnams ni byang phyogs kyi ngogs na 'dug pa'i skyes bu'i rang gi mdun rol na gnas pa yin la /
translated: The forms located in the northern direction of the lake are the forms located in the southern direction of the lake, which are in front of the person in the northern direction of the lake.

original: byang phyogs kyi ngogs kyi kha na 'dug pa'i gzugs rnams kyang lho phyogs na 'dug pa'i skyes bu'i rang gi mdun rol na gnas pa yin te de rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi ngogs kyi kha na 'dug pa'i gzugs rnams kyang lho phyogs na 'dug pa'i skyes bu'i rang gi mdun rol na gnas pa yin te de rnams kyi'o //
translated: Also, the forms that are situated on the northern bank are situated in front of the person who is situated on the southern bank.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this statement?

original: gzugs brnyan phan tshun dmigs te tshig gi don ni byang phyogs na 'dug pa rnams kyis kyang lho phyogs kyi ngogs kyi gting na gzugs brnyan dmigs la lho phyogs na 'dug pa rnams kyis kyang byang phyogs kyi ngogs kyi gting na gzugs brnyan dmigs kyi /🔽gnyi @258a * //🔽ga cig car dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan phan tshun dmigs te tshig gi don ni byang phyogs na 'dug pa rnams kyis kyang lho phyogs kyi ngogs kyi gting na gzugs brnyan dmigs la lho phyogs na 'dug pa rnams kyis kyang byang phyogs kyi ngogs kyi gting na gzugs brnyan dmigs kyi / gnyi @258a * // ga cig car dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The meaning is that the forms that are situated on the northern bank are perceived as reflected images in the water of the lake by the person who is situated on the southern bank, and the forms that are situated on the southern bank are perceived as reflected images in the water of the lake by the person who is situated on the northern bank.🔽But the forms that are situated on the northern bank are not perceived by the person who is situated on the southern bank,🔽nor are the forms that are situated on the southern bank perceived by the person who is situated on the northern bank.

original: rang rol gyi ngogs kyi gting gi gzugs brnyan ni ngogs de na 'dug pa mtshe'u'i chu ril gyis mthong ba rnams kyis kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rang rol gyi ngogs kyi gting gi gzugs brnyan ni ngogs de na 'dug pa mtshe'u'i chu ril gyis mthong ba rnams kyis kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: The reflected images of the forms that are situated on the northern bank are not perceived by those who are situated on the northern bank and who see the entire surface of the water of the lake.

original: gal te des na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te des na ci zhe na /
translated: If this is so, then what?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In response to this question, the root text states:

original: bum pa'am ras yug gi gzugs gcig la lta ba po skyes bu gnyis kyis lhan cig mi mthong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'am ras yug gi gzugs gcig la lta ba po skyes bu gnyis kyis lhan cig mi mthong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that two people looking at the same form, such as a vase or a cloth, do not see it together.

original: mthong ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthong ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they definitely see it together.

original: 'dir ni lhan cig mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni lhan cig mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, they do not see it together.

original: de'i phyir der gzugs gzhan zhig 'byung bar ni rigs pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir der gzugs gzhan zhig 'byung bar ni rigs pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that another form would arise there.

original: / rnam pa gcig tu na 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: / rnam pa gcig tu na 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Or, the meaning of this is as follows:

original: 'jig rten na grib ma dang nyi ma gnyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na grib ma dang nyi ma gnyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba ma mthong ste /
translated: In the world, one does not see the simultaneous arising of both shade and sunlight.

original: 'dun khang ngam gzhan na yang rung gang na grib ma yod pa de na nyi ma med la /
analyzed: 'dun khang ngam gzhan na yang rung gang na grib ma yod pa de na nyi ma med la /
translated: Where there is shade in a house or elsewhere, there is no sunlight.

original: bla gab med pa gang na nyi ma yod pa de na grib ma med na /
analyzed: bla gab med pa gang na nyi ma yod pa de na grib ma med na /
translated: Where there is sunlight, there is no shade.

original: grib ma na 'dug pa'i me long gi nang na nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan yang dmigs so //
analyzed: grib ma na 'dug pa'i me long gi nang na nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan yang dmigs so //
translated: But one also observes the reflection of the sun in a mirror in the shade.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mtshe'u'i nang du ni nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan yang 'byung la /
analyzed: mtshe'u'i nang du ni nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan yang 'byung la /
translated: The reflection of the sun arises in a pond.

original: mtshe'u de'i ngogs na yod pa'i 'dun khang grib ma can gyi nang du me long zhig bzhag na me long de'i nang du nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan mtshe'u na 'dug pa de'i gzugs brnyan gzhan zhig kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽mtshe'u'i nang gi nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de yang nyi mas kun nas bslang ba yin pas gdon mi za bar nyi ma'i ngo bo nyid yin par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: mtshe'u de'i ngogs na yod pa'i 'dun khang grib ma can gyi nang du me long zhig bzhag na me long de'i nang du nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan mtshe'u na 'dug pa de'i gzugs brnyan gzhan zhig kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro // mtshe'u'i nang gi nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de yang nyi mas kun nas bslang ba yin pas gdon mi za bar nyi ma'i ngo bo nyid yin par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: If a mirror is placed in the pavilion on the bank of the lake, the reflection of the sun in the lake will appear as another reflection in the mirror.🔽Since the reflection of the sun in the lake is also aroused by the sun, it must be accepted as having the nature of the sun.

original: me long gi nang du gzugs brnyan gzhan 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang nyi ma'i ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs brnyan gyis kun nas bslang ba yin pas 'di yang gdon mi za bar nyi ma'i ngo bo nyid yin par khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: me long gi nang du gzugs brnyan gzhan 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang nyi ma'i ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs brnyan gyis kun nas bslang ba yin pas 'di yang gdon mi za bar nyi ma'i ngo bo nyid yin par khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: Since the other reflection that arises in the mirror is also aroused by the reflection that has the nature of the sun, it must be accepted as having the nature of the sun.

original: de lta yin dang grib ma dang nyi ma dag lhan cig na 'dug par 'gyur ba zhig na 'jig rten na gzhan na ni grib ma dang nyi ma dag lhan cig 'dug pa yang med pas der gzugs brnyan de 'byung bar rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang grib ma dang nyi ma dag lhan cig na 'dug par 'gyur ba zhig na 'jig rten na gzhan na ni grib ma dang nyi ma dag lhan cig 'dug pa yang med pas der gzugs brnyan de 'byung bar rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then shadow and light would be coexistent. But in the world, shadow and light are not coexistent. Therefore, it is not reasonable that the reflection arises there.

original: khron pa'i chu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khron pa'i nang na chu ma @258b zad pa ring mo zhig na 'dug par snang ba de bzhin du zla ba'i gzugs brnyan 'di nyid kyi nang na 'dug pa yang de dang 'dra bar snang ste /
analyzed: khron pa'i chu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khron pa'i nang na chu ma @258b zad pa ring mo zhig na 'dug par snang ba de bzhin du zla ba'i gzugs brnyan 'di nyid kyi nang na 'dug pa yang de dang 'dra bar snang ste /
translated: Like water in a well, means that just as water in a well appears to be far away when it is not, in the same way, the reflection of the moon appears to be inside this very well.

original: me long la ni de tsam gyi rngam kyang med do //
analyzed: me long la ni de tsam gyi rngam kyang med do //
translated: But there is no such depth in a mirror.

original: de yang 'di'i nang du 'byung na ni gzugs brnyan de yang me long kho na'i nang du 'byung na ni pha zad gzhan na dmigs par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na dmigs te de lta bas na de ni cung zad kyang med kyi gang de ltar snang ba
analyzed: de yang 'di'i nang du 'byung na ni gzugs brnyan de yang me long kho na'i nang du 'byung na ni pha zad gzhan na dmigs par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na dmigs te de lta bas na de ni cung zad kyang med kyi gang de ltar snang ba
translated: If it were to arise there, then the reflection would arise only inside the mirror, and it would not be perceived elsewhere. But it is perceived elsewhere. Therefore, it does not exist in the least.

original: de ni gzugs dang me long la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tshogs pa de'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzugs dang me long la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tshogs pa de'i mthu yin no //
translated: It is the power of the collection of conditions, such as the form and the mirror.

original: chos rnams kyi mthu'i bye brag ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mthu'i bye brag ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The specific powers of things are inconceivable.

original: dper na khab long gis lcags len par snang gi shing la sogs pa ma yin pa dang / zla ba shar nas chu shel las chu 'byung bar snang gi / sol ba la sogs pa las ni ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na khab long gis lcags len par snang gi shing la sogs pa ma yin pa dang / zla ba shar nas chu shel las chu 'byung bar snang gi / sol ba la sogs pa las ni ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: For example, it is like the fact that a magnet attracts iron and not wood, and that water appears from a moonstone when the moon rises, but not from charcoal.

original: me long gi rgyud dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan ni gzugs kyi rgyun du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me long gi rgyud dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan ni gzugs kyi rgyun du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the reflection is related to the continuum of the mirror, the reflection is not a continuation of the form.

original: me long gi rgyud dang 'brel pa'i phyir me long gi gzugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: me long gi rgyud dang 'brel pa'i phyir me long gi gzugs lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is related to the continuum of the mirror, it is like the form of the mirror.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang dus gzhan mnyam pa'i gzugs lta bur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang dus gzhan mnyam pa'i gzugs lta bur ro //
translated: Because it arises simultaneously, it is like the form of the same time period.

original: de ltar na skye ba'i srid pa 'chi ba'i srid pa'i rgyun du gyur pa ji lta bar gzugs brnyan ni gzugs kyi de lta bu ma yin pas gzugs brnyan gyi dpe bsgrub pa dang mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na skye ba'i srid pa 'chi ba'i srid pa'i rgyun du gyur pa ji lta bar gzugs brnyan ni gzugs kyi de lta bu ma yin pas gzugs brnyan gyi dpe bsgrub pa dang mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the life-stream of birth existence is the continuum of the life-stream of death existence, but a reflection is not like that. Therefore, the example of a reflection is not established.

original: 'bru'i rgyun phyis 'byung ba'i ngo bo'i dpe ni rang gi rgyun snga ma'i rgyun can du gyur pa yin pas de lta bas na dpe dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bru'i rgyun phyis 'byung ba'i ngo bo'i dpe ni rang gi rgyun snga ma'i rgyun can du gyur pa yin pas de lta bas na dpe dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: The example of the later entity of the stream of rice is the continuum of the earlier stream of rice. Therefore, it is similar to the example.

original: gzugs brnyan ni gnyis las 'byung phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gnyis kyis 'byung ba ni gnyis las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni gnyis las 'byung phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gnyis kyis 'byung ba ni gnyis las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Because a reflection arises from two, etc. means that it arises from two, i.e., it arises from two.

original: de'i phyir te gzugs dang me long las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gzugs brnyan ni gtso bo'i rgyu me long la sogs pa gang yin pa de la brten nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir te gzugs dang me long las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzugs brnyan ni gtso bo'i rgyu me long la sogs pa gang yin pa de la brten nas 'byung ste /
translated: Because of that, i.e., from form and a mirror, etc.🔽A reflection arises in dependence on the primary cause, such as a mirror, etc.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi gtso bo'i rgyu ni me long la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi gtso bo'i rgyu ni me long la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The primary cause of a reflection is a mirror, etc.

original: de dag gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are in conformity with it.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gal te ral gri'i phred du 'dug na ni gzugs brnyan yang chu rings su 'dug par snang la gal @259a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gal te ral gri'i phred du 'dug na ni gzugs brnyan yang chu rings su 'dug par snang la gal @259a * //
translated: For example,🔽if the sword is placed horizontally, the reflection appears as if it were placed horizontally;

original: te bsgreng ste 'dug na ni gzugs brnyan yang de kho na ltar snang na /
analyzed: te bsgreng ste 'dug na ni gzugs brnyan yang de kho na ltar snang na /
translated: if the sword is placed vertically, the reflection appears as if it were placed vertically.

original: skye ba'i srid pa yang de ltar 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / me long lta bu gtso bo'i rgyu gang yang rung ba zhig dang gnyis las 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa yang de ltar 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / me long lta bu gtso bo'i rgyu gang yang rung ba zhig dang gnyis las 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: But birth existence does not arise from two principal causes, as is the case with a reflection, and it is not the case that the reflection arises from the same two principal causes as the birth existence.

original: gal te phyi'i khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa gtso bo'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa gtso bo'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the principal cause of the reflection is the external water and blood, etc.,

original: sems pa med pa'i phyir dang rdzus te skye ba rnams la yang de med pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa med pa'i phyir dang rdzus te skye ba rnams la yang de med pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: we reply that this is not so, because these are devoid of thought and because beings born supernaturally have no such external elements.

original: de'i phyir yang dpe 'di ni mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dpe 'di ni mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Therefore this example is not appropriate.

original: 'dis ci zhig bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci zhig bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does this example demonstrate?

original: khyad par du byas pa'i gtan tshigs la dpe 'di mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par du byas pa'i gtan tshigs la dpe 'di mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It demonstrates that this example is not appropriate for a reason that is qualified.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: skye ba'i srid pa'i gzugs ni gang dang bral ba dang / gang du skye ba de dag gi bar ma'i rgyud la yod pa'i gzugs sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa'i gzugs ni gang dang bral ba dang / gang du skye ba de dag gi bar ma'i rgyud la yod pa'i gzugs sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: The form of the intermediate existence is preceded by the form that exists in the continuum between the place from which one is departing and the place where one will be born.

original: gnyis las 'byung ba ma yin pa ni nye bar lan pa gzugs kyi rgyun gyi ngo bo'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'bru'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i ngo bo lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis las 'byung ba ma yin pa ni nye bar lan pa gzugs kyi rgyun gyi ngo bo'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'bru'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i ngo bo lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is not derived from the two, it is the nature of the continuum of form that is the nature of the cause of the body, like the nature of the continuum of rice.

original: de lta yin na bsgrub pa 'di la ma nges pa nyid kyang brjod par mi nus la /
analyzed: de lta yin na bsgrub pa 'di la ma nges pa nyid kyang brjod par mi nus la /
translated: If that is so, then it is said that this proof is not established and it is also said that it is not possible to state that it is not ascertained.

original: phyir bsgrub par bya ba yang nus pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir bsgrub par bya ba yang nus pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is also said that it is not possible to prove the thesis.

original: lung gis kyang srid pa bar ma yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lung gis kyang srid pa bar ma yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove that the intermediate existence exists by means of scripture,

original: mgur nas gsungs phyir yod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mgur nas gsungs phyir yod ces bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “It exists because it is stated in the scriptures.”

original: rang gi ming nas brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi ming nas brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is stated in the scriptures because it is mentioned by name.

original: mdo 'di dag mi 'don to zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan dag go //
analyzed: mdo 'di dag mi 'don to zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan dag go //
translated: The other schools do not recite these sūtras.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'don ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'don ce na /
translated: Why do they not recite them?

original: de dag gi lung dag las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi lung dag las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not appear in their scriptures.

original: sde pa gzhan gyi lung las grags pa ci ste tshad mar mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan gyi lung las grags pa ci ste tshad mar mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Why do they not accept as authoritative what is well known in the scriptures of other schools?

original: yang dag par bsdus pa'i bzhi po nyams pas mdo sgro btags pa yin par dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par bsdus pa'i bzhi po nyams pas mdo sgro btags pa yin par dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they suspect that the sūtras are fabrications, since the four reliances have declined.

original: gnas gsum zhes bya ba ni rgyu gsum ste /🔽ma rung ba ni nang med pa'o //🔽zla mtshan dang ldan pa ni khrag dang ldan pa ste 'di gnyis ni gnas dang po yin no //🔽chags par gyur cing phrad pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrig pa'i chos byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnas gsum zhes bya ba ni rgyu gsum ste / ma rung ba ni nang med pa'o // zla mtshan dang ldan pa ni khrag dang ldan pa ste 'di gnyis ni gnas dang po yin no // chags par gyur cing phrad pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrig pa'i chos byed pa ste /
translated: The three conditions are the three causes.🔽The first condition is the mother who is not defective, that is, who is not lacking an organ.

original: 'di ni gnas gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second condition is the mother who is not past her fertile period, that is, who has menstrual blood.

original: dri za yang nye bar gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: dri za yang nye bar gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third condition is the couple’s passion and union, that is, their engagement in sexual intercourse.🔽The fourth condition is the gandharva, the being of the intermediate state, who is present.

original: phung po zhig pa nye bar @259b gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: phung po zhig pa nye bar @259b gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'o //
translated: The phrase “when the disintegration of the aggregates is imminent” refers to the death existence.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni lnga zhes bya ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes bya ba ni gang zag bstan pa'i mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni lnga zhes bya ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes bya ba ni gang zag bstan pa'i mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “five nonreturners” and the phrase “seven destinations of spiritually advanced beings” will be explained in the chapter entitled “The Exposition of the Person.”

original: skyes ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang skyes pa zhes bya ba'i lha zhig yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skyes ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang skyes pa zhes bya ba'i lha zhig yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase “one who is born as a god” and so on means that it would follow, absurdly, that they are gods who are born as gods.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes bya ba ni bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de dag nyid rnam pa gsum du phye na bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes bya ba ni bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de dag nyid rnam pa gsum du phye na bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “seven destinations of spiritually advanced beings” refers to the seven types of nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: de'i phyir dus dang yul gyi khyad par gyi bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gsum du bshad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus dang yul gyi khyad par gyi bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gsum du bshad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “The three types of nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state are explained as being of three types each, based on distinctions of time and place.”

original: ci rigs par dus kyi khyad par gyi bye brag dang / yul gyi khyad par gyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: ci rigs par dus kyi khyad par gyi bye brag dang / yul gyi khyad par gyi bye brag gis so //
translated: the differences in the time of the present life and the differences in the time of the future life.

original: 'dir mdo yang gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir mdo yang gdon par bya ste /
translated: Here, a sūtra should be quoted:

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan yod na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan yod na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag ngas khyed la skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun dang nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang bstan gyi /
analyzed: dge slong dag ngas khyed la skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun dang nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang bstan gyi /
translated: “Monks, I will teach you the seven destinations of holy beings and also passing into nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind, I will explain it.”

original: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the seven destinations of holy beings?

original: 'di na dge slong 'di ltar zhugs pa yin te /🔽bdag 'byung yang ci ma rung snyam pa yang med la /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong 'di ltar zhugs pa yin te / bdag 'byung yang ci ma rung snyam pa yang med la /
translated: Here, a monk is thus engaged:🔽He does not think, ‘Oh, may I not come into being.’

original: bdag gi 'byung yang ci ma rung snyam pa yang med pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa yang med bdag gi 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa yang med cing /
analyzed: bdag gi 'byung yang ci ma rung snyam pa yang med pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa yang med bdag gi 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa yang med cing /
translated: He does not think, ‘Oh, may I come into being.’ He does not think, ‘Oh, may I come into being.’ He does not think, ‘Oh, may I not come into being.’

original: yod pa gang yin pa dang yang dag pa gang yin pa de spang bar bya'o snyam pa'i btang snyoms 'thob po //
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa dang yang dag pa gang yin pa de spang bar bya'o snyam pa'i btang snyoms 'thob po //
translated: He attains equanimity, thinking: “Whatever exists and whatever is real, that should be abandoned.”

original: de srid pa 'di la chags pa med la /
analyzed: de srid pa 'di la chags pa med la /
translated: He is not attached to this existence.

original: de nas shes rab kyi go 'phang zhi ba mchog kyang rtogs shing 'dis go 'phang de yang lus kyis mngon du byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas shes rab kyi go 'phang zhi ba mchog kyang rtogs shing 'dis go 'phang de yang lus kyis mngon du byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then he realizes the supreme peace of the state of wisdom, and he manifests that state with his body.

original: dge slong de ltar zhugs pa'i 'gro ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: dge slong de ltar zhugs pa'i 'gro ba ni gang yin /
translated: “Bhikṣus, if someone were to ask, ‘What is the destiny of a bhikṣu who has entered this?

original: skye ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: skye ba ni gang yin /
translated: What is his rebirth?

original: tshe rabs gzhan ni gang yin zhes 'dri bar byed pa yod na /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan ni gang yin zhes 'dri bar byed pa yod na /
translated: What is his other existence?’

original: dge slong dag dper na zhogs ma'i me chung ngu mngon par 'grub bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de'i nga @260a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag dper na zhogs ma'i me chung ngu mngon par 'grub bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de'i nga @260a * //
translated: “Bhikṣus, just as a small fire, when it is produced, burns and then goes out, in the same way, bhikṣus, the bhikṣu’s aggregates will cease.

original: rgyal gyi lhag ma de tsam zhig ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa las de'i nga rgyal gyi lhag ma de spangs shing yongs su shes nas kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da'
analyzed: rgyal gyi lhag ma de tsam zhig ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa las de'i nga rgyal gyi lhag ma de spangs shing yongs su shes nas kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da'
translated: They attain nirvana in the intermediate state by abandoning the five higher fetters through abandoning and fully understanding the remainder of the pride of thinking i am.🔽

original: bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar 'gyur te /
translated: He does not abandon or fully understand that much of the remainder of the pride of the conqueror, but having abandoned and fully understood that remainder of the pride of the conqueror, he abandons the five higher fetters and attains nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: 'di ni skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba dang po yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba dang po yin par bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the first destination of the holy being.

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, he is engaged in this way:

original: bdag 'byung yang ci ma rung snyam pa yang med ces bya ba nas 'dri bar byed pa yod na zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag 'byung yang ci ma rung snyam pa yang med ces bya ba nas 'dri bar byed pa yod na zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He does not think, “Wouldn’t it be good if I were to arise,” up to “If there were one who asks.”

original: dper na lcags kyi thu lum mam thong lcags me kun du 'bar ba'i nang du rab tu bsregs pa lcags kyi tho bas brdungs pa rnams kyi lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de'i zhes bya ba nas kun du
analyzed: dper na lcags kyi thu lum mam thong lcags me kun du 'bar ba'i nang du rab tu bsregs pa lcags kyi tho bas brdungs pa rnams kyi lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de'i zhes bya ba nas kun du
translated: Just as an iron ball or iron ingot that is heated in a blazing fire and struck by an iron hammer, the iron sparks fly up into the air and then fall to the ground.

original: sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te /
translated: One who has abandoned the five factors associated with the lower realms attains nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: 'di ni skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second destination of holy beings.

original: gzhan yang dge slong 'di ltar zhugs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //🔽lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar nas sa la ma lhung ba nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong 'di ltar zhugs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no // lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar nas sa la ma lhung ba nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, a monk practices in this way.🔽An iron spark rises up into the air and dies out before it falls to the ground.

original: de bzhin du de'i zhes bya ba nas bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te /
