translated: Because there is no distinction in their destination.

original: 'di dag la ni yul de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir yul du 'gro ba'i bye brag med la mdo las gsungs pa'i dpe gsum po la ni yul du 'gro ba'i bye brag yod pas de dag dang mi 'byor to //
analyzed: 'di dag la ni yul de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir yul du 'gro ba'i bye brag med la mdo las gsungs pa'i dpe gsum po la ni yul du 'gro ba'i bye brag yod pas de dag dang mi 'byor to //
translated: They do not correspond to the three examples stated in the sutra because there is no distinction in their destination, since they attain nirvana in that very realm.

original: gzugs med pa dag tu yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag tu yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Also, in the formless realm

original: gal te de ltar skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag kho na bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid yin par rnam par gzhag par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag kho na bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid yin par rnam par gzhag par gyur na /
translated: if those who attain nirvana after birth were posited as those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state,

original: gzugs med pa rnams su yang de dag de bzhin du gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams su yang de dag de bzhin du gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: then those who attain nirvana in the formless realm would also be stated in that way,

original: de na tshe'i tshad kyi bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na tshe'i tshad kyi bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they attain nirvana before the end of their lifespan.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir mdo'i don ni tshe'i tshad kyi bar du'am zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo'i don ni tshe'i tshad kyi bar du'am zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the meaning of the sūtra is not as you have stated.

original: yang gzugs med pa dag tu bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gsungs par ci mngon zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gzugs med pa dag tu bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gsungs par ci mngon zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Why is it that the sūtra does not state that one attains nirvāṇa in the intermediate state in the formless realm?🔽The sūtra states:

original: bsam gtan dag gis bcu tshan bzhi //🔽zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag gis bcu tshan bzhi // zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The four absorptions are four sets of ten.

original: bsam gtan bzhis mdo'i don rnams bcu tshan bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhis mdo'i don rnams bcu tshan bzhi ste /
translated: The sūtra states that the four absorptions are four sets of ten.

original: bsam gtan dang po la bcu tshan gcig nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la bcu tshan gcig gi bar du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la bcu tshan gcig nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la bcu tshan gcig gi bar du mdzad nas so //
translated: The first absorption is one set of ten, up to the fourth absorption is one set of ten.

original: gzugs med dag gi bdun tshan gsum //
analyzed: gzugs med dag gi bdun tshan gsum //
translated: The three formless states are three sets of seven.

original: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang rnam shes dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched dag gis ni de gsum na srid pa bar ma med pa'i phyir dang / skye ba'i gnas med pas gnyis med pa'i phyir bdun tshan gsum ste de mdzad nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang rnam shes dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched dag gis ni de gsum na srid pa bar ma med pa'i phyir dang / skye ba'i gnas med pas gnyis med pa'i phyir bdun tshan gsum ste de mdzad nas so //
translated: The three formless states of the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness and the base of nothingness are three sets of seven because the intermediate state of existence does not exist there and because there are no two sets of seven.

original: 'du @262b shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched na ni gsum po de dag nyid dang / gong du 'pho ba med pa'i phyir drug tshan du mdzad nas tshom bu yang dag sdebs /🔽spel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du @262b shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched na ni gsum po de dag nyid dang / gong du 'pho ba med pa'i phyir drug tshan du mdzad nas tshom bu yang dag sdebs / spel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since there is no higher rebirth, they are not classified as a group of six.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: How is that?

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: Here a monk, through whatever aspects, signs and characteristics, is secluded from attachment to desire realm objects, secluded from attachment to negative and nonvirtuous states, possesses investigation and analysis,🔽and abides in the first concentration that is born of seclusion and possesses joy and pleasure.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang rtags de dag dang mtshan ma de dag yid la mi byed kyi /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang rtags de dag dang mtshan ma de dag yid la mi byed kyi /
translated: He does not mentally engage those aspects, signs and characteristics.

original: 'on kyang de gang zhe na dmigs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang de gang zhe na dmigs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam pa'am /
translated: But what is that? It is the form aspect of the focal object,

original: tshor ba'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rnam pa'am /
translated: the feeling aspect,

original: 'du shes kyi rnam pa'i chos de dag la nad du yid la byed cing /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi rnam pa'i chos de dag la nad du yid la byed cing /
translated: He attends to those phenomena that are the aspects of perception as a disease,

original: 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par yid la byed do //
translated: as a tumor, as a barb, as misery, as impermanent, as suffering, as empty, as selfless.

original: des chos de dag la nad du yid la byas shing bdag med pa'i bar du yid la byas nas chos de dag la yid 'byung bar byed /
analyzed: des chos de dag la nad du yid la byas shing bdag med pa'i bar du yid la byas nas chos de dag la yid 'byung bar byed /
translated: When he attends to those phenomena as a disease, up to when he attends to them as selfless, he becomes disgusted with those phenomena,

original: 'jigs par byed /
analyzed: 'jigs par byed /
translated: he becomes frightened of them,

original: phyir zlog par byed do //
analyzed: phyir zlog par byed do //
translated: he turns away from them.

original: des chos de dag la yid 'byung bar byas /
analyzed: des chos de dag la yid 'byung bar byas /
translated: When he becomes disgusted with those phenomena,

original: 'jigs par byas /
analyzed: 'jigs par byas /
translated: when he becomes frightened of them,

original: phyir bzlog par byas nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyir bzlog par byas nas 'di lta ste /
translated: when he turns away from them, he is led to the state of nectar,

original: phung po thams cad nges par spangs pa sred pa zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni zhi pa'o //
analyzed: phung po thams cad nges par spangs pa sred pa zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni zhi pa'o //
translated: to the pacification, to the excellence, which is the definite abandonment of all the aggregates, the end of craving, the freedom from attachment, the cessation, nirvana.

original: 'di ni gya nom pa'o zhes bdud rtsi'i go 'phang la gtod do zhes bya ba dang / mdo de nyid brjod nas khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gya nom pa'o zhes bdud rtsi'i go 'phang la gtod do zhes bya ba dang / mdo de nyid brjod nas khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference is that this is stated in a sutra, and then it is said:

original: de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba de 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol zhing srid pa'i zag pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba de 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol zhing srid pa'i zag pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: Thus, knowing and seeing in this way, their minds are liberated from the defilements of desire, the defilements of existence, and the defilements of ignorance.

original: rnam par grol na bdag ni rnam par grol lo zhes bya bar ye shes mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par grol na bdag ni rnam par grol lo zhes bya bar ye shes mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When liberated, they see with wisdom: “I am liberated.”

original: bdag gi skye ba ni zad /
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba ni zad /
translated: They think: “My births are exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten /
translated: I have practiced pure conduct.

original: bya ba ni byas te /
analyzed: bya ba ni byas te /
translated: I have done what needed to be done.🔽I will know no other existence than this.”🔽After stating that sūtra, it says:

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so snyam mo zhes bya ba dang / mdo de nyid brjod nas rnam par mi 'grol gyi /
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so snyam mo zhes bya ba dang / mdo de nyid brjod nas rnam par mi 'grol gyi /
translated: “They do not attain complete liberation,

original: 'on kyang chos la @263a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos la @263a * //
translated: but by that very aspiration for the Dharma,

original: 'dun pa de nyid dang / chos la chags pa de nyid dang / chos la dga' ba de nyid dang / chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dun pa de nyid dang / chos la chags pa de nyid dang / chos la dga' ba de nyid dang / chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: that very attachment to the Dharma, that very delight in the Dharma, and that very joy in the Dharma, they attain complete liberation in the intermediate state.”🔽It says: “They do not attain complete liberation in the intermediate state.

original: 'on kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / skyes nas kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / skyes nas kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: But they will not attain nirvana after they are born.🔽But they will attain nirvana without exertion.

original: 'on kyang mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: But they will not attain nirvana without exertion.🔽But they will attain nirvana with exertion.

original: 'on kyang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: But they will not attain nirvana with exertion.🔽But they will go to a higher rebirth.

original: 'on kyang gong du 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gong du 'pho bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang gong du 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gong du 'pho bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: But they will not go to a higher rebirth.

original: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid dang / chos la chags pa de nyid dang / chos la dga' ba de nyid dang / chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyis tshangs chen pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid dang / chos la chags pa de nyid dang / chos la dga' ba de nyid dang / chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyis tshangs chen pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang /
translated: However, by that very aspiration for the Dharma, by that very attachment to the Dharma, by that very delight in the Dharma, and by that very joy in the Dharma, one will be reborn with the same fortune as the Mahābrahmā gods.

original: tshangs chen pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tshangs chen pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: One will not be reborn with the same fortune as the Mahābrahmā gods.🔽However, by that very aspiration for the Dharma, and so on up to by that very joy in the Dharma, one will be reborn with the same fortune as the Brahmapurohita gods.

original: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid dang / snga ma bzhin du chos la mngon par dga' ba'i bar de nyid kyis tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / tshangs chen po'i mdun na 'don pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid dang / snga ma bzhin du chos la mngon par dga' ba'i bar de nyid kyis tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / tshangs chen po'i mdun na 'don pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: One will not be reborn with the same fortune as the Brahmapurohita gods.

original: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid kyis chos la mngon par dga' ba'i bar de nyid kyis tshangs ris pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid kyis chos la mngon par dga' ba'i bar de nyid kyis tshangs ris pa'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang /
translated: Here, monks, by whatever aspects, whatever characteristics,

original: mtshan ma gang dag gis rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /🔽sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog @263b pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang rtags de dag dang mtshan ma
analyzed: mtshan ma gang dag gis rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste / sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog @263b pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang rtags de dag dang mtshan ma
translated: and whatever signs one is free from investigation and analysis, internally clear,

original: de dag yid la mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de dag yid la mi byed kyi /
translated: and with a one-pointed mental continuum, without investigation and analysis, possessing the joy and bliss born from concentration, having fully accomplished the second concentration and abides, one does not attend to those aspects, those characteristics,🔽and those signs.

original: 'on kyang gang de nyid na dmigs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang de nyid na dmigs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: However, one attends to that very object...

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The entire text is the same as before, up to “the cessation that is separation from desire, up to separation from ignorance, is peaceful, is sublime, is the supreme state, and is the complete nirvana.”

original: mdo de nyid brjod nas de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba de /
analyzed: mdo de nyid brjod nas de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba de /
translated: Having expressed that very sutra, it is said, “One who knows and sees in that way

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol zhing srid pa'i zag pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa las zhes bya ba nas bya ba ni byas te 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no /🔽// / bam po nyi shu bzhi pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol zhing srid pa'i zag pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa las zhes bya ba nas bya ba ni byas te 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no / // / bam po nyi shu bzhi pa /
translated: is liberated from the mind’s defilement of desire, from the defilement of existence, from the defilement of ignorance, up to ‘the task has been accomplished, and there is no more beyond this existence.’

original: mdo de nyid brjod nas rnam par mi grol gyi /
analyzed: mdo de nyid brjod nas rnam par mi grol gyi /
translated: Having expressed that very sutra, it is said, “One who does not attain liberation🔽but who has the aspiration for the Dharma, up to who delights in the Dharma, will be reborn with a fortune equal to that of the gods of clear light.”🔽It is said, “One who does not attain liberation

original: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis 'od gsal gyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'od gsal gyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis 'od gsal gyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'od gsal gyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: but who has the aspiration for the Dharma, up to who delights in the Dharma, will not be reborn with a fortune equal to that of the gods of clear light.

original: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: However, through just that aspiration for the Dharma up to just that delight in the Dharma, one is born with fortune equal to the gods of immeasurable radiance.🔽One is not born with fortune equal to the gods of immeasurable radiance.🔽However, through just that aspiration for the Dharma up to just that delight in the Dharma, one is born with fortune equal to the gods of lesser radiance.

original: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du chos la 'dun pa de nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis 'od chung gi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du chos la 'dun pa de nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis 'od chung gi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang /
translated: Here, monks, through whatever aspects,

original: rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
translated: through whatever signs, through whatever marks, one abides in equanimity through freedom from attachment to joy, and one is mindful and has introspection.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa la gnas pa bde ba la gnas pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa la gnas pa bde ba la gnas pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The Āryas say that pleasure experienced by the body is abiding in pleasure that is based on mindfulness.

original: dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag yid la mi byed kyi zhes bya ba @264a * //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag yid la mi byed kyi zhes bya ba @264a * //
translated: He does not pay attention to those aspects, those signs, and those characteristics, but he fully abides in the third meditative absorption in which there is no joy and in which he has purified pleasure.

original: mdo thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
translated: All of the sutra is the same as before.

original: ris mthun pa 'ba' zhig la khyad par yod de /
analyzed: ris mthun pa 'ba' zhig la khyad par yod de /
translated: The only difference is in the homogeneous group.

original: gong du 'pho bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gong du 'pho bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: He does not proceed higher.🔽However, he is reborn with a fortune equal to that of the gods in the Luminous Heaven, up to he is reborn with a fortune equal to that of the gods in the Heaven of Vast Fruit.

original: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du chos la 'dun pa da nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis dge rgyas kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / dge rgyas kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du chos la 'dun pa da nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis dge rgyas kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / dge rgyas kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: He is not reborn with a fortune equal to that of the gods in the Heaven of Vast Fruit.

original: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du de nyid kyis tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du de nyid kyis tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: However, by that alone, one will be born with the same fortune as the gods of immeasurable virtue.🔽However, by that alone, one will not be born with the same fortune as the gods of immeasurable virtue.🔽However, by that alone, one will be born with the same fortune as the gods of minor virtue.

original: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du de nyid kyis dge chung gi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis bde ba yang spangs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du de nyid kyis dge chung gi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis bde ba yang spangs te /
translated: Here, a monk abandons pleasure,

original: snga nas sdug bsngal spongs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal spongs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
translated: previously abandons pain, and through the subsiding of mental pleasure and mental pain, attains the fourth concentration, which is neither painful nor pleasant and possesses complete purity of mindfulness due to equanimity.

original: gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag ces bya bar mdo thams cad snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag ces bya bar mdo thams cad snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for all the sūtras, with respect to those aspects, those signs, and those marks.

original: lha'i ris su skye ba ni khyad par du bya ste /🔽chos la mngon par dga' ba'i bar de nyid kyis 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / skye bar mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: lha'i ris su skye ba ni khyad par du bya ste / chos la mngon par dga' ba'i bar de nyid kyis 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / skye bar mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Birth in the god realms is distinguished:🔽By that very delight in the Dharma, one is reborn with the same fortune as the gods of the higher realms.🔽One is not reborn there, but is reborn with the same fortune as the gods of the Brahma heavens.

original: bsod nams skyes kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / skye bar mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: bsod nams skyes kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / skye bar mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: One is not reborn there, but is reborn with the same fortune as the gods of the gods of the Brahma heavens.

original: sprin med kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: sprin med kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Here a monk, by whatever aspects, whatever signs, whatever aspects and signs, completely transcends the perceptions of form,🔽and having the perception of the infinitude of space, abides having fully accomplished the sphere of the infinitude of space.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur @264b cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang zhes bya ba snga ma
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur @264b cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang zhes bya ba snga ma
translated: That is said to be the fourth absorption.

original: bzhin no // des na gzugs med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig ni gdon par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin no // des na gzugs med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig ni gdon par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is formless, only the phrase “aspect of form” should be omitted.

original: 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar mdo de nyid brjod nas khyad par ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar mdo de nyid brjod nas khyad par ni 'di yod de /
translated: The sutra is quoted up to “cessation, nirvana,” and the difference is this.

original: de ltar shes shing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes shing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus knowing...

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ...I do not know of any other existence beyond this.🔽Having stated that sutra,

original: mdo de nyid brjod nas /
analyzed: mdo de nyid brjod nas /
translated: it says:

original: rnam par mi 'grol gyi 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar 'gyur gyi 'on kyang de nyid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar
analyzed: rnam par mi 'grol gyi 'on kyang chos la 'dun pa de nyid nas chos la mngon par dga' ba de nyid kyi bar gyis skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar 'gyur gyi 'on kyang de nyid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar
translated: One who is born and attains nirvana through that very aspiration for Dharma up to that very delight in Dharma, and one who is born and does not attain nirvana, but through that very aspiration for Dharma up to that very delight in Dharma attains nirvana without exertion, up to one who is born and does not attain nirvana without exertion, but through that very aspiration for Dharma up to that very delight in Dharma attains nirvana with exertion, and one who is born and does not attain nirvana with exertion, but through that very aspiration for Dharma up to that very delight in Dharma attains nirvana by leaping over.🔽Having stated all that,

original: mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i bar thams cad brjod nas /
analyzed: mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i bar thams cad brjod nas /
translated: it says:

original: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: One who is born and does not attain nirvana by leaping over, but through that very aspiration for Dharma up to that very delight in Dharma attains nirvana by leaping over to the Highest.

original: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du chos la mngon par dga' ba'i bar de nyid kyis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma bzhin du chos la mngon par dga' ba'i bar de nyid kyis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang /
translated: Here, monks, by whatever aspects,

original: rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: by whatever characteristics, by whatever marks, one completely transcends the base of infinite space,🔽thinking “consciousness is infinite,” and abides having fully accomplished the base of infinite consciousness, by those aspects,

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang zhes bya ba mdo bdun po nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang zhes bya ba mdo bdun po nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: the seven sutras should be stated as in the base of infinite space.

original: khyad par ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig yod do //🔽yang 'di na dge slong rnam pa @265a * //
analyzed: khyad par ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig yod do // yang 'di na dge slong rnam pa @265a * //
translated: The difference is that one is born with the same fortune as the gods who go to the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Here, a monk, by means of certain aspects, signs, and indications, completely transcends the sphere of infinite consciousness,🔽thinking “there is nothing at all,” and dwells having accomplished the sphere of nothingness.

original: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang zhes bya ba mdo bdun snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de rnam pa de dag dang zhes bya ba mdo bdun snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Those aspects, those signs, and those indications are the same as in the previous sūtra.

original: gang 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang zhes bya ba nas mtshan ma gang dag gis rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: gang 'di na dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang zhes bya ba nas mtshan ma gang dag gis rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Here, a monk, by means of certain aspects, completely transcends the sphere of nothingness,🔽thinking “there is nothing at all,” and dwells having accomplished the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gong du 'pho ba gcig pu ma gtogs pa mdo thams cad snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //🔽de ltar na bsam gtan bzhis ni 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings la sems gtod pa dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / bar ma do dang / skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gong du 'pho ba gcig pu ma gtogs pa mdo thams cad snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o // de ltar na bsam gtan bzhis ni 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings la sems gtod pa dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / bar ma do dang / skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: “He abides having perfected the base of neither perception nor non-perception.”🔽Thus, the four absorptions explain the ten topics of the meaning of the sutra: the mind is focused on the deathless realm, the mind is liberated, there is the intermediate state, there is birth, there is no formation, there is formation,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'gro ba dang / skye gnas su skye ba'i ngo bo nyid mdo'i don bcu tshan bzhi bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'gro ba dang / skye gnas su skye ba'i ngo bo nyid mdo'i don bcu tshan bzhi bshad pa yin no //
translated: there is complete nirvana, there is transference to a higher level, and there is birth in the birthplace.

original: gzugs med pa dang po gsum gyis ni 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings la sems gtod pa dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang po gsum gyis ni 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings la sems gtod pa dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
translated: liberate the mind, and attain nirvana without application and with application after birth.🔽They also proceed to higher levels and take birth in the birthplace of the highest gods.

original: gong du 'gro ba dang / skye gnas su skye ba nyid mdo'i don bdun tshan gsum mo //
analyzed: gong du 'gro ba dang / skye gnas su skye ba nyid mdo'i don bdun tshan gsum mo //
translated: The third group of seven is the meaning of the sutra.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyis ni gong du 'gro ba ma gtogs pa drug tshan bshad do //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyis ni gong du 'gro ba ma gtogs pa drug tshan bshad do //
translated: The base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment explains six groups, excluding proceeding to higher levels.

original: de'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de'i tshe tshad kyi bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no zhes brjod par bya rung ba ma yin te /🔽sgra mi snyan ma gtogs par 'chi //
analyzed: de'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de'i tshe tshad kyi bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no zhes brjod par bya rung ba ma yin te / sgra mi snyan ma gtogs par 'chi //
translated: Therefore it is not suitable to say that those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state attain nirvana after a certain period of time.🔽Because it is said, They die without exception,

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag na yang bar ma dor 'chi ba srid do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag na yang bar ma dor 'chi ba srid do //
translated: death in the intermediate state is possible in the formless realm.

original: de lta bas na lung las kyang srid pa bar ma grub ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na lung las kyang srid pa bar ma grub ste /
translated: Therefore the intermediate existence is also established from scripture.

original: kyang zhes bya @265b ba'i sgras ni rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya @265b ba'i sgras ni rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word also indicates that it is not only established by reasoning.

original: bdud sun 'byin byed ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi nyan thos mthas mgu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdud sun 'byin byed ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi nyan thos mthas mgu zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Mara who causes remorse is the Mara who, at the time of the Tathagata Kasyapa, was a disciple called Samudrareņu.

original: de'i tshe bdud sum 'byin byed ces bya ba zhig gi glad du khu tshur gyis bsnun pa las des ma rangs pa'i skad byung ba dang skad cig de nyid la rang gi lus kyis sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par lhung ngo zhes bya ba yin
analyzed: de'i tshe bdud sum 'byin byed ces bya ba zhig gi glad du khu tshur gyis bsnun pa las des ma rangs pa'i skad byung ba dang skad cig de nyid la rang gi lus kyis sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par lhung ngo zhes bya ba yin
translated: When he was struck on the head with a fist by a Mara called Parivarjita, he uttered a word of discontent and in that very instant his body fell into the great Avici hell.

original: te / rang gi lus kho nas zhes 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: te / rang gi lus kho nas zhes 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is because the text says, “by his own body alone,” he thought that there is no intermediate existence.

original: de gson po kho nar dmyal ba'i me dag gis zhes bya ba la dgongs pa ni bdud de gson po kho nar dmyal ba las byung ba'i me dag gis bskor nas rang gi lus kyi gnas skabs la sdug bsngal skyes pa'i phyir rang gi lus kho nas lhung
analyzed: de gson po kho nar dmyal ba'i me dag gis zhes bya ba la dgongs pa ni bdud de gson po kho nar dmyal ba las byung ba'i me dag gis bskor nas rang gi lus kyi gnas skabs la sdug bsngal skyes pa'i phyir rang gi lus kho nas lhung
translated: The meaning of the phrase “only while alive, by the fires of the hells” is that only while alive, the māra is surrounded by the fires of the hells and experiences the suffering of his body.

original: ngo zhes bshad kyi shi nas srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs dang dmyal bar skye ba'i srid pa'i gnas su song bar ma gyur pa ni ma yin no snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo zhes bshad kyi shi nas srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs dang dmyal bar skye ba'i srid pa'i gnas su song bar ma gyur pa ni ma yin no snyam pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that he falls by his own body, but not that he does not go to the state of the intermediate existence after death and to the place of rebirth in the hells.

original: las shin tu drag po yongs su rdzogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni zhing dang bsam pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir shin tu drag po rnams so //
analyzed: las shin tu drag po yongs su rdzogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni zhing dang bsam pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir shin tu drag po rnams so //
translated: “Very intense actions that are completed” are very intense because they are associated with a special field and attitude.

original: bsags pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bsags pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa rnams so //
translated: They are completed because they are accumulated.

original: de ma thag tu dmyal ba dag tu skye'o zhes bya ba ni de ma thag ces 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag tu dmyal ba dag tu skye'o zhes bya ba ni de ma thag ces 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: “He is immediately born in the hells” means that because the text says “immediately,” there is no intermediate existence.

original: 'gro ba gzhan du mi 'gro bar zhes bya ba la dgongs pa ni bka' 'di skye ba gzhan dag dgag pa lhur mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan du mi 'gro bar zhes bya ba la dgongs pa ni bka' 'di skye ba gzhan dag dgag pa lhur mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: The intention is that this statement is focused on preventing other births,

original: srid pa bar ma dgag pa lhur mdzad pa ni ma yin no snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dgag pa lhur mdzad pa ni ma yin no snyam pa yin no //
translated: but is not focused on preventing an intermediate existence.

original: lnga kho na zhes bya ba ni gal te sgra ji bzhin du brtags na lnga zhes 'byung bas mtshams med pa lnga kho na byas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: lnga kho na zhes bya ba ni gal te sgra ji bzhin du brtags na lnga zhes 'byung bas mtshams med pa lnga kho na byas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one analyzes the literal meaning of the text, it would say that only five are heinous acts, because it says, “Only five.”

original: gcig gam gnyis kyis ni dmyal bar 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang 'gyur la /🔽gang dag byas shing brtsams nas sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir byas ma thag tu ste mtshams med pa byas ma thag stu sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur gyi dus gzhan gyi bar du @266a * //
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis kyis ni dmyal bar 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang 'gyur la / gang dag byas shing brtsams nas sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir byas ma thag tu ste mtshams med pa byas ma thag stu sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur gyi dus gzhan gyi bar du @266a * //
translated: It would also say that one who commits one or two does not go to hell.🔽And it would say that one is born in hell immediately after committing a heinous act, because it says, “One who commits and initiates such acts is born in hell.”

original: gson por 'dug nas kyang ma yin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gson por 'dug nas kyang ma yin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One is born in hell immediately after committing a heinous act, but not after remaining alive for some time.

original: srid pa bar mar skye ba nyid yin par go su zhig mi 'dod ces bya ba ni gnas skabs tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: srid pa bar mar skye ba nyid yin par go su zhig mi 'dod ces bya ba ni gnas skabs tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it occurs in a different state.

original: skye ba ni skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Birth is directed toward birth.🔽We do not say that it is born.

original: skyes pa yin no zhes ni mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di skyes pa'i don yin no zhes mi smra ste /
analyzed: skyes pa yin no zhes ni mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di skyes pa'i don yin no zhes mi smra ste /
translated: We do not say that the term “will be born” means “is born.”

original: de lta bas na 'di ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.🔽The brahmin has already taken his age to the Lord of Death

original: bram ze na tshod khyer zin rga ba dang / zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gis na tshod 'chi bdag gi drung du khyer ba de ni na tshod khyer zin pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze na tshod khyer zin rga ba dang / zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gis na tshod 'chi bdag gi drung du khyer ba de ni na tshod khyer zin pa'o //
translated: The brahmin has already taken his age to the Lord of Death means that he has already taken his age to the Lord of Death.

original: bram ze zhes bya ba ni bod pa yin te /
analyzed: bram ze zhes bya ba ni bod pa yin te /
translated: The brahmin is a designation.

original: bram ze rgan po 'ga' zhig la bos pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze rgan po 'ga' zhig la bos pa'o //
translated: It refers to an old brahmin.

original: 'dir khungs ni //
analyzed: 'dir khungs ni //
translated: The source for this is

original: bar na khyod kyi gnas kyang yod min zhing //
analyzed: bar na khyod kyi gnas kyang yod min zhing //
translated: You have no abode in between

original: zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: This is the source.

original: bar na khyod kyi gnas med ces bya ba ni srid pa bar ma med pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: bar na khyod kyi gnas med ces bya ba ni srid pa bar ma med pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: “You have no place to stay in between” means that there is no intermediate state.

original: khyod la lam rgyags te lam gyi rgyags kyang ni yod ma yin zhes bya ba ni khyod la 'jig rten pha rol gyi dge ba'i tshogs med do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod la lam rgyags te lam gyi rgyags kyang ni yod ma yin zhes bya ba ni khyod la 'jig rten pha rol gyi dge ba'i tshogs med do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: “You have no provisions for the road” means that you have no accumulation of virtue for the next world.

original: mi dag gi nang na gnas su med do zhes bya ba la dgongs pa ni khyod de'u re 'chi ste /
analyzed: mi dag gi nang na gnas su med do zhes bya ba la dgongs pa ni khyod de'u re 'chi ste /
translated: “You have no place to stay among humans” means that you are about to die.

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig gnas pa ltar mi dag gi nang na gnas su med do snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di na kha cig gnas pa ltar mi dag gi nang na gnas su med do snyam pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that you have no place to stay among humans, as if you were staying here for a while.

original: 'gro ba la bgegs byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba la bgegs byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because there is no obstruction to your going” means that you cannot avoid going.

original: khyod kyis ji skad du srid pa bar ma yod do zhes brjod pa 'di ni dgongs pa yin gyi kho bos ji skad du srid pa bar ma med do zhes brjod pa 'di ni dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gal te gtan tshigs gang gis🔽na 'dir 'gyur /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji skad du srid pa bar ma yod do zhes brjod pa 'di ni dgongs pa yin gyi kho bos ji skad du srid pa bar ma med do zhes brjod pa 'di ni dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gal te gtan tshigs gang gis na 'dir 'gyur /
translated: What is your reason for saying that?

original: brtag pa 'di ni khyod la 'ang mtshungs te zhes bya ba ni dri ba 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtag pa 'di ni khyod la 'ang mtshungs te zhes bya ba ni dri ba 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This examination is also similar for you means that this question is also similar for you.

original: mdo mi 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdud sun 'byin byed kyi mdo la sogs pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir mdo 'di ni srid pa bar ma med pa'i khungs ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo mi 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdud sun 'byin byed kyi mdo la sogs pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir mdo 'di ni srid pa bar ma med pa'i khungs ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not contradict the sutras means that this sutra is not a source for the existence of the intermediate being because it does not contradict the Sutra of Mara's Defeat and so on.

original: khungs zhes bya ba ni shes par byed par gzhan du shes @266b par mi byed pha yin no zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa gang la gzhan du shes par byed pa med pa de ni shes par byed pa gzhan du shes par mi byed pa yin🔽te / 'di skad du don gang zhig bstan pa'i phyir khungs mdo 'am tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa gang yin pa gal te don de kho na ston gyi de dang 'gal ba don gzhan ma yin na de shes par byed pa gzhan du shes par mi byed pa'i khungs
analyzed: khungs zhes bya ba ni shes par byed par gzhan du shes @266b par mi byed pha yin no zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa gang la gzhan du shes par byed pa med pa de ni shes par byed pa gzhan du shes par mi byed pa yin te / 'di skad du don gang zhig bstan pa'i phyir khungs mdo 'am tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa gang yin pa gal te don de kho na ston gyi de dang 'gal ba don gzhan ma yin na de shes par byed pa gzhan du shes par mi byed pa'i khungs
translated: That which causes understanding is a source that does not cause understanding elsewhere.

original: yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in this way: If a sutra or verse is recited in order to teach a meaning, and if it teaches just that meaning and not another meaning that contradicts it, then it is a source that causes understanding, not that which causes understanding elsewhere.

original: sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can /🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having the appearance of existence in the past

original: 'byung zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The term “appearance” means that which appears.

original: 'di ya sngon gyi dus na srid pa'i sha tshugs lta bu yod pas na /
analyzed: 'di ya sngon gyi dus na srid pa'i sha tshugs lta bu yod pas na /
translated: This is stated in this way: This person existed in the past, having the appearance of existence.

original: sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can no //
analyzed: sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can no //
translated: Therefore, he is one who has the appearance of existence in the past.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir te 'di ltar 'gro ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / der phyin par byed pa srid pa bar ma ni las gcig po de kho nas 'phen par byed ngo //
analyzed: 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir te 'di ltar 'gro ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / der phyin par byed pa srid pa bar ma ni las gcig po de kho nas 'phen par byed ngo //
translated: The intermediate existence that causes one to go to a realm and the intermediate existence that causes one to go to a destination are projected by the same action.

original: khyi mo la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni khyi mo dang / phag mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyi mo la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni khyi mo dang / phag mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: Dogs and so on refers to dogs, pigs, and so on.

original: 'gro ba lnga ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The five types of migration refers to the five types of migration.

original: gal te mngal na 'dug pa las shi bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mngal na 'dug pa las shi bar gyur na /
translated: If one dies while in the womb,🔽the intermediate existence of a hell being will burn the mother’s womb.

original: de'i dmyal ba'i srid pa bar mas ma'i mngal tshig par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba pa ni 'bar ba yin la srid pa bar ma 'ang de dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: de'i dmyal ba'i srid pa bar mas ma'i mngal tshig par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba pa ni 'bar ba yin la srid pa bar ma 'ang de dang 'dra bas so //
translated: The intermediate existence of a hell being is similar to a hell being because it is ablaze.

original: srid pa snga ma la'ang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmyal ba pa dus snga ma'i srid pa'i gnas skabs pa rnams kyang me ma mur la sogs pa lhag pa dag na 'phyan pa na /
analyzed: srid pa snga ma la'ang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmyal ba pa dus snga ma'i srid pa'i gnas skabs pa rnams kyang me ma mur la sogs pa lhag pa dag na 'phyan pa na /
translated: Also, those in the prior existence refers to those in the prior existence of a hell being who wander in the hells of Reviving, and so on, and in the additional hells such as the Hell of Burning Embers.

original: rtag tu 'bar ba ma yin na srid pa bar ma rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rtag tu 'bar ba ma yin na srid pa bar ma rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If it is not always burning, then what need is there to mention the intermediate existences?

original: yang na 'bar du chug na yang zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba ba'i srid pa bar ma'o //
analyzed: yang na 'bar du chug na yang zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba ba'i srid pa bar ma'o //
translated: Or, even if it were to burn,

original: mngal na phan tshun ma reg pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma pa rnams ni lus shin tu dang bas phan tshun mi reg pa'i phyir dang / las la rag lus pa'i phyir mi tshig ste /
analyzed: mngal na phan tshun ma reg pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma pa rnams ni lus shin tu dang bas phan tshun mi reg pa'i phyir dang / las la rag lus pa'i phyir mi tshig ste /
translated: because the intermediate existences of hell beings do not touch each other in the womb, they do not burn, because their bodies are extremely subtle and do not touch each other, and because they depend on karma.

original: mi tshig pa ni de dag gi las la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi tshig pa ni de dag gi las la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not burn because they depend on their karma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyi mo la sogs pa'i mngal mi tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyi mo la sogs pa'i mngal mi tshig go //
translated: For that very reason, the wombs of bitches and so on do not burn.

original: gling bzhi pa bye ba phrag brgya snang bar mdzad do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub @267a * //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa bye ba phrag brgya snang bar mdzad do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub @267a * //
translated: It illuminates a billion four-continent worlds.

original: sems dpa'i srid pa bar ma gzhon nu thor bu lta bu mtshan dang dpe byad dang bcas pa yin pa de'i phyir srid pa bar ma na bzhugs pa yum gyi lhums su 'jug par bzhed pa des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rang gi
analyzed: sems dpa'i srid pa bar ma gzhon nu thor bu lta bu mtshan dang dpe byad dang bcas pa yin pa de'i phyir srid pa bar ma na bzhugs pa yum gyi lhums su 'jug par bzhed pa des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rang gi
translated: Therefore, the one who, while dwelling in the intermediate existence, wishes to enter the womb of his mother, illuminates the trichiliocosm with his radiance,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yin pa'i phyir snang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yin pa'i phyir snang bar mdzad do //
translated: because that is his Buddha-field.

original: glang po che'i phru gu dkar po zhes bya ba ni gal te srid pa bar ma dus snga ma'i srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sha tshugs can yin no //
analyzed: glang po che'i phru gu dkar po zhes bya ba ni gal te srid pa bar ma dus snga ma'i srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sha tshugs can yin no //
translated: The white baby elephant is the form of the intermediate existence that will arise in the previous existence.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i yum gyis de ltar glang po che'i phru gu'i gzugs su gzigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i yum gyis de ltar glang po che'i phru gu'i gzugs su gzigs she na /
translated: Why does the Bodhisattva's mother see the form of a baby elephant in that way?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas bzlog nas yun ring po lon pa'i phyir de ni mtshan ma tsam du zad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas bzlog nas yun ring po lon pa'i phyir de ni mtshan ma tsam du zad de /
translated: Because the Bodhisattva has long since turned away from the animal realm, that is merely a sign.

original: bskal pa brgya lus pa gang tshun cad mtshan gyi rnam par smin pa can gyi las dag mdzad par rtsom pa de tshun cad de'i ngan 'gro thams cad log pa yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya lus pa gang tshun cad mtshan gyi rnam par smin pa can gyi las dag mdzad par rtsom pa de tshun cad de'i ngan 'gro thams cad log pa yin no //
translated: From that time on, he will have no more unfortunate rebirths.

original: dper na rgyal po kri k'is rmi lam bcu mthong ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyi mtshan ma tsam du zad pa'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po kri k'is rmi lam bcu mthong ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyi mtshan ma tsam du zad pa'o //
translated: For example, King Kṛkī had ten dreams, which were only the signs of future events.

original: rmi lam bcu ni 'dul ba las 'byung ste /
analyzed: rmi lam bcu ni 'dul ba las 'byung ste /
translated: The ten dreams are found in the Vinaya:🔽an elephant coming through a window and getting stuck;

original: glang po che skar khung nas 'byung ba mjug ma la thogs pa dang / skom pa med pa la khron pa phyi bzhin bsnyegs pa dang / mu tig bre gang /
analyzed: glang po che skar khung nas 'byung ba mjug ma la thogs pa dang / skom pa med pa la khron pa phyi bzhin bsnyegs pa dang / mu tig bre gang /
translated: a thirsty man being chased by a well;🔽exchanging a measure of pearls for a measure of flour;🔽sandalwood being valued at the price of wood;

original: phye bre gang dang brje ba dang / tsan dan shing gi rin thang du 'tshang pa dang / kun dga'i ra ba me tog dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dag me tog dang 'bras bu thams cad rkun bo rnams kyis brkus pa dang /
analyzed: phye bre gang dang brje ba dang / tsan dan shing gi rin thang du 'tshang pa dang / kun dga'i ra ba me tog dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dag me tog dang 'bras bu thams cad rkun bo rnams kyis brkus pa dang /
translated: a pleasure grove with abundant flowers and fruits, all the flowers and fruits being stolen by thieves;

original: glang po che'i phru gu dag gis sbos kyi glang po che skrag pa dang / spre'u mi gtsang bas spags pa gzhan dag la bsgo bar byed pa dang / spre'u dbang bskur bar byed pa dang / ras yug gcig skye bo bco brgyad kyis drangs pa dang /🔽skye bo'i tshogs phal po che'i lhan cig 'thab pa dang / 'thab mo dang rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pas phan tshun gnod par gyur ba zhes bya ba rmi lam bcu rmis nas /
analyzed: glang po che'i phru gu dag gis sbos kyi glang po che skrag pa dang / spre'u mi gtsang bas spags pa gzhan dag la bsgo bar byed pa dang / spre'u dbang bskur bar byed pa dang / ras yug gcig skye bo bco brgyad kyis drangs pa dang / skye bo'i tshogs phal po che'i lhan cig 'thab pa dang / 'thab mo dang rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pas phan tshun gnod par gyur ba zhes bya ba rmi lam bcu rmis nas /
translated: eighteen people pull on a single cloth,🔽and a great crowd of people fight, quarrel, argue, and mutually harm each other.🔽Having had these ten dreams, he asked the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Kāśyapa,

original: des bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs la gsol ba dang / @267b bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus /
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs la gsol ba dang / @267b bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus /
translated: and the Blessed One said, 'In the future,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: a Tathāgata named Śākyamuni will appear.

original: de'i nyan thos rnams nye du phal mo che spangs nas rab tu byung ba glang po che skar khung nas 'byung ba mjug ma la thogs pa lta bur gtsug lag khang dag la khyim gyi 'du shes skyed nas chags par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i nyan thos rnams nye du phal mo che spangs nas rab tu byung ba glang po che skar khung nas 'byung ba mjug ma la thogs pa lta bur gtsug lag khang dag la khyim gyi 'du shes skyed nas chags par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: His śrāvakas, having abandoned most of their relatives, will go forth, and they will develop a sense of home toward the monasteries, like elephants who come out of a stable and are tethered by the tail.

original: khron pa'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na bram ze dang khyim pa rnams la ched du chos 'chad dang de dag nyan par 'dod pa nyid yang dag par gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
analyzed: khron pa'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na bram ze dang khyim pa rnams la ched du chos 'chad dang de dag nyan par 'dod pa nyid yang dag par gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
translated: The dream of the well shows that his śrāvakas will not be able to teach the Dharma to brahmans and householders, and they will not want to listen.

original: phye dang mu tig bre gang gi rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na phye bslang ba'i phyir yang dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa chos rin po che rnams ston par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: phye dang mu tig bre gang gi rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na phye bslang ba'i phyir yang dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa chos rin po che rnams ston par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The dream of the measure of sesame seeds and pearls shows that his śrāvakas will teach the precious Dharma of the faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and so on, even for the sake of a handful of sesame seeds.

original: tsan dan gyi rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na lus dang tshul khrims dang shes rab ma bsgoms pas mu stegs kyi gzhung lugs dag bzung nas /
analyzed: tsan dan gyi rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na lus dang tshul khrims dang shes rab ma bsgoms pas mu stegs kyi gzhung lugs dag bzung nas /
translated: The dream of sandalwood indicates that his śrāvakas will not cultivate body, morality, and wisdom and will instead adopt the treatises of the tīrthikas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang snyoms par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston to //🔽kun dga'i ra ba'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na dpag btsal nas dge 'dun gyi me tog gam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang snyoms par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston to // kun dga'i ra ba'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na dpag btsal nas dge 'dun gyi me tog gam /
translated: The dream of the sandalwood indicates that his śrāvakas will not cultivate body, morality, and wisdom, and will take up the treatises of the tīrthikas.

original: 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de btsongs shing btsongs nas 'tsho bar byed la des kyang khyim pa gso bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de btsongs shing btsongs nas 'tsho bar byed la des kyang khyim pa gso bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
translated: The dream of the pleasure grove indicates that his śrāvakas will speculate about the future, and will sell the flowers and fruits of the saṃgha.

original: glang po che'i phru gu'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na tshul khrims 'chal cing sdig pa'i chos can 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: glang po che'i phru gu'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na tshul khrims 'chal cing sdig pa'i chos can 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: The dream of the elephant calf indicates that his śrāvakas will be immoral and will engage in evil dharmas.

original: de dag gis dge slong gnas brtan tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can gang dag yin pa de dag gnas nas skrod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
analyzed: de dag gis dge slong gnas brtan tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can gang dag yin pa de dag gnas nas skrod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
translated: This shows that they will expel the elder monks who are virtuous and have moral discipline.

original: spre'u mi gtsang bas spags pa'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i tshe nyan thos dag kho na tshul khrims 'chal zhing sdig pa'i chos can yin la dge slong dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i nyes pas gleng bar byed do zhes🔽bya ba de ston to //
analyzed: spre'u mi gtsang bas spags pa'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i tshe nyan thos dag kho na tshul khrims 'chal zhing sdig pa'i chos can yin la dge slong dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i nyes pas gleng bar byed do zhes bya ba de ston to //
translated: The dream of the monkey smeared with filth shows that at that time the disciples will be immoral and have bad qualities, and that they will falsely accuse the virtuous monks.🔽This shows that the disciples will anoint themselves in the monasteries

original: spre'u dbang bskur ba'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na gtsug lag khang dag tu bdag nyid kyi yin par dbang skur @268a * //🔽bar byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: spre'u dbang bskur ba'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na gtsug lag khang dag tu bdag nyid kyi yin par dbang skur @268a * // bar byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: as if they were kings.

original: 'jig rten na yang ma ni nga yang rgyal srid 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang ma ni nga yang rgyal srid 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
translated: And in the world they will say, “I am a king.”

original: ras yug gi rmi lam gyis ni de'i bstan pa kho na rnam pa bco brgyad du gyes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ras yug gi rmi lam gyis ni de'i bstan pa kho na rnam pa bco brgyad du gyes par 'gyur la /
translated: The dream of the cloth shows that his doctrine will be divided into eighteen sects.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ras yug ni nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //🔽thab mo'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na sder 'chas nas phan tshun to zhes grag go //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ras yug ni nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to // thab mo'i rmi lam gyis ni de'i nyan thos dag kho na sder 'chas nas phan tshun to zhes grag go //
translated: The dream of the cloth of liberation shows that the cloth will not be damaged.

original: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /🔽glang chen to zhes grag go //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni / glang chen to zhes grag go //
translated: The dream of the dispute shows that his disciples will be divided into factions and will quarrel among themselves.

original: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: The summary verse:

original: glang chen khron pa phye dang tsan dan glang chen be'u //
analyzed: glang chen khron pa phye dang tsan dan glang chen be'u //
translated: Elephants, a well, wheat, sandalwood, an elephant, a calf,

original: de bzhin kun dga' rab dang ni spre'u dbang bskur //
analyzed: de bzhin kun dga' rab dang ni spre'u dbang bskur //
translated: Ānanda, the consecration of a monkey,

original: mi gtsang spre'u dang ras yug thab mo zhes bya ba /

original: 'byung ba gzhan kho na zhig ces bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag las ma gtogs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba gzhan kho na zhig ces bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag las ma gtogs pa dag go //
translated: “Another element” means an element other than semen and blood.

original: sa bon dang myu gu 'gag pa dang / skye ba'i tshul du ste /
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu 'gag pa dang / skye ba'i tshul du ste /
translated: In the manner that a seed ceases and a sprout arises,

original: 'jig pa dang 'gag pa dag gi srang mda'i mtho dman bzhin du dus mnyam pa'i phyir skad cig ma gcig kho na la sa bon ni 'gag la myu gu ni skye'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang 'gag pa dag gi srang mda'i mtho dman bzhin du dus mnyam pa'i phyir skad cig ma gcig kho na la sa bon ni 'gag la myu gu ni skye'o //
translated: because destruction and arising are simultaneous, like the rising and falling of a scale’s beam, the seed ceases and the sprout arises in a single moment.

original: nur nur po zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni dang por nur nur po yin no //
analyzed: nur nur po zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni dang por nur nur po yin no //
translated: The embryo that is called kalala is the first.

original: nur nur po las mer mer skye //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nur nur po las mer mer skye // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: From kalala arises arbuda,🔽and so on.

original: de ltar bshad na mdo'i tshig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na mdo'i tshig ces bya ba ni /
translated: If this is explained in this way, the words of the sutra are acceptable.

original: dge slong grog mkhar zhes bya ba ni lus gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi pa 'bras chan dang // zan dron gyis gsos pa pha ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las byung ba 'di'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong grog mkhar zhes bya ba ni lus gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi pa 'bras chan dang // zan dron gyis gsos pa pha ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las byung ba 'di'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The monk Antahpura means the coarse body that is composed of the four great elements, nourished by boiled rice and barley cakes, and designated as this, which arises from the parents’ impure substances.

original: pha ma'i mi gtsang ba nyid nur nur po yin la /
analyzed: pha ma'i mi gtsang ba nyid nur nur po yin la /
translated: The parents’ impure substances are the kalala.

original: de las byung ba'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It arises from that.

original: dur khrod ces bya ba ni dur gyi khrod do //
analyzed: dur khrod ces bya ba ni dur gyi khrod do //
translated: Cemetery means a place where corpses are discarded.

original: dper brjod pa ni khrag gi thigs pa blangs so zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: dper brjod pa ni khrag gi thigs pa blangs so zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The example is “I took a drop of blood,”

original: lus kyi dbang po'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it becomes the nature of the body faculty.

original: dper na lo ma'i srin bu lta bu'i yin la zhes bya ba ni dper na las rnams las ; lo ma'i 'byung ba chen po dag la brten nas lo ma'i drin bu 'byung ba gzhan dbang po'i ngo bor gyur pa gnag dag yin pa skye bar 'gyur ba
analyzed: dper na lo ma'i srin bu lta bu'i yin la zhes bya ba ni dper na las rnams las ; lo ma'i 'byung ba chen po dag la brten nas lo ma'i drin bu 'byung ba gzhan dbang po'i ngo bor gyur pa gnag dag yin pa skye bar 'gyur ba
translated: From actions, other elements arise in dependence on the great elements of the leaf, and other worms arise that are of the nature of the sense faculties.

original: lta bu'o // lo ma'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lta bu'o // lo ma'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni ma yin te /
translated: But the great elements of the leaf are not the cause of the worms,

original: de'i srin bu rnams phal ches pas lo ma dum pu dang mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i srin bu rnams phal ches pas lo ma dum pu dang mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the worms are mostly found in the decaying parts of the leaf and not in the undamaged parts.

original: 'o na pha ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las byung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na pha ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las byung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: But how do you interpret the sutra that states, “The kalala arises from the impurity of the parents”?

original: de'i phyir mi gtsang ba la brten nas skye ba la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir mdo dang yang mi @270b 'gal lo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi gtsang ba la brten nas skye ba la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir mdo dang yang mi @270b 'gal lo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond, he says, “There is no contradiction with the sutra because it is stated intending that the kalala arises in dependence on impurity.”

original: der ni mi gtsang ba la brten nas 'byung ba gzhan dag skye ba la dgongs shing bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: der ni mi gtsang ba la brten nas 'byung ba gzhan dag skye ba la dgongs shing bzhed pa yin no //
translated: There, the Bhagavān intended and accepted that other elements arise in dependence on impurity.

original: de'i phyir nur nur po zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nur nur po zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is called kalala.🔽Thus, it does not contradict the sutra that states:

original: de lta bas pha ma'i mi gtsang ba'i nur nur po las byung bas zhes bya ba'i mdo dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta bas pha ma'i mi gtsang ba'i nur nur po las byung bas zhes bya ba'i mdo dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: The kalala arises from the parents' impure substances.🔽Just as worms arise in leaves,🔽so the other elements arise in the semen and blood.

original: ji skad du ji ltar lo ma la brten nas srin bu'i 'byung ba chen po dbang po dang bcas pa lo ma dang dus mnyam pa dag skye ba ltar khu chu dang khrag la brten nas nur nur po zhes bya ba la 'byung ba gzhan dbang po dang🔽bcas pa khu chu dang khrag dang dus mnyam pa dag skye'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du ji ltar lo ma la brten nas srin bu'i 'byung ba chen po dbang po dang bcas pa lo ma dang dus mnyam pa dag skye ba ltar khu chu dang khrag la brten nas nur nur po zhes bya ba la 'byung ba gzhan dbang po dang bcas pa khu chu dang khrag dang dus mnyam pa dag skye'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The other elements arise in the semen and blood, simultaneously with the semen and blood, and they possess faculties.

original: gzhan la ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i slob dpon dag na re drod gsher las skyes pa dang rdzus te skyes pa'i skye gnas dag la ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i slob dpon dag na re drod gsher las skyes pa dang rdzus te skyes pa'i skye gnas dag la ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The Abhidharma masters say: The other two birth processes, birth from heat and moisture and spontaneous birth, should be explained as appropriate.

original: de la rigs pa ni 'di yin par snang ngo zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rigs pa ni 'di yin par snang ngo zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the reasoning that appears to the master.

original: dmyal ba pa dag na bsil ba mthong nas zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i dmyal bar skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba pa dag na bsil ba mthong nas zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i dmyal bar skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Seeing the cool in the hells means that they are born in the cold hells.

original: gnas skabs gang yis zhes bya ba ni shan pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang yis zhes bya ba ni shan pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: By what state means by the state of a butcher, etc.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i slob dpon thogs med la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i slob dpon thogs med la sogs pa'o //
translated: The former masters are the Yogācāra masters such as Asaṅga.

original: stan las ldang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas gong mar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stan las ldang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas gong mar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Like rising from a seat means that they go to a higher place of birth.

original: mi la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dgas ji ltar 'gro ba de dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dgas ji ltar 'gro ba de dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: Like humans, etc. means like the way humans, animals, and ghosts go.

original: drang srong rnams la skur 'debs pa //🔽zhes bya ba ni kha zer ba ste /
analyzed: drang srong rnams la skur 'debs pa // zhes bya ba ni kha zer ba ste /
translated: They slander the ṛṣis.🔽This means they speak ill of them.

original: skur pa 'debs par byed pa zhes bya ba tha tshig go //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs par byed pa zhes bya ba tha tshig go //
translated: It means they slander them.

original: sgo nga las skye rtag tu'o //
analyzed: sgo nga las skye rtag tu'o //
translated: Always for the egg-born.

original: zhes bya ba smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says, “the first is the most obscured.”

original: gzhan ni thams cad rmongs zhes bya ba 'dir ni nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni thams cad rmongs zhes bya ba 'dir ni nges pa med pa ste /
translated: The others are not certain,

original: shes bzhin yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are also conscious.🔽The Sūtra teaches the opposite order,🔽that is, the first is the most obscured.🔽The Sūtra teaches the opposite order of the other three, because it says, “The first is the most obscured.”🔽The Sūtra says that the first is the most obscured, because it is the most obscured with respect to entering the womb.🔽The Sūtra says that the second is the most obscured with respect to remaining in the womb.🔽The Sūtra says that the third is the most obscured with respect to leaving the womb.

original: bzlog ste bstan to zhes bya ba mdo las ni mngal du 'jug pa thams cad shes bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang por bshad de gsum ni ji skad bstan pa'i go rims bzhin kho na yin no //🔽gang zhig skye bar 'gyur bde yang sgo nga @271a * //🔽las skyes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgo nga las skye bar 'gyur ba ni sgo nga las skyes pa'o zhes bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
