analyzed: bzlog ste bstan to zhes bya ba mdo las ni mngal du 'jug pa thams cad shes bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang por bshad de gsum ni ji skad bstan pa'i go rims bzhin kho na yin no // gang zhig skye bar 'gyur bde yang sgo nga @271a * // las skyes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgo nga las skye bar 'gyur ba ni sgo nga las skyes pa'o zhes bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The Sūtra says that the fourth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the fifth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the sixth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the seventh is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the eighth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the ninth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the tenth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the eleventh is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the twelfth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the thirteenth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don kyang byung zin pa dang 'dra bar brjod de /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don kyang byung zin pa dang 'dra bar brjod de /
translated: The Sūtra says that the fourteenth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the fifteenth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the sixteenth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the seventeenth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.🔽The Sūtra says that the eighteenth is the most obscured with respect to the mode of birth.

original: dper na da ltar dang nye ba la da lta dang 'dra ba'am zhes bya ba dang / legs su smon pa las byung bar gyur pa dang / 'dra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na da ltar dang nye ba la da lta dang 'dra ba'am zhes bya ba dang / legs su smon pa las byung bar gyur pa dang / 'dra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: the one who is well-wishing is the one who has come from well-wishing;🔽the one who is similar is the one who has come from the similar.

original: smra ba po kha cig ni 'ga' zhig la 'ong bzhin du nga 'ongs zin par shes par gyis shig ces kyang zer te /
analyzed: smra ba po kha cig ni 'ga' zhig la 'ong bzhin du nga 'ongs zin par shes par gyis shig ces kyang zer te /
translated: Some speakers say to someone who is coming, “I have come, understand!”

original: de lta bas na 'di ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault here.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re gzhan dag las kyang mthong ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir sgo nga las skyes pa dang / skye par 'gyur ba dang / skye ba yang sgo nga las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re gzhan dag las kyang mthong ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir sgo nga las skyes pa dang / skye par 'gyur ba dang / skye ba yang sgo nga las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Master Saṅghabhadra says that since it is said that one sees in other scriptures as well, one born from an egg and one who will be born are called “one born from an egg.”

original: de lta bas na 'di ni nyes pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni nyes pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault here.

original: yang na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis kyang ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis kyang ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Or, it is said that the name of the future is used, that is, the name of the future is used to teach.

original: dper na mdo las /
analyzed: dper na mdo las /
translated: For example, a sūtra says:

original: 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Conditioned states form.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas ni bskyed zin pa'i gnas skabs na yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas ni bskyed zin pa'i gnas skabs na yin gyi /
translated: That is, conditioned states exist in the state of having already been generated,

original: skyed pa'i gnas skabs na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed pa'i gnas skabs na ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the state of being generated.

original: 'dus byas ni yang 'du bya bar rung ba ma yin yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis de ltar ston par yang byed do //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni yang 'du bya bar rung ba ma yin yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis de ltar ston par yang byed do //
translated: Although conditioned states are not suitable to be generated again, the name “that which will arise” is applied to them.

original: de bzhin du 'bras chan 'tshed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras chan 'tshed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to such statements as “Cook the rice.”🔽How does one enter the mother’s womb without being conscious?

original: ji ltar na shes bzhin du ma yin par ma'i mngal du 'jug cing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes bzhin du ma yin par ma'i mngal du 'jug cing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The text states:

original: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas //
analyzed: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas //
translated: Because the mind is distorted,

original: rtse dags 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro //
analyzed: rtse dags 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro //
translated: one goes to the place of birth through desire for sex.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i yul nye ba'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i yul nye ba'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: This is the proximate state of the object of birth.

original: de bzhin du gnas so 'byung ngo snyam du mos shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas so 'byung ngo snyam du mos shing /
translated: Similarly, one has the aspiration “I will stay there”

original: lhag par 'dod pa ni ring ba'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: lhag par 'dod pa ni ring ba'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: and the excessive desire is the distant state.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de bzhin du gnas na'ang 'di dag tu gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas na'ang 'di dag tu gnas par bya'o //
translated: “I will stay there” is the proximate state.🔽“I will stay there in that way” is the distant state.

original: 'byung na yang 'di dag nas 'byung ngo snyam pa yin te phyin ci log 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni de yod do //
analyzed: 'byung na yang 'di dag nas 'byung ngo snyam pa yin te phyin ci log 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni de yod do //
translated: But when they do occur, they occur in these ways.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug @271b dag kho nas blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa skyes pa'i yul du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug @271b dag kho nas blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa skyes pa'i yul du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: Others say: The mind is mistaken due to attachment, hatred, and delusion, not only in regard to the object that is the place of birth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan du'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du'ang ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not otherwise.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rlungs langs pa'am /
analyzed: rlungs langs pa'am /
translated: It is like the wind blowing,

original: char pa 'bab pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du kun dga'i ra ba'am skyed mos tshal lam khang bzangs su 'jug pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / shes bzhin pa ni mngal du 'jug go snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: char pa 'bab pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du kun dga'i ra ba'am skyed mos tshal lam khang bzangs su 'jug pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / shes bzhin pa ni mngal du 'jug go snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: rain falling, and so on, and like entering a pleasure grove, a park, a palace, and so on, and like entering the womb with full awareness, knowing exactly what is happening.

original: gal te yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes na ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kho nas nying mtshams sbyor bar byed par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes na ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kho nas nying mtshams sbyor bar byed par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If one knows reality as it is, how can one posit that the mind enters the womb by means of a defiled mind alone?

original: ma la sred pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir sems nyon mongs pa can nyid yin no zhes zer ro //🔽gzhan dag na re mngal du 'jug pa la 'di snyam du rlung langs pa'am zhes bya ba nas shing drung ngam rtsig pa'i drung du 'gro'o zhes bya ba dang / gnas na yang 'di dag tu gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la sred pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir sems nyon mongs pa can nyid yin no zhes zer ro // gzhan dag na re mngal du 'jug pa la 'di snyam du rlung langs pa'am zhes bya ba nas shing drung ngam rtsig pa'i drung du 'gro'o zhes bya ba dang / gnas na yang 'di dag tu gnas par bya'o //
translated: Because it is not free from craving for the mother, the mind is defiled.🔽Others say: When entering the womb, the mind has wrong ideation and resolve, thinking, I will go to the foot of a tree or the foot of a wall, and when staying, I will stay there.

original: 'byung na'ang 'di dag nas 'byung ngo snyam pa la sogs pa log pa'i 'du shes dang / mos pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni skyes ma thag pa'i gnas skabs na 'byung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung na'ang 'di dag nas 'byung ngo snyam pa la sogs pa log pa'i 'du shes dang / mos pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni skyes ma thag pa'i gnas skabs na 'byung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: When emerging, I will emerge from there. This occurs in the state of the moment of birth.

original: de las 'khor los sgyur ba ni dang po ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'khor los sgyur ba ni dang po yin te /🔽gcig ni shes bzhin du 'jug go zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de las 'khor los sgyur ba ni dang po ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'khor los sgyur ba ni dang po yin te / gcig ni shes bzhin du 'jug go zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The first is a universal monarch,

original: gnyis pa ni rang sangs rgyas yin te gzhan ni gnas pa yang zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rang sangs rgyas yin te gzhan ni gnas pa yang zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the second is a pratyekabuddha,

original: gsum pa ni sangs rgyas yin te /🔽gzhan ni 'byung ba'ang zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sangs rgyas yin te / gzhan ni 'byung ba'ang zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: and the third is a buddha.

original: 'dir yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'di dag 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'di dag 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the term “will occur” is used figuratively, because at that time they are not universal monarchs, etc.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni rnam grangs su bshad par zad kyi don ni de dag kho nar zad da snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni rnam grangs su bshad par zad kyi don ni de dag kho nar zad da snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The term “such” refers to the fact that these are merely alternative explanations, but the meaning is the same.

original: brdar btags pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa nyid du rnam par @272a * //
analyzed: brdar btags pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa nyid du rnam par @272a * //
translated: The term “conventional” means that they are related as cause and effect.

original: gzhag pa'o // nyon mongs las kyis mngon du byas //
analyzed: gzhag pa'o // nyon mongs las kyis mngon du byas //
translated: and the state of being placed.🔽By the afflictions and karma, it is made manifest.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyis bsgos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyis bsgos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is imbued with the afflictions and karma.🔽Like a lamp, it is momentary.

original: mar me bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyi tshul gyis 'pho ba'i phung po lnga skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir mar me dang 'dra'o zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: mar me bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyi tshul gyis 'pho ba'i phung po lnga skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir mar me dang 'dra'o zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the five aggregates that are transferred in the manner of a continuum are momentary, because they are like a lamp.

original: ji ltar 'phangs bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phangs bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: As projected.

original: 'phangs pa ni dus re zhig gi rgyun yin te /
analyzed: 'phangs pa ni dus re zhig gi rgyun yin te /
translated: The projection is the continuum for a certain time.

original: 'di ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the difference.

original: tshe'i ste tsher 'gyur pa'i las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe'i ste tsher 'gyur pa'i las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the karma that produces life is different.

original: mtshan rnams rim gyis skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan rnams rim gyis skye bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sex organs are the last to develop.🔽The sex organs are the last to develop.

original: mtshan ni mig la sogs pa'i rten te /
analyzed: mtshan ni mig la sogs pa'i rten te /
translated: The sex organs are the bases of the eyes, etc.

original: de dag gis mig la sogs pa gsal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de dag gis mig la sogs pa gsal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because the eyes, etc., are made manifest by them.

original: rkyag dong lta bu zhes bya ba dang / lus kyi rma 'khyims pa chen po der zhes bya ba ni rma 'khyims pa dang 'dra bas rma 'khyims pa'o zhes smad pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: rkyag dong lta bu zhes bya ba dang / lus kyi rma 'khyims pa chen po der zhes bya ba ni rma 'khyims pa dang 'dra bas rma 'khyims pa'o zhes smad pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: It is like a cesspool, a great festering wound. It is a festering wound because it is like a wound.

original: dri nga ba mi bzad pa ni mi bzad par dri nga ba'o //
analyzed: dri nga ba mi bzad pa ni mi bzad par dri nga ba'o //
translated: It is a terrible stench, a stench that is unbearable.

original: 'di ni mun khung yang yin te snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mun khung yang yin te snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a darkness, because it is devoid of light.

original: 'di ni 'dam rdzab dang 'dra ba'i btsog pa rnams kyis 'dam rdzab kyang yin te der ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dam rdzab dang 'dra ba'i btsog pa rnams kyis 'dam rdzab kyang yin te der ro //
translated: It is a swamp, because it is a swamp of filth that resembles a swamp.

original: rtag tu byi dor bya dgos pa ni rtag tu gtsang sbra bya dgos pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu byi dor bya dgos pa ni rtag tu gtsang sbra bya dgos pa'o //
translated: It is always to be cleaned, because it must always be kept clean.

original: pho'i khu chu dang mo'i khrag dang gsher ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi chu ser dang / dri mas kun du myags shing kun nas myags pa rnam par myags shing khyad par du myags pa rul zhing rnags pa 'dred pa der lag pa bcug ste lag pa dang /
analyzed: pho'i khu chu dang mo'i khrag dang gsher ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi chu ser dang / dri mas kun du myags shing kun nas myags pa rnam par myags shing khyad par du myags pa rul zhing rnags pa 'dred pa der lag pa bcug ste lag pa dang /
translated: It is filled with the male semen, the female blood, and the special watery essence of the embryo, which are rotten, festering, putrid, and foul-smelling.

original: rkang pa la sogs pa'i yan lag dang nying lag bcad cing gtubs nas /
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa'i yan lag dang nying lag bcad cing gtubs nas /
translated: The limbs and minor limbs, such as the feet, are cut and severed.

original: 'byin par byed 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: 'byin par byed 'dren par byed do //
translated: They are extracted and pulled out.

original: rma gsar pa lta bu ni na ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rma gsar pa lta bu ni na ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Like a fresh wound, it is painful.

original: rma gsar pa'i bdag nyid dang 'dra bas na rma gsar pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rma gsar pa'i bdag nyid dang 'dra bas na rma gsar pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a fresh wound, thus it is like a fresh wound.

original: 'di la rma gsar pa dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid yod pas na rma gsar pa lta bu can gyi byis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rma gsar pa dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid yod pas na rma gsar pa lta bu can gyi byis pa yin no //
translated: Since it has the nature of a fresh wound, it is a child with the nature of a fresh wound.

original: mtshon dang thal ba'i sman te de dag gi bdag nyid lta bur 'dug pa ni mtshon dang thal ba'i sman lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshon dang thal ba'i sman te de dag gi bdag nyid lta bur 'dug pa ni mtshon dang thal ba'i sman lta bu'o //
translated: Like a knife and a caustic salve, they exist in the nature of those two.

original: 'di dag la mtshon dang thal ba'i sman lta bu'i @272b reg pa yod pas na mtshon dang thal ba'i sman lta bu'i reg pa dang ldan pa'i lag pa dag yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag la mtshon dang thal ba'i sman lta bu'i @272b reg pa yod pas na mtshon dang thal ba'i sman lta bu'i reg pa dang ldan pa'i lag pa dag yin te /
translated: Since they have the contact of a knife and a caustic salve, they are hands with the contact of a knife and a caustic salve.

original: de gnyis kyis blangs nas 'khru bar byed do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis blangs nas 'khru bar byed do //
translated: Having taken them up with those two, they wash.

original: skye ba'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro bas so //
translated: The cause of birth is by way of following.

original: de'i rgyu med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rgyu med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rgyu med pa nyid du'o //
translated: The phrase “without a cause” means without a primary cause.

original: 'di rgyu med pa nyid gcig yin na ni de dang 'dra bas thams cad kyang rgyu med pa kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa'i nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rgyu med pa nyid gcig yin na ni de dang 'dra bas thams cad kyang rgyu med pa kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa'i nus pa ste /
translated: If this were the only cause, then everything would arise without a cause, because it is similar. However, the power of seeds, etc.🔽with regard to sprouts, etc. is seen.

original: myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / yal ga la sogs pa la skyed par byed pa sa bon dang / myu gu dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / yal ga la sogs pa la skyed par byed pa sa bon dang / myu gu dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong ngo //
translated: The power of seeds, etc. with regard to sprouts, stems, leaves, branches, etc. is seen.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: yul dang dus so sor nges pa las te yul dang dus so sor nges pa las so //
analyzed: yul dang dus so sor nges pa las te yul dang dus so sor nges pa las so //
translated: Because of the restriction of place and time.

original: de la yul so sor nges pa ni sa bon la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i yul kho nar skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yul so sor nges pa ni sa bon la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i yul kho nar skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The restriction of place is because they arise only in the place that is related to the seeds, etc.

original: dus nges pa ni sa bon gyi mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus nges pa ni sa bon gyi mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The restriction of time is because they arise immediately after the seeds, etc.

original: yul dang dus so sor nges pa las tshos pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus so sor nges pa las tshos pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The restriction of place and time is with regard to cooking, etc.

original: tshos pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sgra dang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshos pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sgra dang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa ste /
translated: and the potencies of fire, etc. with regard to cooking, pleasure, pain, sound, eye consciousness, etc.

original: me dang / grang ba dang / dro ba dang / bsnun pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: me dang / grang ba dang / dro ba dang / bsnun pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong ngo //
translated: are seen.

original: gal te rgyu med pa zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If they arose without a cause,

original: bskyed par bya ba la yul dang dus nges pa las myu gu la sogs pa las sa bon la sogs pa dang / tshos pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa'i nus pa yod par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba la yul dang dus nges pa las myu gu la sogs pa las sa bon la sogs pa dang / tshos pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa'i nus pa yod par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: the potencies of seeds, etc. with regard to sprouts, etc. and of fire, etc. with regard to cooking, etc. would not be restricted to a particular place and time in the production of what is to be produced.

original: rtag tu thams cad na thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta bu yang mi mthong bas de'i phyir rgyu med pa las byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad na thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta bu yang mi mthong bas de'i phyir rgyu med pa las byung ba ni med do //
translated: But since that is not seen, therefore there is no arising without a cause.

original: rgyu rtag par yod par smra ba ni sngar bsal zin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /🔽dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
analyzed: rgyu rtag par yod par smra ba ni sngar bsal zin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni / dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
translated: The assertion that a permanent cause exists has already been refuted.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is said:🔽Because of order, etc., it is not God, etc.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni bar du'o //
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni bar du'o //
translated: The remaining eight are in the middle.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid @273a * //🔽pa'i yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid @273a * // pa'i yan lag rnams so //
translated: Namely, the members of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, and existence.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not in the realm of form or the formless realm.

original: gzugs na spyod pa la ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag gi tshe nyid na ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug gi yan lag dag yod pa'i phyir bar du yan lag brgyad ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa la ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag gi tshe nyid na ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug gi yan lag dag yod pa'i phyir bar du yan lag brgyad ma yin no //
translated: In the realm of form, the members of consciousness, name-and-form, and the six sense bases exist at the time of the member of consciousness, so there are not eight members in the middle.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la ni ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug gi yan lag dag kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la ni ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug gi yan lag dag kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the formless realm, the members of name-and-form and the six sense bases do not exist.

original: gleng gzhi chen po'i rnam grangs kyi mdo las ni /
analyzed: gleng gzhi chen po'i rnam grangs kyi mdo las ni /
translated: In the Mahānidāna-paryāya Sūtra, it says:

original: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na 'on kyang ming dang gzugs nur nur po nyid du bya ba'i phyir rmongs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na 'on kyang ming dang gzugs nur nur po nyid du bya ba'i phyir rmongs par 'gyur ram /
translated: Ananda, if consciousness did not enter the mother’s womb, would name and form come to birth and growth in the womb?

original: btsun pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i mdo de 'byung ste /
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i mdo de 'byung ste /
translated: “No, Lord.”

original: ma'i mngal du 'jug pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar yin no //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du 'jug pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar yin no //
translated: Entry into the mother’s womb occurs only in the desire realm.🔽Because the prior end and the subsequent end are mentioned along with their results and causes, respectively.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'bras bu dang rgyu dang bcas pa dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni go rims bzhin du sngon gyi mtha' 'bras bu dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma'i mtha' rgyu dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'bras bu dang rgyu dang bcas pa dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni go rims bzhin du sngon gyi mtha' 'bras bu dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma'i mtha' rgyu dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The prior end is mentioned along with its result, and the subsequent end is mentioned along with its cause.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha'i rgyu ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha'i rgyu ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
translated: The causes of the prior end are ignorance and formation.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba'i bar yan lag lnga yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba'i bar yan lag lnga yin no //
translated: The results of the prior end are the five members from consciousness to feeling.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i 'bras bu ni skye ba dang rga shi'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i 'bras bu ni skye ba dang rga shi'o //
translated: The effect at the end of the future is birth and old age and death.

original: de'i rgyu ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / yan lag gsum yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / yan lag gsum yin no //
translated: The cause of that is the three members of craving, grasping, and existence.

original: de ltar na yan lag bdun ni sngon gyi mtha' pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag bdun ni sngon gyi mtha' pa yin la /
translated: Thus, seven members are at the beginning,

original: lnga ni phyi ma'i mtha' pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //🔽yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di dag gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni ci ma rig pa nyid 'ba' zhig gam /
analyzed: lnga ni phyi ma'i mtha' pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro // yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di dag gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni ci ma rig pa nyid 'ba' zhig gam /
translated: and five are at the end.🔽What are ignorance, etc.?

original: 'on te nyon mongs pa thams cad dam /🔽'on te nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs yin snyam du the tshom za zhing 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te nyon mongs pa thams cad dam / 'on te nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs yin snyam du the tshom za zhing 'dri ba yin no //
translated: Are they only ignorance, or all the defilements, or the state of being defiled?

original: ltan cig spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa rnams ni ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pas so //🔽de'i dbang gis /
analyzed: ltan cig spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa rnams ni ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pas so // de'i dbang gis /
translated: Ignorance is the state of being defiled, because the defilements are associated with it.

original: de dag kun du 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag kun du 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the power of that state of being defiled,🔽the defilements arise.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar ma rig pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa de dag kun du 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar ma rig pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa de dag kun du 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus, the afflictions arise through the power of ignorance.

original: kun du @273b 'byung ba ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: kun du @273b 'byung ba ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: Arising means that they follow after it.

original: rmongs pa la nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung gi ma rmongs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa la nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung gi ma rmongs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The afflictions arise for the confused, not for the unconfused.

original: rgyal po gshegs so zhes byas na zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyal po gshegs so zhes smras na /
analyzed: rgyal po gshegs so zhes byas na zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyal po gshegs so zhes smras na /
translated: When it is said that the king is coming,

original: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang de'i dbang gis 'bangs la sogs pa de dag kun du 'byung ba'i phyir de'i zham 'bring ba 'bangs la sogs pa yang 'ong bar grub pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang de'i dbang gis 'bangs la sogs pa de dag kun du 'byung ba'i phyir de'i zham 'bring ba 'bangs la sogs pa yang 'ong bar grub pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: it is understood that his retinue is also coming, because they always go together and because they arise through his power.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa'i dbang gis na ma rig pa'i yan lag ni nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa'i dbang gis na ma rig pa'i yan lag ni nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, it is understood that through the power of ignorance, the state of affliction is the member of ignorance.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Thus,

original: nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs zhes bshad kyi ma rig sngon gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs zhes bshad kyi ma rig sngon gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni ma bshad do //
translated: The stage of the defilement is explained, but the stage of ignorance is not explained.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gnas skabs zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gnas skabs zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The stage of the action of merit, etc. is the stage of the action of merit, demerit, and immobility.🔽It should be said: up to the appearance of the four sense spheres.🔽Because at that time, they are established as such.

original: skye mched bzhi dod tshun chad do zhes brjod par bya ba yin pa las zhes bya ba ni lus dang yid kyi skye mched dag ni skye ba'i srid pa nyid na byung zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi dod tshun chad do zhes brjod par bya ba yin pa las zhes bya ba ni lus dang yid kyi skye mched dag ni skye ba'i srid pa nyid na byung zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body and mind sense spheres are already present in the existence at birth.

original: de'i tshe der rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dod pa'i tshe lus dang yid kyi skye mched dag tu rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe der rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dod pa'i tshe lus dang yid kyi skye mched dag tu rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do //
translated: At the time of the appearance of the eye sense sphere, etc., they are established as the body and mind sense spheres.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug po de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad de dbang po dang / yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus tshun chad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽reg pa bde sdug la sogs kyi //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug po de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad de dbang po dang / yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus tshun chad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // reg pa bde sdug la sogs kyi //
translated: The six sense spheres are up to the coming together of the three, i.e., up to the coming together of the sense faculty, the object and the consciousness.

original: rgyu shes nus pa tshun chad do //
analyzed: rgyu shes nus pa tshun chad do //
translated: Contact is up to the capacity to know the cause of pleasure, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la dbang po dang / yul dang rnam par shes pa drug 'dus pa ni reg pa ste skye mched drug tshang ba la 'dus pa yod pa'i phyir skyes pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dbang po dang / yul dang rnam par shes pa drug 'dus pa ni reg pa ste skye mched drug tshang ba la 'dus pa yod pa'i phyir skyes pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The coming together of the six, i.e., the sense faculty, the object and the consciousness, is contact. It is defined as the stage of birth because the coming together exists when the six sense spheres are complete.

original: gang tshun chud yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang tshun chud yin zhe na /
translated: Up to what point?

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshong ba'i rgyu dag shes par nus pa tshun chad de /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshong ba'i rgyu dag shes par nus pa tshun chad de /
translated: Up to the point of the capacity to know the causes of the sensations of pleasure, pain and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: byis pa de srid du bde ba'i tshor ba'i rgyu ni 'di'o //
analyzed: byis pa de srid du bde ba'i tshor ba'i rgyu ni 'di'o //
translated: The child is then able to know: “This is the cause of the sensation of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rgyu ni 'di'o //🔽bde @274a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rgyu ni 'di'o //🔽bde @274a * //
translated: This is the cause of the sensation of pain.🔽This is the cause of the sensation of neither pleasure nor pain.”

original: ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i rgyu ni 'di'o zhes bya bar yongs su gcod mi nus pa'i gnas skabs de ni reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i rgyu ni 'di'o zhes bya bar yongs su gcod mi nus pa'i gnas skabs de ni reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The state in which one is unable to determine that this is the cause of pleasure, of suffering, or of neither pleasure nor suffering is contact.

original: 'di ltar byis pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar yongs su mi chod pas me la yang reg par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar yongs su mi chod pas me la yang reg par byed do //
translated: Thus, the fool, not having determined that it is the cause of suffering, touches fire.

original: yongs su gcod nus nas ni tshor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su gcod nus nas ni tshor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But when he is able to determine it, it is feeling.

original: gang tshun chad yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang tshun chad yin zhe na /
translated: From what point on?

original: 'khrig tshun chad de ji srid du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun du mi spyod pa'i bar gyi gnas skabs de ni tshor ba zhes bya'o //🔽gnas skabs de ni tshor ba phul du byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khrig tshun chad de ji srid du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun du mi spyod pa'i bar gyi gnas skabs de ni tshor ba zhes bya'o // gnas skabs de ni tshor ba phul du byung ba yin te /
translated: From the point of sexual union, that is, from the point at which one does not engage in sexual union out of passion.

original: tshor ba'i rgyu tshor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rgyu tshor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This state is called feeling, because it is the culmination of feeling, since it is the cause of feeling.

original: sred pa ni /
analyzed: sred pa ni /
translated: Craving is:

original: longs spyod 'khrig pa'i chags can gyi //
analyzed: longs spyod 'khrig pa'i chags can gyi //
translated: The attachment to enjoyment and sexual union.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi longs spyod dang / 'jig rten na grags pa'i 'khrig pa la chags pa can gyi gang zag gi 'dod chags de kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs ni sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi longs spyod dang / 'jig rten na grags pa'i 'khrig pa la chags pa can gyi gang zag gi 'dod chags de kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs ni sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The term craving refers to the craving of a person who is attached to the enjoyment of the characteristics of the sense objects such as form, etc. and to sexual intercourse which is well known in the world. The state in which that craving is indulged in is called craving.

original: 'dis yul dang bdag gi ngo bo len pas na nye bar len pa nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: 'dis yul dang bdag gi ngo bo len pas na nye bar len pa nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi yin te /
translated: The four kinds of afflictions are called grasping because they grasp the object and the nature of the self.

original: gnas skabs de ni len pa zhes bya'o //🔽de srid 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: gnas skabs de ni len pa zhes bya'o // de srid 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur ba'i //
translated: That state is called grasping.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The state of existence in which the effect will arise is called becoming.🔽The term effect refers to the effect of the action that is to be experienced in the next birth.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yongs su rgyug par ston to //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yongs su rgyug par ston to //
translated: The term will arise indicates the future.

original: 'di la srid pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pas na srid pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la srid pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pas na srid pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The state of existence in which that effect will arise is called the state of existence in which the effect will arise.

original: yang srid pa'i las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is also called the action of renewed existence.

original: de ni srid pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'byung bar 'gyur bas na srid pa ste las kyi rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: de ni srid pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'byung bar 'gyur bas na srid pa ste las kyi rnam grangs yin no //
translated: “It is called becoming” means that it is called becoming because it causes the arising of that which is to come. It is a synonym for action.

original: tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin //
translated: Up to feeling is aging and death.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la thug pa'i bar ni rga shi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la thug pa'i bar ni rga shi ste /
translated: Up to the stage of feeling is aging and death.

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa yan lag bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa yan lag bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: It has the nature of four members, name-and-form, etc.🔽The Blessed One said that the four members are called aging and death in order to discourage those disciples who are frightened by the idea of the endlessness of cyclic existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i skye bo skyo par bya ba'i phyir dge slong dag ming dang gzugs kyi skye ba gang yin pa de ni rga shi'i skye ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i skye bo skyo par bya ba'i phyir dge slong dag ming dang gzugs kyi skye ba gang yin pa de ni rga shi'i skye ba yin no //
translated: He said, “Monks, the arising of name-and-form is the arising of aging and death.

original: tshor ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes yan lag bzhi rga shi'i sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes yan lag bzhi rga shi'i sgrar gsungs so //
translated: The same is true up to feeling.”

original: skad cig pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma las 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: skad cig pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma las 'byung ba'am /
translated: Momentary means arising from a moment or

original: 'di la skad cig @274b ma 'byung bas na skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la skad cig @274b ma 'byung bas na skad cig pa'o //
translated: it is momentary because it arises in a moment.

original: rgyun gyis brtse ba'am spyod pa ni rgyun chags pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun gyis brtse ba'am spyod pa ni rgyun chags pa ste /
translated: It is continuous because it is connected or it is practiced continuously.

original: rgyun dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'brel pa can yang de dang 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: rgyun dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'brel pa can yang de dang 'dra ba ste //
translated: It is called “continuous” because it is uninterrupted.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called “related” because it is related to the cause and effect of the homogeneous cause.

original: gnas skabs pa ni bcu gnyis pa phung po lnga'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas skabs pa ni bcu gnyis pa phung po lnga'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called “situated” because it is situated in the situation of the five aggregates.

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The term “arising together with consciousness” is explained in detail.

original: 'dir ming ni 'du shes la sogs pa phung po gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dir ming ni 'du shes la sogs pa phung po gsum mo //
translated: Here, “name” refers to the three aggregates of feeling, perception, and formation.

original: gzugs ni rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Form” refers to form and the formless.

original: ming dang gzugs la rnam par gnas pa'i dbang po rnams zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams de la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la rnam par gnas pa'i dbang po rnams zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams de la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The term “the faculties situated in name-and-form” means that the faculties arise in dependence on that, or

original: de dag ming dang gzugs la brten nas rnam par shes pa gnas pas so //
analyzed: de dag ming dang gzugs la brten nas rnam par shes pa gnas pas so //
translated: that consciousness is situated in name-and-form in dependence on those faculties.

original: skye mched drug 'dus pa ni reg pa'o zhes bya ba la 'dus pa ni mig la sogs pa rang rang gi yul la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug 'dus pa ni reg pa'o zhes bya ba la 'dus pa ni mig la sogs pa rang rang gi yul la 'jug pa ste /
translated: The meeting of the eye, etc., with their objects is the meeting of the six sense spheres.

original: de ni ci rigs par de'i tshe gang la 'dus pa srid pa de'i de reg pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ci rigs par de'i tshe gang la 'dus pa srid pa de'i de reg pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That is contact, as appropriate, at the time of the meeting of the six sense spheres.🔽The entanglements associated with that are grasping.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i kun nas dkris pa dag ni len pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa la sogs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i kun nas dkris pa dag ni len pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa la sogs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dag ste /
translated: The entanglements associated with that are the entanglements of shamelessness, absence of abashment, etc.

original: de ni len pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni len pa yin no //
translated: That is grasping.

original: des kun nas bslang ba zhes bya ba ni sred pas kun nas bslang ba'o //
analyzed: des kun nas bslang ba zhes bya ba ni sred pas kun nas bslang ba'o //
translated: That which is motivated by that is motivated by craving.

original: kha cig na re tshor bas kun nas bslang ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re tshor bas kun nas bslang ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say it is motivated by feeling.

original: skye ba ni zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: Birth is the arising of the aggregates.🔽Maturation is aging.

original: yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu smin pa'i mthu nyams pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu smin pa'i mthu nyams pa'am /
translated: Maturation is the loss of the power of the ripened effect.

original: skad cig ma snga ma la ltos nas so //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma la ltos nas so //
translated: Or, in dependence on the previous moment.

original: zhig pa ni shi ba'o zhes bya ba ni skad cig de la 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: zhig pa ni shi ba'o zhes bya ba ni skad cig de la 'jig pa'o //
translated: Destruction is death, that is, the disintegration of the moment.

original: gzhan dag na re 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni 'jig pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni 'jig pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that that which is directed toward destruction is destruction.

original: skad cig pa dang 'brel pa can ni rab tu byed pa dag las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa dag las ji skad 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig pa dang 'brel pa can ni rab tu byed pa dag las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa dag las ji skad 'byung zhe na /
translated: The momentariness of things is as it is taught in the Prajñaptiśāstra.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is dependent origination?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams @275a * //🔽cad do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams @275a * // cad do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: All conditioned factors.🔽What are conditioned factors?

original: de la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni skad cig re re la 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni skad cig re re la 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are those factors that are subject to destruction in each moment.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skad cig pa yin la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skad cig pa yin la /
translated: Dependent origination is momentary,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i skad cig ma gnyis ka 'brel pa'i phyir 'brel pa can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i skad cig ma gnyis ka 'brel pa'i phyir 'brel pa can yin no //
translated: because two moments are related as cause and effect.

original: tshe gsum bar chad med par 'brel pa dag / ces bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: tshe gsum bar chad med par 'brel pa dag / ces bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The phrase “uninterrupted continuity of life” refers to the twelve links of dependent origination in the context of the five aggregates.

original: tshe 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'brel pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnas skabs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'brel pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnas skabs pa yin no //
translated: Because the links of dependent origination are related to the past, present, and future lives, dependent origination is said to be “in the context of the present life.”

original: bar chad med pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni cha gsum pa rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni cha gsum pa rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “uninterrupted continuity” is used to establish the third part of the definition.

original: de nyid rgyun chags pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs pa de nyid rgyun chags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa yin te /🔽skad cig ma du ma'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de nyid rgyun chags pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs pa de nyid rgyun chags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa yin te / skad cig ma du ma'i phyir ram /
translated: The phrase “it is also a continuous process” means that dependent origination is a continuous process because the links of dependent origination are related to one another in the context of the present life.

original: tshe du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dgongs pa can zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa las byung bas na dgongs pa can te /
analyzed: tshe du ma yin pa'i phyir ro // dgongs pa can zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa las byung bas na dgongs pa can te /
translated: This continuity is due to the fact that there are many moments of dependent origination or that there are many lives.

original: gdul ba la dgongs pa'i dbang gis de ltar bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdul ba la dgongs pa'i dbang gis de ltar bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “it is also a provisional description” means that dependent origination is a provisional description because it is a description that is based on a particular intention.🔽This means that the Buddha taught dependent origination in this way because he was thinking of those who are to be trained.

original: mtshan nyid pa yin zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid gtsor mdzad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid pa yin zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid gtsor mdzad pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term “philosopher” is used because they emphasize the characteristics.

original: rab tu byed pa dag las ni 'dus byas thams cad smos pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin par bshad de /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dag las ni 'dus byas thams cad smos pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin par bshad de /
translated: The treatises explain that dependent origination is both animate and inanimate, since they mention all conditioned states.

original: 'dus byas thams cad rgyu nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad rgyu nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All conditioned states are characterized by causes.

original: gdul ba'i rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ni sems can du ston pa kho na'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su bshad de de'i phyir /🔽sngon dang phyi mtha' bar dag la //🔽rmongs pa rnam par bzlog phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul ba'i rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ni sems can du ston pa kho na'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su bshad de de'i phyir / sngon dang phyi mtha' bar dag la // rmongs pa rnam par bzlog phyir ro //
translated: Dependent origination is explained as having twelve members in order to counteract the delusion of disciples regarding the past, future, and far removed.🔽The treatise declares:🔽In order to counteract delusion

original: zhes bya ba la smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la smos so //
translated: Regarding the prior end, the later end, and the far removed.🔽Therefore, it has three sections.

original: de nyid kyi phyir cha gsum pa yin no zhes bya ba la cha ni tshan tshan yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir cha gsum pa yin no zhes bya ba la cha ni tshan tshan yin no //
translated: The term “section” means a part.

original: bdag ci zhig tu byung bar gyur zhes bya ba ni mi'am ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ci zhig tu byung bar gyur zhes bya ba ni mi'am ma yin pa'o //
translated: “What was I in the past?” refers to whether one was a human or not.

original: bdag ji ltar ni byung bar gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis te rigs pa gang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci ma 'ongs pa'i @275b dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bdag ji ltar ni byung bar gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis te rigs pa gang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci ma 'ongs pa'i @275b dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: means by what sort of mode, by what sort of principle.🔽Will I exist in the future?🔽means will I exist in the future or not?

original: 'on te 'byung bar mi 'gyur ram /🔽ci zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te 'byung bar mi 'gyur ram / ci zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: What will I become?🔽means what sort of thing will I become?

original: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam pa yin no //🔽'di ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ngo bo'i rdzas tshol ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam pa yin no // 'di ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ngo bo'i rdzas tshol ba'o //
translated: How will I come to be?

original: 'di ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis te rigs pa gang gis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis te rigs pa gang gis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: means by what sort of mode, by what sort of principle.

original: bdag gi ngo bo'i rdzas de nyid nges par mi zin pas yod pa ni ci zhig yin snyam te da lta bdag yod pa ni 'di ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: bdag gi ngo bo'i rdzas de nyid nges par mi zin pas yod pa ni ci zhig yin snyam te da lta bdag yod pa ni 'di ni ci zhig yin /
translated: Since he does not ascertain the substance of the self’s essential nature, he thinks, What is there?

original: 'gyur ba ni ci zhig yin snyam nas de ltar nges par mi zin to //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni ci zhig yin snyam nas de ltar nges par mi zin to //
translated: Since he does not ascertain how it is, he thinks, How is it?🔽Since he does not ascertain the substance of the self’s essential nature, he thinks, What is there?🔽What is there now?🔽What will I become?

original: mdo las go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sutra states that they are in that order.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni phyi ma'i mtha' rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni phyi ma'i mtha' rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Birth and aging-death are stated in order to counteract ignorance about the future.

original: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar ni bar du rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar ni bar du rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: From consciousness to becoming are stated in order to counteract ignorance about the present.🔽The sutra itself states this.🔽The sutra explains that the order of dependent origination is stated in that way.

original: 'di ltar mdo nyid las gsungs so zhes bya ba ni mdo las kyang de kho na ltar bshad do zhes mdos rang gi bshad pa gzhung 'dzugs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo nyid las gsungs so zhes bya ba ni mdo las kyang de kho na ltar bshad do zhes mdos rang gi bshad pa gzhung 'dzugs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is stated in the sutra:🔽“In this way, one will not run to the past, thinking, ‘Did I exist in the past?’”

original: de ni ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam snyam du sngon gyi mtha' la 'brang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam snyam du sngon gyi mtha' la rab🔽tu mi rgyug pa ste /
analyzed: de ni ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam snyam du sngon gyi mtha' la 'brang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam snyam du sngon gyi mtha' la rab🔽tu mi rgyug pa ste /
translated: One does not run to the past, thinking, “Did I exist in the past?”

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mthong ba kho nas 'das pa'i dus la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mthong ba kho nas 'das pa'i dus la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and one who sees dependent origination as it is does not doubt the past.

original: rgyas par zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de ni ci bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' la 'brang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas pa dang / de bzhin du 'di ci zhig yin snyam du bar gyi mtha' las rgyug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyas par zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de ni ci bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' la 'brang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas pa dang / de bzhin du 'di ci zhig yin snyam du bar gyi mtha' las rgyug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the following: “He does not speculate about the future, thinking, ‘Will I exist in the future? ’” and “He does not speculate about the present, thinking, ‘What is this? ’”

original: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa dag kyang zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang len pa dag srid pa thams cad phyi ma'i mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir yin gyi ji skad du gong du rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar zhes bshad pa🔽lta bur bar du rmongs @276a * //
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa dag kyang zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang len pa dag srid pa thams cad phyi ma'i mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir yin gyi ji skad du gong du rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar zhes bshad pa🔽lta bur bar du rmongs @276a * //
translated: Craving, grasping, and becoming are also mentioned in order to counteract confusion about the future.

original: pa bzlog pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa bzlog pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to avert the future.

original: 'di la rigs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: 'di dag ni de kho na'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni de kho na'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “Because they are the causes of that alone.”

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' kho na'i rgyu yin pas so //🔽las dang nyon mongs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni gzhi yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' kho na'i rgyu yin pas so // las dang nyon mongs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni gzhi yin te /
translated: The reason is that they are the causes of the future alone.🔽Because they are the basis of karma and the mental afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gzhi yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gzhi yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Consciousness and the other members are the basis of karma and the mental afflictions.🔽The members are results in the same way.

original: de bzhin 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba ni yan lag bdun po nyid 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba ni yan lag bdun po nyid 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The seven members are results.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'i yan lag ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'i yan lag ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The members of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling are the results of ignorance and the volitional formations.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The members of birth and old age and death are the results of craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: lnga ni rgyur gyur pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams so //
analyzed: lnga ni rgyur gyur pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams so //
translated: Ignorance, the formative forces, craving, grasping and becoming.🔽Because they have the nature of karma and moral defilement.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Ignorance, craving and grasping have the nature of moral defilement.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The formative forces and becoming have the nature of karma.

original: gzhi rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The five bases are: consciousness, name/form, the six sense-fields, contact and sensation.🔽Because the two kinds of moral defilement are distinguished.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The two kinds of moral defilement are craving and grasping.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su ni rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu mdor bsdus zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga shi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su ni rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu mdor bsdus zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga shi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the future, the result is summarized in two aspects: birth and old-age-and-death.

original: 'das pa'i dus su ni nyon mongs pa sgo gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir rgyu mdor bsdus zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ma rig pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su ni nyon mongs pa sgo gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir rgyu mdor bsdus zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ma rig pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: In the past, the cause was taught in brief because the afflictions were taught in one door. The cause is called “brief” because the afflictions are taught in terms of ignorance.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang de ltar 'bras bu rnam pa lngar rgya ma bskyed la 'das pa'i dus su de ltar rgyu rnam pa gnyis su rgyas bskyed do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang de ltar 'bras bu rnam pa lngar rgya ma bskyed la 'das pa'i dus su de ltar rgyu rnam pa gnyis su rgyas bskyed do //
translated: In the future, the result will be taught in five parts without expansion, and in the past, the cause was taught in two parts without expansion.

original: 'di ltar 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan zin to zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan zin to zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: In this way, the Bhagavān has already taught this. What is it?

original: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa //
translated: Afflictions arise from afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu @276b la sogs pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu @276b la sogs pa //
translated: This is taught in the verse beginning with “from that, the basis and afflictions arise.”

original: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //🔽de las gzhi zhes bya ba ni bya ba de las so //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs // zhes bya ba yin no // de las gzhi zhes bya ba ni bya ba de las so //
translated: This is the system of the limbs of existence.

original: de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skye //
analyzed: de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skye //
translated: From that, the basis and afflictions arise.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhi las zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhi las zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: This is from the perspective of “from the basis.”

original: skye ba zhes bya ba 'dir ni de ltar na zhes bya ba zhig khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba 'dir ni de ltar na zhes bya ba zhig khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: In the present context, the phrase “in that way” should be supplied from the preceding section.🔽The phrase “arises from a basis or from the mental afflictions” should be supplied from the following section.

original: gzhi'am nyon mongs pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'di na gzhi las kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhi'am nyon mongs pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'di na gzhi las kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba mthong ste /
translated: It is seen that the mental afflictions arise from a basis.

original: tshor ba las sred pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba las sred pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For example, craving arises from feeling.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa las kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa las kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba mthong ste /
translated: It is also seen that the mental afflictions arise from the mental afflictions.

original: sred pa las len pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sred pa las len pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For example, grasping arises from craving.

original: ma rig pa yang sngon gyi mtha'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yin par yang bshad pas de gal te len pa yin na ni srid pa las skye'o zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang sngon gyi mtha'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yin par yang bshad pas de gal te len pa yin na ni srid pa las skye'o zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Since ignorance is also described as the essential nature of all the mental afflictions at the beginning of cyclic existence, if it is grasping, then it arises from existence.

original: 'on te sred pa yin na ni gzhi las skye'o zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: 'on te sred pa yin na ni gzhi las skye'o zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: If it is craving, then it arises from a basis.

original: de lta bas na ma rig pa nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhi'am nyon mongs pa las skye'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rig pa nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhi'am nyon mongs pa las skye'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that ignorance arises from the basis that is the nature of the afflictions or from the afflictions.

original: rga shi yang yan lag bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi gzhi yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rga shi yang yan lag bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi gzhi yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: It is also taught that old age and death are the basis that is the nature of four members.

original: 'di na gzhi las kyang nyon mongs pa skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di na gzhi las kyang nyon mongs pa skye bar mthong ste /
translated: Here, it is seen that the afflictions arise from the basis.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said, “Craving has the condition of feeling.”

original: de lta bas na de las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin pas yang 'di las kha bskang par bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na de las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin pas yang 'di las kha bskang par bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: Thus, it is taught that the afflictions arise from that and will arise. Therefore, there is not the slightest need to supplement this teaching,

original: de ltar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been taught.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis lugs de ltar bstan par ci mngon zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis lugs de ltar bstan par ci mngon zhe na smras pa /
translated: How do we know that the Lord taught the order of the members in this way?

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because he said, “In this way, this entire great mass of suffering comes into being.”

original: de lta ma yin na 'di nus pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di nus pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te /
translated: If this system were not so,

original: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // bya ba nyid do de las gzhi //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // bya ba nyid do de las gzhi //
translated: as it has been explained, “From the affliction, the affliction and action arise. From that, the basis.

original: de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skye //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa'i lugs 'di ma yin par gyur na /🔽ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas /🔽skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang smre @277a * //
analyzed: de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skye // zhes ji skad bshad pa'i lugs 'di ma yin par gyur na / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang smre @277a * //
translated: From that, the basis and the affliction arise.”🔽Then the statement, “From ignorance as a condition, the karmic predispositions,” and so on, up to “From birth as a condition, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation,

original: sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de tsam kho na zhig gsungs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de tsam kho na zhig gsungs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: suffering, unhappiness, and strife arise,” would be stated.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But then the statement, “Thus there is the origin of this entire great mass of suffering,” would not be stated.

original: yang dag par 'byung ba dang skye ba zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'byung ba dang skye ba zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Origination and arising are not different in meaning.

original: de lta bas na 'di'i nus pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa mngon par rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di'i nus pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa mngon par rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: Thus, the power of this seed is the expression of the form of the seed as explained.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon yid 'ong gi mkhan po gnas brtan dbyig gnyen de skad zer ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon yid 'ong gi mkhan po gnas brtan dbyig gnyen de skad zer ba yin no //
translated: Others say that the elder Vasubandhu, the teacher of Bhadanta Sthiramati, said this.

original: mdo gzhan las ma rig pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i mdo las so //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las ma rig pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i mdo las so //
translated: Another sūtra says that ignorance arises from the cause of improper mental attention.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What does that sūtra say?

original: mdo las / dge slong dag ma rig pa ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo las / dge slong dag ma rig pa ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: A sūtra says, “Monks, ignorance has a cause, a condition, and a basis.

original: dge slong dag ma rig pa'i rgyu ni gang rkyen ni gang gzhi ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag ma rig pa'i rgyu ni gang rkyen ni gang gzhi ni gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, what is the cause of ignorance? What is the condition? What is the basis?

original: dge slong dag tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Monks, improper mental attention is the cause of ignorance.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni rkyen no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni rkyen no //
translated: Incorrect mental activity is the condition.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni gzhi'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa lnga pa /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni gzhi'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa lnga pa /
translated: Incorrect mental activity is the basis.🔽Incorrect mental activity arises from the cause of ignorance.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs zhes bya ba ni mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs zhes bya ba ni mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: This is stated in another sūtra.🔽A sūtra states:

original: mdo las / mig dang gzugs la brten nas gti mug las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa rnyog pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las / mig dang gzugs la brten nas gti mug las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa rnyog pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “From the eye and form, mental activity arising from delusion and turbidity is generated.”

original: de ci'i phyir 'dir ma smos /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'dir ma smos /
translated: Why isn’t this stated here?

original: ji ltar na yan lag gzhan yin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yan lag gzhan yin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it not be a different member?

original: de ni 'dir yang len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni 'dir yang len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here it is explained that it is included in grasping.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa rnyog pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa rnyog pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to mental activity and turbidity.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdor ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdor ro //
translated: Here means in the Dependent Origination Sutra.

original: ji ltar @277b bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar @277b bshad ce na /
translated: How is it explained?

original: len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained because it is included in grasping.

original: 'di ltar len pa ni longs spyod rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar len pa ni longs spyod rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
translated: Thus, grasping is the occasion of the occurrence of the afflictions in order to obtain enjoyments.

original: de'i nang du yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa phyin ci log gi sems pa'i gtod pa 'dus pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i nang du yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa phyin ci log gi sems pa'i gtod pa 'dus pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: And since improper mental attention is included in that, it is explained.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa rgyu med pa nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa rgyu med pa nyid kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, ignorance does not exist without a cause.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las yan lag gzhan gyis kha bskang bar bya ba yang mi dgos so //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las yan lag gzhan gyis kha bskang bar bya ba yang mi dgos so //
translated: And it is not necessary to supplement the twelve members such as ignorance with other members.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par yang thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par yang thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And since improper mental attention has ignorance as its cause, it does not follow that there is an infinite regress.

original: slob dpon gyis ji ltar 'dus zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ji ltar 'dus zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The Master [Vasubandhu] says, “How is it included in grasping?”

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa'i nang du ji ltar 'dus /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa'i nang du ji ltar 'dus /
translated: How is incorrect mental attention included in grasping?

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the essential nature of incorrect mental attention that is included in grasping.

original: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa las yin te /
analyzed: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa las yin te /
translated: If it is from the point of view of association,

original: gal te tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'di ni len pa'i nang du 'dus par 'dod na /
