analyzed: gal te tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'di ni len pa'i nang du 'dus par 'dod na /
translated: if incorrect mental attention is associated with grasping, then for that reason it is asserted to be included in grasping.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag sred pa dang ma rig pa dag gi nang du tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de 'dus par 'gyur te /

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i dus gang yin pa 'di ni reg pa'i dus yin no //

analyzed: gti mug las skyes pa'i phyir te gti mug las skyes pa ni gti mug las skyes pa'o //
translated: That which arises from delusion is born of delusion.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa las byung ba ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ste /

translated: Feeling that arises from contact associated with ignorance is called feeling that arises from contact associated with ignorance.

original: gang la ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yod @278b pa de la ni gdon mi za bar ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yod @278b pa de la ni gdon mi za bar ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Where there is feeling that arises from contact associated with ignorance, there is contact associated with ignorance.

original: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i tshor ba ni sred pa'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i tshor ba ni sred pa'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Feeling that is not associated with ignorance is not a cause of craving.

original: de lta bas na reg pa'i dus na yod pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni tshor ba dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i ma rig pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bor grub pas ma rig pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las🔽byung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //

translated: Thus, since incorrect mental activity that exists at the time of contact is established as the entity of the condition for ignorance that occurs simultaneously with feeling, this passage demonstrates that ignorance arises from the cause of incorrect mental activity.

original: de lta bas na tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ma rig pa rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin zhing de ltar reg pa'i dus na yod pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa tshor ba dang lhan cig

translated: Thus, because ignorance arises from the cause of incorrect mental activity, it is not causeless. Since incorrect mental activity that exists at the time of contact is established as the entity of the condition for ignorance that occurs simultaneously with feeling,

original: gti mug las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa rnyog pa zhes 'byung bas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de yang gti mug las skyes pa yin par gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de lta bas na 'di ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las kyang ma rig pa 'byung la ma rig pa las kyang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'byung ngo zhes 'khor lo lta bur bshad pa yin no //

translated: It is not stated in the Sutra on Dependent Origination.

original: de'i phyir zhal nas mdo gzhan las gsungs @279b pa'i sgo nas rigs pa 'di rnam par 'jog pas mdo gzhan nye bar 'god pa dgos pa gzhan yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhal nas mdo gzhan las gsungs @279b pa'i sgo nas rigs pa 'di rnam par 'jog pas mdo gzhan nye bar 'god pa dgos pa gzhan yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the purpose of the other sutra is to establish this reasoning by teaching it in another sutra.

original: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhes zer ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhes zer ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa'o //
translated: The author of the treatise says, “If that were so, it would be absurd.”

original: ji ltar na ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How would it be absurd?

original: bshad pa / mdo gzhan las ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skye'o zhes bstan te /🔽dgra bcom pa rnams kyi tshor ba ma rig pa med pa ni sred pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / mdo gzhan las ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skye'o zhes bstan te / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi tshor ba ma rig pa med pa ni sred pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: The other sutra teaches, “Craving arises in dependence on the feeling that arises from contact with ignorance.”🔽The feeling of arhats who lack ignorance is not a condition for craving.

original: phyin ci log med pa'i reg pa yang nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin la /
analyzed: phyin ci log med pa'i reg pa yang nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin la /
translated: Contact that is free of error is not a condition for afflicted feeling.

original: dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa'i reg pa yang phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'dis reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya ba'i yan lag 'di gnyis kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'dir ma smos bzhin du gzhan nas bstan
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa'i reg pa yang phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'dis reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya ba'i yan lag 'di gnyis kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'dir ma smos bzhin du gzhan nas bstan
translated: This reasoning shows that the two factors of contact and feeling are not mentioned in this dependent origination sutra, but are taught elsewhere.

original: pa'i phyir shes par 'gyur bas yan lag 'di gnyis kyang ma smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir shes par 'gyur bas yan lag 'di gnyis kyang ma smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are known, these two factors are not mentioned.🔽Similarly, another sutra declares:

original: de bzhin du mdo gzhan las de gal te bsod nams kyi 'du byed dag mngon par 'du byed na bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo gzhan las de gal te bsod nams kyi 'du byed dag mngon par 'du byed na bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes par 'gyur te /
translated: If one creates meritorious compositional activity, consciousness proceeds to merit.

original: bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bstan te /
translated: It is similar for nonmeritorious and unshakable compositional activity.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'du byed ma rig pa med pa ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'du byed ma rig pa med pa ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nas /
translated: The compositional activity of an arhat who lacks ignorance is meritorious.

original: mi g-yo ba nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang mi 'gyur bas 'du byed kyi yan lag 'di yang rigs pas grub ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang mi 'gyur bas 'du byed kyi yan lag 'di yang rigs pas grub ste /
translated: Therefore, this link of conditionings is established by reason.

original: 'dir brjod mi dgos so zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'dir brjod mi dgos so zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: It is not necessary to say anything more about it.

original: de bzhin du rigs pa'i sgo nas skye ba med par rga shi mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar shes pas skye ba'i yan lag kyang brjod mi dgos par 'gyur bas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs pa'i sgo nas skye ba med par rga shi mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar shes pas skye ba'i yan lag kyang brjod mi dgos par 'gyur bas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, since it is understood by reason that without birth, aging and death do not occur, it is not necessary to say anything more about the link of birth.

original: slob dpon gyis 'di ni klan kar mi rung ba kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs rgyas par bshad do //🔽'dir ni ji ltar na 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de la ma rig pa @280a * //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'di ni klan kar mi rung ba kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs rgyas par bshad do // 'dir ni ji ltar na 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de la ma rig pa @280a * //
translated: The Master says, “This is not a proper objection at all,” and he explains his own position in detail.🔽Here, how does one come from the other world to this world?

original: dang / 'du byed dag gis ni 'jig rten 'dir 'brel par byed de /
analyzed: dang / 'du byed dag gis ni 'jig rten 'dir 'brel par byed de /
translated: There, ignorance and the conditionings connect one to this world.

original: 'jig rten 'di pa de yang rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'i yan lag rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di pa de yang rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'i yan lag rnams yin no //
translated: The present world is the members of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling.

original: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams kyis ni 'jig rten pha rol du sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams kyis ni 'jig rten pha rol du sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Craving, grasping, and becoming connect one to the next world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol de yang skye ba dang rga shi yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol de yang skye ba dang rga shi yin no //
translated: The next world is birth, old age, and death.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'dir ni gdul ba rnams la don de tsam zhig brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir la don de yang gong du bshad zin pa'i phyir te /🔽sngon dang phyi mtha' bar dag la //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'dir ni gdul ba rnams la don de tsam zhig brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir la don de yang gong du bshad zin pa'i phyir te / sngon dang phyi mtha' bar dag la //
translated: In this Sutra on Dependent Origination, only that much is stated for the sake of instructing disciples, and that meaning has already been explained above.🔽As it is said,

original: rmongs pa rnam par bzlog phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnam par bzlog phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate confusion about the beginning, end, and middle.🔽Since that has already been explained, it is not appropriate to criticize it.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis bshad zin pa'i phyir 'dir ni klan kar mi rung ba kho na yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par ma tshang bar bstan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis bshad zin pa'i phyir 'dir ni klan kar mi rung ba kho na yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par ma tshang bar bstan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar dang sbyar ro //
translated: The explanation is not incomplete.

original: gnyis ka yang 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad yin zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos dus gsum pa thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la de dag nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang yin pas khyad par ci yang med do //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad yin zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos dus gsum pa thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la de dag nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang yin pas khyad par ci yang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all because all conditioned phenomena of the three times are dependent origination and they are also dependent origination itself.🔽How are future nonarisen phenomena dependent origination?🔽This is like how future phenomena are called conditioned by the name of their future arising.

original: ma 'ongs pa ma byas pa rnams kho na yang ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis ma 'ongs pa rnams la 'dus byas zhes bya ba ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang de dang 'dra'o snyam du bsams pa yin
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma byas pa rnams kho na yang ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis ma 'ongs pa rnams la 'dus byas zhes bya ba ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang de dang 'dra'o snyam du bsams pa yin
translated: It is thought that dependent origination is similar to that.

original: no // mngon par 'du byed pa pa'i sems pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: no // mngon par 'du byed pa pa'i sems pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said that the volition that is formation is the formation of formation.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa pa zhes smos pa ni sems pa thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mngon par brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa pa zhes smos pa ni sems pa thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mngon par brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term formation is stated because it expresses the intrinsic identity of all volition.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa yin no //
translated: It is formation because it is the formation of the maturation.

original: des bsams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: des bsams pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is intended,

original: lhar skye bar shog shig mir skye bar shog shig ces bya ba la sogs pa smon lam btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhar skye bar shog shig mir skye bar shog shig ces bya ba la sogs pa smon lam btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one formulates the wish: “May I be born as a god, may I be born as a human.”

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa rnams la 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa rnams la 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, future factors are called conditioned because they are the object of the wish, not because they are the object of the activity of the wish.

original: bsams pa de 'dor du gzhug pa'i phyir zag pa med @280b pa rnams ji ltar zhes smos te /🔽ma 'ongs pa zag pa dang bcas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni de ltar bsam du'ang rung na /
analyzed: bsams pa de 'dor du gzhug pa'i phyir zag pa med @280b pa rnams ji ltar zhes smos te / ma 'ongs pa zag pa dang bcas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni de ltar bsam du'ang rung na /
translated: In order to refute this opinion, the author of the treatise says, “How can the future unconditioned factors be the object of the wish?”🔽The future factors that are associated with the outflows can be the object of the wish.

original: ma 'ongs pa zag pa med pa gang dag yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa zag pa med pa gang dag yin pa de dag go //
translated: But how can the future unconditioned factors that are free from the outflows be the object of the wish?

original: ji ltar bsam du rung /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam du rung /
translated: How can they be the object of the wish?

original: rgol bar byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: rgol bar byed pas smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: de dag kyang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams thob par gyur cig ces thob par bya ba'i phyir sems pa dge bas bsams pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams thob par gyur cig ces thob par bya ba'i phyir sems pa dge bas bsams pa dag yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are virtuous thoughts that think of obtaining, thinking, “May they obtain uncontaminated states.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par gyur cig snyam du thob par bya bar bsams pa'i phyir 'dus byas su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par gyur cig snyam du thob par bya bar bsams pa'i phyir 'dus byas su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Nirvana would also be a conditioned state because it is thought of as something to be obtained, thinking, “May nirvana be obtained.”

original: de ltar don de ma 'ongs pa rnams 'dus byas nyid yin par rnam par gzhag na nyes pa yod pas de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba tshul gzhan rgyas par 'god par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar don de ma 'ongs pa rnams 'dus byas nyid yin par rnam par gzhag na nyes pa yod pas de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba tshul gzhan rgyas par 'god par byed de /
translated: Since there is a fault in positing that future states are conditioned in this way, the following mode is extensively set forth in order to demonstrate that they are similar in type.

original: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs gzugs su rung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa re zhig gzugs su mi rung yang gzugs su rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba de bzhin du chos ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos su rigs mthun
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs gzugs su rung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa re zhig gzugs su mi rung yang gzugs su rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba de bzhin du chos ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos su rigs mthun
translated: Just as future form, which will become suitable as form, is called form because it is of the same type as form, even though it is not yet suitable as form, so future phenomena are called dependently arisen because they are of the same type as dependently arisen phenomena.

original: pas de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa rnams la rten cing 'brel te byung ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pas de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa rnams la rten cing 'brel te byung ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught that future phenomena are dependently arisen.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rgyu yang yan lag de kho na yin pas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rgyu yang yan lag de kho na yin pas so //
translated: Because they are causes and results means that a cause is just a link and a result is just a link.🔽Even though that is so, it is not the case that they are not posited due to the specific relation of cause and effect.

original: de ltar yin yang ltos pa'i bye brag gis rnam par gzhag pa med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ltos pa'i bye brag gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar byung ba rnam par mi gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin yang ltos pa'i bye brag gis rnam par gzhag pa med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ltos pa'i bye brag gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar byung ba rnam par mi gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that dependent origination and that which is dependently arisen are not posited due to the specific relation of cause and effect.

original: tshu rol dang pha rol lta bu dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshu rol dang pha rol lta bu dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, this shore and the other shore, and cause and effect.🔽For example, cause and effect, and father and son.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bzhin dang pha dang bu bzhin no zhes bya ba de las rgyu dang 'bras bu ni dper na sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa ji ltar gang la ltos nas rgyur rnam par gzhag pa de la ltos nas 'bras bu ma yin la
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bzhin dang pha dang bu bzhin no zhes bya ba de las rgyu dang 'bras bu ni dper na sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa ji ltar gang la ltos nas rgyur rnam par gzhag pa de la ltos nas 'bras bu ma yin la
translated: Cause and effect are like a seed and a sprout, etc. That which is posited as a cause in dependence on something is not its effect in dependence on that.

original: / gang la ltos nas 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa de la ltos nas rgyu ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /🔽'bras bu @281a * //
analyzed: / gang la ltos nas 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa de la ltos nas rgyu ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na / 'bras bu @281a * //
translated: That which is posited as an effect in dependence on something is not its cause in dependence on that.

original: la ltos nas rgyur rnam par gzhag la /🔽rgyu la ltos kyang 'bras bu yin pa dang / ji ltar gang la ltos nas pha yin pa de la ltos nas bu ma yin la /
analyzed: la ltos nas rgyur rnam par gzhag la / rgyu la ltos kyang 'bras bu yin pa dang / ji ltar gang la ltos nas pha yin pa de la ltos nas bu ma yin la /
translated: Rather, that which is posited as a cause in dependence on an effect is its cause.🔽That which is posited as an effect in dependence on a cause is its effect.🔽That which is a father in dependence on a son is not a son in dependence on that.

original: gang la ltos nas bu yin pa de la ltos nas pha ma yin gyi'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas bu yin pa de la ltos nas pha ma yin gyi'o na ci zhe na /
translated: That which is a son in dependence on a father is not a father in dependence on that.

original: bu la ltos nas pha zhes bya zhing cig shos la ltos nas kyang bu zhes bya ba la de dag rnam par mi gnas pa yang ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bu la ltos nas pha zhes bya zhing cig shos la ltos nas kyang bu zhes bya ba la de dag rnam par mi gnas pa yang ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The father is called father in relation to the son, and the son is called son in relation to the father.

original: mu dang po ni chos ma 'ongs pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin te /🔽'di las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu dang po ni chos ma 'ongs pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin te / 'di las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first possibility is future factors, because they are dependent origination, since they are the cause of other factors.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not dependent origination,

original: ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have not yet arisen.

original: gnyis pa ni dgra bcom pa'i chos tha ma zhes bya ba ni byung zin pa'i phyir dang / de las 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dgra bcom pa'i chos tha ma zhes bya ba ni byung zin pa'i phyir dang / de las 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The second possibility is the final factors of an arhat, because they are dependent origination, since they are the effect of other factors.🔽They are not dependent origination,🔽because they do not produce an effect.

original: gsum pa ni de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i tha ma dag las gzhan pa'i chos 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i tha ma dag las gzhan pa'i chos 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The third possibility is past and present factors other than those, that is, other than the final factors of an arhat.

original: bzhi pa ni chos 'dus ma byas rnams so zhes bya ba ni de dag la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dang / mi skye ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni chos 'dus ma byas rnams so zhes bya ba ni de dag la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dang / mi skye ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not have results and they are endowed with the quality of non-arising.

original: grag go zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa yin no //🔽ci 'di dag gang zhig gang 'dod pa 'dod rgyal du 'chad pa zhig gam zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gnas skabs pa zhes bya ba nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa yin no // ci 'di dag gang zhig gang 'dod pa 'dod rgyal du 'chad pa zhig gam zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gnas skabs pa zhes bya ba nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The word “it is said” means that this is not possible.🔽Do they explain this as they wish, whatever they like?

original: rten cang 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos de dag ma yin pa'ang yod ces bya ba'i bar de lta bu la sogs pa'o //🔽sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ma rig pa kho na bshad kyi /
analyzed: rten cang 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos de dag ma yin pa'ang yod ces bya ba'i bar de lta bu la sogs pa'o // sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ma rig pa kho na bshad kyi /
translated: This is the context of dependent origination, from “dependent origination is a dharma” up to “there are dharmas that are not dependent origination.”🔽This is the definitive meaning.🔽The statement “ignorance of the prior end” shows that because only ignorance is explained,

original: phung po gzhan dag ni ma yin pa de'i phyir ma rig pa kho na yan lag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa'i don yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: phung po gzhan dag ni ma yin pa de'i phyir ma rig pa kho na yan lag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa'i don yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: therefore only ignorance is a link. This is the definitive meaning.

original: nges pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rnam par phye ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rnam par phye ba'i don to //
translated: The term “definitive meaning” means the meaning that is distinguished.

original: glang po che'i rjes lta bu ni mdo zhig go //
analyzed: glang po che'i rjes lta bu ni mdo zhig go //
translated: The elephant’s footprint is a sūtra.

original: de dag la ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan yang yod de zhes bya ba ni skra la sogs pa de dag la sa'i khams tsam kho nar ma zad kyi zhes bya ba @281b yin no //
analyzed: de dag la ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan yang yod de zhes bya ba ni skra la sogs pa de dag la sa'i khams tsam kho nar ma zad kyi zhes bya ba @281b yin no //
translated: The phrase “there is also form, etc., in them” means that in those things such as hair, there is not only the earth element.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'dir yang bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs dag tu gang zhig gtso bo yin pa de bstan pa yin
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'dir yang bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs dag tu gang zhig gtso bo yin pa de bstan pa yin
translated: The phrase “in the same way, here also, the principal is taught” means that in this sūtra on dependent origination, the principal factor in the context of the five aggregates with their twelve aspects is taught.

original: te / ma rig pa gtso bo yin pa'i skabs su ni ma rig pa zhes bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: te / ma rig pa gtso bo yin pa'i skabs su ni ma rig pa zhes bstan pa yin la /
translated: In the context of ignorance as the principal factor, ignorance is taught.

original: 'du byed la sogs pa gtso bo yin pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni 'du byed la sogs pa bstan pa yin par zad kyi de la ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa chos gzhan dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa gtso bo yin pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni 'du byed la sogs pa bstan pa yin par zad kyi de la ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa chos gzhan dag kyang yod do //
translated: In the context where formations and so on are primary, only formations and so on are taught, but they also have other phenomena such as form and feeling.

original: de las ni gang gis na de dag ma rdzogs par bstan par gyur pa sa'i khams kyis skra la sogs pa ston pa ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo de las ni gang gis ni skra la sogs pa de dag ma rdzogs
analyzed: de las ni gang gis na de dag ma rdzogs par bstan par gyur pa sa'i khams kyis skra la sogs pa ston pa ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo de las ni gang gis ni skra la sogs pa de dag ma rdzogs
translated: The passage from the sutra that states, The earth element does not teach hair and so on is not saying that the earth element teaches hair and so on.

original: par bstan par 'gyur ba skra la sogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: par bstan par 'gyur ba skra la sogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: The sutra states, What is hair and so on?🔽The earth element.

original: sa'i // khams so zhes sa'i khams kyis skra la sogs pa ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa'i // khams so zhes sa'i khams kyis skra la sogs pa ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The earth element does not teach hair and so on.

original: de dag la ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yod pas skra la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin gyi sa'i khams 'ba' zhig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yod pas skra la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin gyi sa'i khams 'ba' zhig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since they also have other phenomena such as form, hair and so on are the essence of form and so on, they are not the essence of the earth element alone.

original: 'on kyang de las ni sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de las ni sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: However, the Abhidharmakośa declares, What is the earth element?🔽

original: skra dang spu dag go zhes skra la sogs pa dag kho nas sa'i khams ston pa yin te /
analyzed: skra dang spu dag go zhes skra la sogs pa dag kho nas sa'i khams ston pa yin te /
translated: But from that passage, the earth element is indicated only by hair and so on, since it says, What is the earth element?🔽Hair and body hair.

original: skra la sogs pa ma gtogs par bor te nang gis sa'i khams med pas sa'i khams 'di rdzogs par bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa ma gtogs par bor te nang gis sa'i khams med pas sa'i khams 'di rdzogs par bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since there is no internal earth element apart from hair and so on, the earth element is taught in its entirety.

original: de bzhin du 'di las kyang ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du mdo 'di las kyang ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa kho nar bstan pa yin gyi lhag ma dang
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di las kyang ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du mdo 'di las kyang ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa kho nar bstan pa yin gyi lhag ma dang
translated: So too, here, ignorance and so on are taught in their entirety in this sutra, since it says, Ignorance, formation, consciousness and so on.

original: bcas par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcas par ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not taught with remainder.

original: mchi ma dang mchil ma dang snabs la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni mdo de las mchi ma dang mchil ma dang snabs la sogs pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: mchi ma dang mchil ma dang snabs la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni mdo de las mchi ma dang mchil ma dang snabs la sogs pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: Since tears, mucus, spittle and so on are not mentioned in that sutra,

original: de lta bas na de dag la yod pa'i sa'i khams ma bshad pas lhag ma dang bcas pa kho @282a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag la yod pa'i sa'i khams ma bshad pas lhag ma dang bcas pa kho @282a * //
translated: Therefore, since the earth element that exists in them is not explained, it is said to be incomplete.

original: na zhes ston par byed do //🔽yang na gal te de kho na dang 'dra bar bstan par nus na ma rig pa'i lhag ma yod la rag go zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te ji ltar ma bshad pa'i phyir sa'i khams kyi lhag ma mchil ma dang snabs la sogs pa
analyzed: na zhes ston par byed do // yang na gal te de kho na dang 'dra bar bstan par nus na ma rig pa'i lhag ma yod la rag go zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te ji ltar ma bshad pa'i phyir sa'i khams kyi lhag ma mchil ma dang snabs la sogs pa
translated: Therefore, since the earth element that exists in them is not explained, it is shown that it has a remainder.🔽Or else, if the remainder of ignorance could be explained in the same way, then the remainder of ignorance would exist.

original: la yod pa de kho na dang 'dra bar bstan par nus na //
analyzed: la yod pa de kho na dang 'dra bar bstan par nus na //
translated: If the remainder of the earth element that exists in saliva, mucus, and so on, which is not explained, could be explained in the same way,

original: ma rig pa'i lhag ma yod la rag ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i lhag ma yod la rag ste /
translated: then the remainder of ignorance would exist.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bstan par mi nus so snyam nas sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bstan par mi nus so snyam nas sbyor ba yin te /
translated: The word “if” is used because it is thought that it cannot be explained.

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa dang / mtha'i bar mi shes pa dang / sangs rgyas mi shes pa dang / chos mi shes pa dang / dge 'dun mi shes pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas mi shes pa'i gnas thams cad bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa dang / mtha'i bar mi shes pa dang / sangs rgyas mi shes pa dang / chos mi shes pa dang / dge 'dun mi shes pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas mi shes pa'i gnas thams cad bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the states of ignorance are explained in the sutra, such as ignorance of the past, ignorance of the future, ignorance of the present, ignorance of the Buddha, ignorance of the Dharma, and ignorance of the Saṅgha.

original: ma rig pa ni phung po lnga'i gnas skabs yin no zhes tshor ba la sogs pa rigs pa tha dad pa ni ma rig par ci'i phyir bstan te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni phung po lnga'i gnas skabs yin no zhes tshor ba la sogs pa rigs pa tha dad pa ni ma rig par ci'i phyir bstan te /
translated: Why is it that feeling and so on, which have different natures from ignorance, are taught to be ignorance in the sutra, “Ignorance is the state of the five aggregates”?

original: tshor ba la sogs pa ni ma rig pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa ni ma rig pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Feeling and so on are not suitable as ignorance.

original: yod pa dang med par nges pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yod dam med na go rims bzhin du yang yod pa dang med par nges pa kho na yan lag yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med par nges pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yod dam med na go rims bzhin du yang yod pa dang med par nges pa kho na yan lag yin te /
translated: The sutra states that the five aggregates are the state of ignorance, but it does not state that ignorance is the state of the five aggregates.🔽The sutra states that the five aggregates are the state of ignorance, but it does not state that ignorance is the state of the five aggregates.

original: ma rig pa yod pa na 'du byed rnams yod la de med na de dag kyang med pas ma rig pa kho na yan lag yin gyi tshor ba la sogs par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa yod pa na 'du byed rnams yod la de med na de dag kyang med pas ma rig pa kho na yan lag yin gyi tshor ba la sogs par ni ma yin te /
translated: If ignorance exists, then karmic formation exists. If it does not exist, then they also do not exist. Therefore, only ignorance is a link, and not feeling, etc.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams la de dag yod kyang rnam par shes pa'i yan lag skyed par byed pa'i 'du byed gang dag yin pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams la de dag yod kyang rnam par shes pa'i yan lag skyed par byed pa'i 'du byed gang dag yin pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that although those are present in arhats, the karmic formations that generate the link of consciousness do not occur.

original: de lta bas na phung po lnga yod kyang 'du byed rnams kyang mi 'byung zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na phung po lnga yod kyang 'du byed rnams kyang mi 'byung zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Thus he says in detail, “Although the five aggregates exist, the karmic formations do not occur.”

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi gnas skabs na phung po lnga yod kyang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi gnas skabs na phung po lnga yod kyang /
translated: Although the five aggregates exist in the state of arhats,

original: bsod nams kyi nye bar 'gro ba na mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi nye bar 'gro ba na mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: the consciousness that occurs in the meritorious and so on up to the consciousness that occurs in the immovable does not occur.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the consciousness that links with a new birth does not occur.

original: skye ba de dang der nye bar 'gro bas na nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba de dang der nye bar 'gro bas na nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is called “that which proceeds” because it proceeds to that and that birth.

original: bsod nams kyis nye bar 'gro bas na bsod nams kyis nye bar 'gro ba'i @282b rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyis nye bar 'gro bas na bsod nams kyis nye bar 'gro ba'i @282b rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: It is called “consciousness that proceeds by way of merit” because it proceeds by way of merit.

original: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies up to “that which proceeds by way of the imperturbable.”

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa med pa'i gnas skabs na phung po lnga dag yod kyang srid pa dang len pa la sogs pa yang mi 'byung bas mdo'i don ni ji skad bstan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa med pa'i gnas skabs na phung po lnga dag yod kyang srid pa dang len pa la sogs pa yang mi 'byung bas mdo'i don ni ji skad bstan pa kho na yin te /
translated: Similarly, even though the five aggregates exist in the state of non- ignorance, craving, grasping, and so on do not occur. Therefore, the meaning of the sutra is exactly as it is explained.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa ji ltar bsgrags pa kho na ltar gzung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa ji ltar bsgrags pa kho na ltar gzung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that ignorance and so on are to be understood just as they are proclaimed.

original: de'i phyir phung po gzhan yod kyang 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin pas de dag ni yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po gzhan yod kyang 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin pas de dag ni yan lag ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though other aggregates exist, they are not conditions of formations and so on, and thus they are not limbs.

original: mdo ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: mdo ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: The sutra is the passage beginning, “Thus have I heard,” and so on, and “The Bhagavat was dwelling in Rājagṛha at Vulture Peak Mountain together with a great saṅgha of 1,250 monks and many bodhisattva mahāsattvas.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The venerable Śāriputra said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya,

original: byams pa der 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis s'a lu ljang pa la gzigs nas dge slong rnams la mdo 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: byams pa der 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis s'a lu ljang pa la gzigs nas dge slong rnams la mdo 'di gsungs so //
translated: “Maitreya, here the Bhagavat, having seen the green rice, spoke this discourse to the monks:

original: dge slong dag sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dag sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
translated: ‘Monks, whoever sees dependent arising sees the Dharma.

original: sus chos mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: sus chos mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: Whoever sees the Dharma sees the Buddha.’

original: bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar gyur nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar gyur nas /
translated: The Bhagavan remained silent.

original: byams pa bde bar gshegs pas bka' stsal pa'i mdo de'i don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gang /
analyzed: byams pa bde bar gshegs pas bka' stsal pa'i mdo de'i don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gang /
translated: Maitreya said, “Sugata, what is the meaning of the sutra you have spoken? What is dependent origination?

original: chos ni gang /
analyzed: chos ni gang /
translated: What is the Dharma?

original: sangs rgyas ni gang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni gang /
translated: What is a Buddha?🔽How is it that by seeing dependent origination one sees the Dharma?

original: ji ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong bas chos mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gang 'di ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong bas chos mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gang 'di ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And what is dependent origination? It is ignorance, etc.”

original: de gsungs nas mdo de las /
analyzed: de gsungs nas mdo de las /
translated: After he said that, the sutra continues:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: “Whether Tathagatas arise or not,🔽this dharmata of phenomena remains.”

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni 'dug pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni 'dug pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It continues up to:

original: gang 'di chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos nges par gyur pa nyid dang / rten @283a * //
analyzed: gang 'di chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos nges par gyur pa nyid dang / rten @283a * //
translated: This is dharmata, the abiding nature of phenomena, the definite nature of phenomena, the basis of phenomena, the source of phenomena, the destination of phenomena, the truth of phenomena, and the reality of phenomena.

original: cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid dang / bden pa kho na dang /
analyzed: cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid dang / bden pa kho na dang /
translated: and dependent origination, and suchness, and unmistaken suchness, and unaltered suchness, and reality, and truth, and

original: ma nor ba nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: ma nor ba nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs te /
translated: nonerroneticness, and nonreversal, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das byams pa'i bka' yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byams pa'i bka' yin no //
translated: This is the word of the Bhagavat Maitreya.

original: gal te chos ma 'ongs pa rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mu dang po ni chos ma 'ongs pa rnams so zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te chos ma 'ongs pa rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mu dang po ni chos ma 'ongs pa rnams so zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: If future phenomena are not dependent origination, then the first alternative is future phenomena, which is what was explained.

original: mdo dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga shi dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: mdo dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga shi dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur pa zhig na /
translated: It contradicts the sutra, because birth and aging and death would not be dependent origination.

original: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar ni yin par yang bshad do //
analyzed: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar ni yin par yang bshad do //
translated: But it is explained that from ignorance up to aging and death are dependent origination.

original: yang na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'on te skye ba dang rga shi'i yan lag dag kyang rten cing 'brel bar byung ba yin par 'dod na ni de gnyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus su rnam par gzhag par mi 'dod par bya dgos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'on te skye ba dang rga shi'i yan lag dag kyang rten cing 'brel bar byung ba yin par 'dod na ni de gnyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus su rnam par gzhag par mi 'dod par bya dgos pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, if you maintain that the members of birth and aging-death are also dependently arisen, then you must not assert that those two are posited in the future time.

original: sngon dang phyi mthar gnyis gnyis dang / bar du brgyad ces bya ba cha gsum du dgod pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi mthar gnyis gnyis dang / bar du brgyad ces bya ba cha gsum du dgod pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the statement that the three times are posited in terms of the two pairs and the eight in the middle would be undermined.

original: sde pa gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni sa ston pa rnams so //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni sa ston pa rnams so //
translated: Other schools say:🔽Because they are the characteristics of conditioned states that arise.

original: 'byung ba'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan dag gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i 'byung zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan dag gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i 'byung zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Other schools say that the arising in the term dependent origination refers to the three characteristics of conditioned states.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: These three are the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: 'dus byas la ni skye ba yang mngon no //
analyzed: 'dus byas la ni skye ba yang mngon no //
translated: The arising of conditioned states is clearly evident.

original: 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan dag tu 'gyur ba yang mngon no zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa gang yin pa de rtag pa yin par brtags pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir na mi rtag pa yin no snyam du🔽bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan dag tu 'gyur ba yang mngon no zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa gang yin pa de rtag pa yin par brtags pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir na mi rtag pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since you assert that the characteristics of conditioned states are permanent, they are not impermanent.

original: gal te khyod mtshan nyid kyang rtag pa yin no zhes smras na /
analyzed: gal te khyod mtshan nyid kyang rtag pa yin no zhes smras na /
translated: If you assert that the characteristics are also permanent,

original: de'i phyir dngos po gzhan rtag pa ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin par yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po gzhan rtag pa ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin par yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is not tenable that a permanent thing is the characteristic of an impermanent thing.

original: mya ngan las @283b 'das pa'am /
analyzed: mya ngan las @283b 'das pa'am /
translated: Neither nirvana nor space

original: nam mkha' ni mi rtag pa 'ga'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /🔽skye ba'i sngon rol na yang mtshan nyid yod pas su'i mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni mi rtag pa 'ga'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te / skye ba'i sngon rol na yang mtshan nyid yod pas su'i mtshan nyid yin /
translated: is the characteristic of any impermanent thing.🔽Since the characteristics exist prior to arising, whose characteristics are they?

original: mtshan gzhi zhig na yang gang gi yin te /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi zhig na yang gang gi yin te /
translated: And when the basis of those characteristics is destroyed, whose are they?

original: rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i lugs kyis ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i lugs kyis ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /

original: ji ltar med pa skye ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa skye ba ltar /

analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar dngos po med pa bdag nyid du ma red pa skye ba ltar /

analyzed: skyes zin pa yang skye na ni thug pa med de mtha' thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'on te snga na yod na'ang rung //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'on te snga na yod na'ang rung // zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhung lugs tha dad pa'i don yin te /

translated: If your position is that an existent entity arises, then in our system also an existent entity arises, because according to the Vaibhāṣika system, the future exists, and according to the Sautrāntika system, the seed that is the generating phenomenon exists.

original: de'i phyir sngar phrad nas phyis skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skye ba'i sngon rol na 'ga' yang med ces bya ba 'di ci ste brjod /

translated: Therefore, why do you say, “That which arises after making contact with something that existed previously does not exist prior to arising”?

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gal te yod pa kho na skye na ni 'o na ni 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / dbyu gu la sogs pa la mi ltos par sngar bum pa rang las rab tu grub pa yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //

translated: In another way, if only what exists is produced, then it would follow that the pot would exist prior to the lump of clay, the stick, etc., without depending on them, since it is produced from itself.🔽Others say:🔽If it is not produced from itself,

analyzed: lhan cig pa la'ang de yod de // zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / bya ba dus mnyam pa la'ang ste //

original: mun pa mar me dang phrad pa de nyid kyi tshe med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mun pa mar me dang phrad pa de nyid kyi tshe med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Darkness does not exist at the very time it makes contact with the lamp.

original: ji ste 'di ni de ma thag tu yin gyi cig car ni ma yin no snyam du sems na de'i phyir yang kha gdangs nyal bzhin zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: ji ste 'di ni de ma thag tu yin gyi cig car ni ma yin no snyam du sems na de'i phyir yang kha gdangs nyal bzhin zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: If you think that this is not immediate but rather simultaneous, then the text says, “As if asleep with open mouth.”

original: 'dir kha gdangs shing bgrad la phyis nyal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir kha gdangs shing bgrad la phyis nyal ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, one does not first open one’s mouth and then fall asleep.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gang zhig kha gdangs shing nyal ba de la kha gdangs te nyal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig kha gdangs shing nyal ba de la kha gdangs te nyal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: One who is asleep with an open mouth is said to be “asleep with an open mouth.”

original: 'on te 'di sngar kha gdangs la phyis nyal lo zhes bya bar /
analyzed: 'on te 'di sngar kha gdangs la phyis nyal lo zhes bya bar /
translated: But if one says, “He opened his mouth before and then went to sleep,”

original: 'dod na de'i phyir gal te phyis //
analyzed: 'dod na de'i phyir gal te phyis //
translated: then, if that is so,

original: btsums pa la yang ci phyir min //
analyzed: btsums pa la yang ci phyir min //
translated: why not also say that he closed his eyes later?

original: 'ga' zhig kha gdangs nas de ma thag tu btsums te nyal ba gang yin pa de la kha gdangs te nyal lo zhes brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kha gdangs nas de ma thag tu btsums te nyal ba gang yin pa de la kha gdangs te nyal lo zhes brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If someone opened his mouth and then immediately closed it and went to sleep, it would be said that he went to sleep with his mouth open.

original: brjod pa'ang ma yin te /🔽de'i phyir gang zhig kha gdangs bzhin du nyal ba de la /
analyzed: brjod pa'ang ma yin te / de'i phyir gang zhig kha gdangs bzhin du nyal ba de la /
translated: But that is not said.🔽Therefore, it is understood that one who goes to sleep with his mouth open

original: kha gdangs shing nyal lo zhes bya'o zhes bya ba shes so //
analyzed: kha gdangs shing nyal lo zhes bya'o zhes bya ba shes so //
translated: is said to go to sleep with his mouth open.

original: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Others say:

original: btsun pa dpal len to //
analyzed: btsun pa dpal len to //
translated: The Venerable Śrīlāta.

original: rten cing 'brel ba ni zlos pa'i don yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel ba ni zlos pa'i don yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of “repetition” is that it is dependent and related.

original: bya ba dang yon tan dag gi tshig sna tshogs kyis brjod par bya ba'i gzhi thams cad khyab par bya bar 'dod pa ni zlos pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba dang yon tan dag gi tshig sna tshogs kyis brjod par bya ba'i gzhi thams cad khyab par bya bar 'dod pa ni zlos pa ste /
translated: The meaning of “repetition” is the desire to pervade all bases of expression with various words of action and qualities.

original: rten cing @285b 'brel bar zhes bya ba ni de dag ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rten cing @285b 'brel bar zhes bya ba ni de dag ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The term pratītyasamutpāda indicates that they are produced in dependence.

original: 'gro zhing 'jig par rung ba ste mi sdod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro zhing 'jig par rung ba ste mi sdod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are fit to go and to perish, that is, they do not remain.

original: sam zhes bya ba'i nye bar bsgyur bas ni 'du ba'i don ston par byed do //
analyzed: sam zhes bya ba'i nye bar bsgyur bas ni 'du ba'i don ston par byed do //
translated: The prefix sam indicates the meaning of collection.

original: au ta gong na yod pa'i ba da ni 'byung ba'i don te zhes bya ba ni skad kyi dbyings bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: au ta gong na yod pa'i ba da ni 'byung ba'i don te zhes bya ba ni skad kyi dbyings bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The prefix u indicates the meaning of origination, because the verbal root is changed.

original: tshogs pa de dang de na zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar zhes bya ba zlos pa'i don yin pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: tshogs pa de dang de na zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar zhes bya ba zlos pa'i don yin pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The term in this and that indicates the meaning of repetition of the term pratītya in the compound pratītyasamutpāda.

original: 'gror rung ba ste ngang gis 'jig pa'i chos rnams 'dus nas skye ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gror rung ba ste ngang gis 'jig pa'i chos rnams 'dus nas skye ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: The origination of things that are fit to go, that is, that perish by their very nature, when they are assembled, is called dependent origination.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni lhan cig 'byung bar nges pas chos gcig pu skye ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni lhan cig 'byung bar nges pas chos gcig pu skye ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Since form, etc., are definitely coexistent, there is no single thing that is originated.

original: 'dod na dgra med rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: 'dod na dgra med rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: In the desire realm, there is no enemy, and there are eight substances of atoms,🔽 up to

original: ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba nas /
translated: and so on.

original: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig /
analyzed: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig /
translated: Minds and mental factors are necessarily simultaneous.🔽

original: ces bya ba'i bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained that mind and mental factors definitely arise simultaneously.🔽This conception is not tenable in this sūtra🔽because it is illogical and the meaning is untenable.

original: rtog pa 'di ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel ba ni zlos pa'i don to zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'di kho na la rung gi mig dang gzugs rnams la
analyzed: rtog pa 'di ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel ba ni zlos pa'i don to zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'di kho na la rung gi mig dang gzugs rnams la
translated: This conception is not tenable in this sūtra alone, which is called dependent origination because it is dependent origination that has the meaning of repetition.🔽How is it tenable in the statement, “Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form”?

original: brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la ji ltar gtub te don du mi rung ba'i phyir mig la brten cing mig la brten nas zhes bya bar tshig bsdu ba ni mi srid kyi /
analyzed: brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la ji ltar gtub te don du mi rung ba'i phyir mig la brten cing mig la brten nas zhes bya bar tshig bsdu ba ni mi srid kyi /
translated: Because the meaning is untenable, it is impossible to compound the words in dependence on the eye and in dependence on the eye into the statement “Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.”

original: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten cing phrad nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin par shes so //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten cing phrad nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin par shes so //
translated: One should understand that the meaning of this statement is that eye consciousness arises in dependence on and in contact with the eye and form.

original: de'i phyir tshig gi don 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba klan ka rgyas par smras pa gang yin pa de so na 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gi don 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba klan ka rgyas par smras pa gang yin pa de so na 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: The extensive refutation remains as it is.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: byed pa po gcig gi bya ba gnyis ni dus sngar te zhes bya ba'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig gi bya ba gnyis ni dus sngar te zhes bya ba'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The condition “arising from the prior” is the two actions of a single agent,

original: khrus byas te bza'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin na sngar mig dang gzugs rnams dang phrad nas byis skye bar 'gyur pa gang yin pa mig gi rnam par shes pa de ni skye ba'i sngon rol na 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: khrus byas te bza'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin na sngar mig dang gzugs rnams dang phrad nas byis skye bar 'gyur pa gang yin pa mig gi rnam par shes pa de ni skye ba'i sngon rol na 'ga' yang med la /
translated: as in “having bathed, he eats.” But prior to the arising of eye consciousness, there is no eye consciousness that has already made contact with eyes and forms.

original: byed pa po med pa'i bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And there is no action without an agent.

original: nges par gzung ba'i don du rnam grangs gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i don du rnam grangs gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The two synonyms are stated for the sake of ascertainment.

original: 'di yod na zhes bya ba de tsam zhig @286a * //
analyzed: 'di yod na zhes bya ba de tsam zhig @286a * //
translated: If one were to say “when this exists,”

original: brjod na ni ma rig pa yod pa 'ba' zhig gis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brjod na ni ma rig pa yod pa 'ba' zhig gis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: only the existence of ignorance would not give rise to formations.

original: gzhan yang yod na yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yod na yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if it exists, it is understood that it is.

original: dper na mig yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba mig kho na yod na zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na mig yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba mig kho na yod na zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: For example, when it is said, “If the eye exists, eye-consciousness arises,” it is not ascertained that “only if the eye exists,”

original: des na gzugs yod na 'byung ngo zhes bya bar shes par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: des na gzugs yod na 'byung ngo zhes bya bar shes par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: so it is understood that it arises if form exists.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya ba rnam grangs gnyis pa 'dis ni 'di kho na skyes pas 'di skye'i gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes rnam grangs gong ma nyid nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya ba rnam grangs gnyis pa 'dis ni 'di kho na skyes pas 'di skye'i gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes rnam grangs gong ma nyid nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: This second formulation, “This arises due to the arising of that,” ascertains the previous formulation, “This arises due to the existence of that,” because it shows that only this arises due to the arising of that, not from another.

original: yan lag brgyud par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yan lag brgyud par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to show the continuity of the members,🔽he says,

original: zhes bya ba ni yan lag 'di ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yan lag 'di ste /
translated: This is the member.

original: ma rig pa'i yan lag yod na 'du byed kyi yan lag 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i yan lag yod na 'du byed kyi yan lag 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: If the member of ignorance exists, this member of formation arises.

original: yan lag 'di ste 'du byed kyi yan lag 'di skyes pas rnam par shes pa'i yan lag 'di skye'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yan lag 'di ste 'du byed kyi yan lag 'di skyes pas rnam par shes pa'i yan lag 'di skye'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This link, the link of formation, produces this link, the link of consciousness.

original: yan lag gzhan dag brgyud pa'ang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan dag brgyud pa'ang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other links should be described in the same way.

original: yang na tshe brgyud par zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang na tshe brgyud par zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: Or, what is the meaning of the term “series of lives”?

original: bstan pa'i phyir rnam grangs gnyis gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir rnam grangs gnyis gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: To explain this, he says, “Two types are mentioned.”🔽He says, “Two types are mentioned in order to show the nature of conditions as direct and indirect causes.”🔽The phrase “Two types are mentioned” should be supplied.

original: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa mngon sum dang / brgyud pa'i rgyun gyis rkyen gyi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir rnam grangs gnyis gsungs pa yin te /🔽'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya bas ni mngon sum gyi rkyen gyi ngo bo ston to //
analyzed: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa mngon sum dang / brgyud pa'i rgyun gyis rkyen gyi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir rnam grangs gnyis gsungs pa yin te / 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya bas ni mngon sum gyi rkyen gyi ngo bo ston to //
translated: The phrase “Two types are mentioned” is supplied because the two types of condition are mentioned in order to show the nature of conditions as direct and indirect causes.🔽The phrase “This exists, that occurs” shows the nature of a direct condition.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya bas ni brgyud pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya bas ni brgyud pa'o //
translated: The phrase “This arises, that arises” shows the nature of an indirect condition.

original: de la mngon sum ni gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can gyi 'du byed 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la mngon sum ni gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can gyi 'du byed 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Direct perception is when afflicted formative factors arise immediately after ignorance.

original: brgyud pa ni gang gi tshe dge ba 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: brgyud pa ni gang gi tshe dge ba 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Indirect perception is when virtue arises,

original: dge ba'i gnas skabs na ma rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas skabs na ma rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ignorance does not exist in the context of virtue.

original: gzhan yang ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi mngon sum gyi rkyen yin la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i ni brgyud pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi mngon sum gyi rkyen yin la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i ni brgyud pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, ignorance is the direct condition of formative factors and the indirect condition of consciousness and so on.

original: 'di skad du ma rig pa'i yan lag yod pas 'du byed kyi yan lag 'byung ba la 'du byed kyi yan lag 'di skyes pas brgyud pa'i ma rig @286b pa'i rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du ma rig pa'i yan lag yod pas 'du byed kyi yan lag 'byung ba la 'du byed kyi yan lag 'di skyes pas brgyud pa'i ma rig @286b pa'i rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is because it is said that when the link of ignorance exists, the link of formative factors arises and when the link of formative factors arises, consciousness arises indirectly due to the condition of ignorance.

original: de thams cad ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin no //
translated: All of this is the master's system.🔽Others say: In order to refute that,

original: gzhan dag na re dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan chos kyi dbyig go //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan chos kyi dbyig go //
translated: the elder Dharmapāla says:

original: rgyu med na dngos po mi 'byung zhes bya bas ni rnam grangs dang pos rgyu med par smra ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med na dngos po mi 'byung zhes bya bas ni rnam grangs dang pos rgyu med par smra ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: “If there is no cause, an entity does not arise” refutes the assertion of causelessness by the first alternative.

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa skye ba med pa dang ldan pa rtag pa las kyang chung zad kyang mi skye'o zhes bya bas ni rnam grangs gnyis pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa skye ba med pa dang ldan pa rtag pa las kyang chung zad kyang mi skye'o zhes bya bas ni rnam grangs gnyis pas so //
translated: “Not even the slightest thing arises from a permanent cause, such as a creator god, which is devoid of arising,” refutes the second alternative.

original: slob dpon gyis rtog pa 'di la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rtog pa 'di la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The master says, “In this theory,” and so on.

original: tshig snga ma smos pa don med par gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: tshig snga ma smos pa don med par gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: “The statement of the former words would be meaningless” refers to “if this exists, that arises.”

original: smra ba gnyi ga dgag pa 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs 'di kho nas rgyu yod pa nyid dang skye ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid dang / rgyu med pa nyid dang rgyu rtag pa nyid du smra ba'i mtshan nyid can gnyis dgag pa 'grub pas de'i phyir rnam grangs snga ma don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smra ba gnyi ga dgag pa 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs 'di kho nas rgyu yod pa nyid dang skye ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid dang / rgyu med pa nyid dang rgyu rtag pa nyid du smra ba'i mtshan nyid can gnyis dgag pa 'grub pas de'i phyir rnam grangs snga ma don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Because both assertions are refuted” means that just by this enumeration, “When this exists, that arises,” the two assertions of the existence of a cause and the possession of arising are refuted, and the assertion of the absence of a cause and the permanence of a cause is refuted. Therefore, the former enumeration is pointless.

original: 'o na ni gang la la dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgol ba gang la la dag bdag rten du gyur pa ste /🔽ma rig pa'i rten du gyur pa yod pas 'du byed la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang la la dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgol ba gang la la dag bdag rten du gyur pa ste / ma rig pa'i rten du gyur pa yod pas 'du byed la sogs pa ste /
translated: “But some say” and so on is an objection. Some opponents conceive that since the self exists as a support,🔽that is, as the support of ignorance, formations and so on arise and are produced.

original: 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung zhing skye bar rtog par byed la ma rig pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung zhing skye bar rtog par byed la ma rig pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: They conceive that since ignorance and so on exist,

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa skyes pas de dag skye bar rtog par byed pa yod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa skyes pas de dag skye bar rtog par byed pa yod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: “When this exists, that comes to be” is supplied in the passage.

original: rgyu de'i phyir smra ba de dag gi rtog pa de bsal zhing dgag par nges par gzung ba 'di mdzad pa yin te bzlog pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir smra ba de dag gi rtog pa de bsal zhing dgag par nges par gzung ba 'di mdzad pa yin te bzlog pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: For this reason, the Buddha definitely declared that the theory of those who propound causation should be refuted and rejected.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang zhig skyes pas zhes bya ba nas sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar smras so //
analyzed: gang zhig skyes pas zhes bya ba nas sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar smras so //
translated: “When this exists, that comes to be” up to “only this great mass of suffering comes to be.”

original: gang zhig skyes pas gang skye ba ni de nyid yod pas de 'byung gi gzhan bdag yod pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig skyes pas gang skye ba ni de nyid yod pas de 'byung gi gzhan bdag yod pas ni ma yin te /
translated: When this exists, that comes to be, because that arises due to the existence of that alone, not due to the existence of another self.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du @287a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du @287a * //
translated: For example,🔽due to the condition of ignorance, formations exist.

original: byed dag ni ma rig pa kho na yod pas 'du byed rnams 'byung gi gzhan yod pas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: byed dag ni ma rig pa kho na yod pas 'du byed rnams 'byung gi gzhan yod pas ni ma yin la /
translated: Due to the existence of ignorance alone, formations arise, not due to the existence of another.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Thus, this entire great mass of suffering originates.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it that this is so?

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Due to the condition of birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, despair, and distress🔽originate. Thus, this entire great mass of suffering originates.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ba skye ba kho na yod pas rga shi la sogs pa 'byung gi /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ba skye ba kho na yod pas rga shi la sogs pa 'byung gi /
translated: Aging, death, and so on originate due to the existence of birth alone,

original: gzhan pa dag yod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag yod pas ni ma yin no //

original: de lta ma yin te 'di skad du 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes brjod na ni bdag rten du gyur pas ma rig pa la sogs pa yod pas 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo zhes smra bar yang 'gyur ro //

original: 'on te yang 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya bar rnam grangs gnyis pa kho na brjod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya bar rnam grangs gnyis pa kho na brjod par gyur na /

analyzed: bdag rten du gyur pa yod pas yin no zhes bya bar rtog par 'gyur te /

original: de'i phyir gang zhig skyes pas skye ba de kho na yod pas de 'byung gi gzhan bdag rten du gyur pa yod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam grangs gnyis kyis nges par 'dzin par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig skyes pas skye ba de kho na yod pas de 'byung gi gzhan bdag rten du gyur pa yod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam grangs gnyis kyis nges par 'dzin par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha taught in two ways: “That which arises due to the arising of this exists, and that which ceases due to the cessation of this ceases.”

original: slob dpon dag ces bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams so //

analyzed: sngar ni 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o //
