analyzed: phyis ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung ngo zhes brjod par bya dgos na /
translated: Later, it would be necessary to say, “Because this exists, that arises.”

original: de lta yang ma yin te de'i phyir de'i don ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te de'i phyir de'i don ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case, so the meaning of the sutra is not as you claim.

original: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len to //
analyzed: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len to //
translated: “Again, it is said” refers to the Venerable Shrīlāta.

original: slob dpon gyis slar smras pa ni /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis slar smras pa ni /
translated: The Master responds:

original: gal te mdo'i don de yin par gyur na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gal te mdo'i don de yin par gyur na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: “If that were the meaning of the sutra,” etc.

original: 'di yod pas 'di mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba kho nar bka' stsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dgag pa kho nas mi 'byung bar bstan na rigs pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba kho nar bka' stsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dgag pa kho nas mi 'byung bar bstan na rigs pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: “It would be necessary to say, ‘Because this exists, that does not arise,’” etc. This shows that it is reasonable to teach that it does not arise only through negation.

original: sngar ni 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa ni skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir sngar 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: sngar ni 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa ni skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir sngar 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: “Previously, it was said, ‘When this arises, that arises,’” etc. Since destruction is preceded by arising, it would be necessary to say, “Because this arose, that arises.”

original: mdo las skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / sme sngags 'don pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa de dag ni rga shis bsdus pa kho na yin te /🔽yan lag gzhan ma yin par khong du @288a * //
analyzed: mdo las skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / sme sngags 'don pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa de dag ni rga shis bsdus pa kho na yin te / yan lag gzhan ma yin par khong du @288a * //
translated: They are subsumed by aging and death alone.

original: chud par bya'o //
analyzed: chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are not separate branches.

original: de la sems can dang sems can du mi bgrang ba'i yul yongs su gyur pa dang / lus yongs su gyur pa las de dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la sems can dang sems can du mi bgrang ba'i yul yongs su gyur pa dang / lus yongs su gyur pa las de dag 'byung ste /
translated: They arise from the transformation of the object, whether it is a sentient being or not a sentient being, and the transformation of the body.

original: yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa ni mya ngan no //
translated: The conception associated with unhappiness is sorrow.

original: mya ngan gyis kun nas bslang ba'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan gyis kun nas bslang ba'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: Speech motivated by sorrow is lamentation.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag ni bshad zin to //
translated: Suffering and unhappiness have already been explained.

original: yid mi bde ba'i shugs zad pa ni 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i shugs zad pa ni 'khrug pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of the force of unhappiness is strife.

original: gzhan dag na re yid mi bde ba ni mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ngal ba yin no zhes zer ro //🔽byis pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba na byis pa ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re yid mi bde ba ni mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ngal ba yin no zhes zer ro // byis pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba na byis pa ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: Others say: Mental dissatisfaction is fatigue preceded by sorrow and lamentation.🔽The passage beginning The fool, etc., is stated in order to explain the meaning of the verse. The fool is the ordinary man.

original: 'du byed tsam zhes bya ba la tsam zhes bya ba smos pas ni bdag dgag pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'du byed tsam zhes bya ba la tsam zhes bya ba smos pas ni bdag dgag pa'i don to //
translated: The word mere in the phrase mere formations excludes the self.

original: mi shes pas zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ma 'dres pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: mi shes pas zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ma 'dres pa ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase through ignorance shows that ignorance is unmixed.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase clinging to the view of self and to the notion that this is mine shows that the view of self and the pride that thinks I am are the basis.

original: lus la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase in regard to the body, etc., means in regard to the body, speech, and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i las rnam pa gsum rtsom ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i las rnam pa gsum rtsom ste /
translated: One creates the three kinds of karma, meritorious, non-meritorious, and unmoving, through body, speech, and mind.

original: tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don du ni bsod nams zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i tshe la bde ba'i don du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las dge ba'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don du ni bsod nams zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i tshe la bde ba'i don du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las dge ba'o //
translated: Meritorious means virtuous karma in the desire realm that is done for the sake of happiness in future lives.

original: bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i don du ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du ni bde ba'i don du gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i don du ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du ni bde ba'i don du gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: The meaning of “neither pleasure nor pain” is up to the third absorption, virtuous form realm states are for the sake of pleasure.

original: de yan chad ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de yan chad ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i don du'o //
translated: Beyond that, they are for the sake of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: tshe 'di la bde ba'i don du ni bsod nams ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la bde ba la ltos nas de byas kyi phyi ma la bde ba la ltos te ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde ba'i don du ni bsod nams ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la bde ba la ltos nas de byas kyi phyi ma la bde ba la ltos te ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Nonvirtuous karma is for the sake of pleasure in this life because it is done in dependence on pleasure in this life, but it is not done in dependence on pleasure in the next life.

original: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis te /🔽ji skad bshad pa'i las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis te / ji skad bshad pa'i las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis /
translated: Karma projects one to a birthplace through the power of projecting karma.

original: me 'bar ba 'gro ba'i tshul du dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: me 'bar ba 'gro ba'i tshul du dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Through the power of projecting karma, as previously explained, one proceeds to that and that birthplace such as the hells, in the manner of proceeding to a blazing fire.

original: dper na rtsva ring po la btang ba'i me @288b 'bar ba 'gro'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rgyun yang srid pa bar ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis yul thag ring por yang 'gro ba de dang der 'gro'o //🔽de ltar bshad na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dper na rtsva ring po la btang ba'i me @288b 'bar ba 'gro'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rgyun yang srid pa bar ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis yul thag ring por yang 'gro ba de dang der 'gro'o // de ltar bshad na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas bzung ste /
translated: For example, just as it is said that fire burns when it is set to long grass, so too consciousness goes to and from various places by the stream of the intermediate existence because it is connected to the stream of the intermediate existence.

original: skye ba'i skad cig ma'i bar 'di thams cad yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i skad cig ma'i bar 'di thams cad yin te /
translated: If it is explained in this way, then the stream of consciousness that is conditioned by formations is all of this, from the mind that links with the intermediate existence up to the moment of birth.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug car 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug car 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa yin par 'dod na /
translated: If it is asserted that the six collections of consciousness are consciousness that is conditioned by formations,

original: rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan pa ste /
translated: then the branch of consciousness is taught.

original: gsum pa rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan pa las /
analyzed: gsum pa rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan pa las /
translated: The third is the teaching on the branch of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bshad pa de 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bshad pa de 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is correct to explain that the sixfold collection of consciousness is the condition for the formation of name-and-form.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: gal te 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi rgyun yin par mi bzhed kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems kho na yin par bzhed par gyur na ni 'di las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bshad par🔽mi 'gyur gyi /🔽'di skad du rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi rgyun yin par mi bzhed kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems kho na yin par bzhed par gyur na ni 'di las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bshad par mi 'gyur gyi / 'di skad du rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: if the consciousness that is the condition for formation were not asserted to be the continuum of the sixfold collection of consciousness, but were asserted to be the mind that links to rebirth, then this explanation would not be correct.🔽It would be necessary to say, “What is consciousness?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is mental consciousness.”

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la ni rnam par shes pa lnga 'byung ba med de /🔽'chad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags 'bral //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la ni rnam par shes pa lnga 'byung ba med de / 'chad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags 'bral //
translated: The five sense consciousnesses do not occur in the moment of linking to rebirth.🔽Birth, death, desire,

original: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba rnams //
analyzed: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba rnams //
translated: degeneration, and linking to rebirth

original: yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be mental consciousness alone.

original: ces 'byung bas yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nas nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces 'byung bas yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nas nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only the mental consciousness links with death.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las de skad bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las de skad bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo las /
translated: The explanation in the Exposition of the Elements is like that because the Dependent Origination Sutra explains:

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'byed pa las ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'byed pa las ming gang zhe na /
translated: What is name?

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
translated: The four name aggregates.

original: gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is form?🔽Any form whatsoever, up to and including the most refined form.

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ba zhes bya ba nas rgyas par gzugs gang yin pa dang / ming gang yin pa de gnyis ni ming dang gzugs zhes @289a * //🔽bya'o zhes de skad du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ba zhes bya ba nas rgyas par gzugs gang yin pa dang / ming gang yin pa de gnyis ni ming dang gzugs zhes @289a * // bya'o zhes de skad du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Name and form are called name and form.

original: 'dod pa'i sred pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa'o //

original: rig pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //🔽mig la sogs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba la sogs pa yang ma rig pa yin par thal bar 'gyur te /

translated: It is that which is not knowledge.🔽The consequence is that the eyes, etc. would also be ignorance.

original: de dag kyang rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eyes, ears, etc. would also be ignorance because they are not knowledge.

original: ci yang ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te ma rig pa rig pa med pa yin na rdzas su med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci yang ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te ma rig pa rig pa med pa yin na rdzas su med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It would be nothing at all. If ignorance were the absence of knowledge, it would not exist substantially.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi dngos por bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi dngos por bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is also unreasonable because it is taught as a condition.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar dgag pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //

translated: It is the opposite of that. He shows that it is a negation that is the opposite of that.

original: mdza' bo las gzhan pa gang yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: mdza' bo las gzhan pa gang yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Nor is it something other than a friend. The phrase “nor is it something other than a friend” indicates that it is not a mere non-entity.

original: mdza' ba med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni med pa yang ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: mdza' ba med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni med pa yang ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Nor is it the absence of a friend. The phrase “nor is it the absence of a friend” indicates that it is not a mere non-existent.

original: chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rigs pa ma yin pa dang / tha snyad ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rigs pa ma yin pa dang / tha snyad ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: Nor is it something that is not a dharma, not a meaning, not an action, etc. The phrase “etc.” includes that which is not a principle, that which is not a convention, that which is not a human being, etc.

original: chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang / don dang / bya ba dang / rig pa dang tha snyad dang mig la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa yin gyi chos la sogs pa las @290b gzhan pa mig la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de yang ma yin la /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang / don dang / bya ba dang / rig pa dang tha snyad dang mig la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa yin gyi chos la sogs pa las @290b gzhan pa mig la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not something that is incompatible with a dharma, etc. It is not something that is incompatible with a dharma, a meaning, an action, a principle, a convention, an eye, etc. It is not something that is other than a dharma, etc., nor is it an eye, etc.

original: chos la sogs pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the absence of a dharma, etc.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ga las she na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes 'byung bas rkyen gyi dngos por bstan pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa rnams la 'du byed med pa'i phyir rig pa ma
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ga las she na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes 'byung bas rkyen gyi dngos por bstan pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa rnams la 'du byed med pa'i phyir rig pa ma
translated: Why is that? Because it is stated that ignorance is a condition of formation.🔽It is not logical that other eyes and so on are conditions because they are not conditions of arhats who lack formation.

original: yin pa gzhan mig la sogs pa yang rkyen gyi dngos por bstan par rigs pa ma yin la rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yin pa gzhan mig la sogs pa yang rkyen gyi dngos por bstan par rigs pa ma yin la rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor are they nonconditions, like the horns of a rabbit.🔽It is said that ignorance is a fetter and so on.

original: ma rig pa ni kun du sbyar ba nas sbyor ba'i bar yin par brjod do zhes bya ba ni mdo dag las ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba nas ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni kun du sbyar ba nas sbyor ba'i bar yin par brjod do zhes bya ba ni mdo dag las ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba nas ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sūtras state that there is the fetter of ignorance and so on up to the bond of ignorance.

original: med pa tsam ni de lta bu yin par 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa yin par 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa tsam ni de lta bu yin par 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa yin par 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not suitable that mere non-existence is that. The meaning is that it is not suitable that the fetters, etc. are that.

original: mig la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin par 'os pa ma yin no zhes de ltar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin par 'os pa ma yin no zhes de ltar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is not suitable that the eyes, etc. are that.

original: de yang lta ba'i rang bzhin yin pas ma rig pa yin par mi rung do zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang ma rig pa dag kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa nyid du tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang lta ba'i rang bzhin yin pas ma rig pa yin par mi rung do zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang ma rig pa dag kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa nyid du tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is not suitable as ignorance because it has the nature of view. The meaning is that view and ignorance are stated separately as fetters, etc.

original: 'o na ni gang lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
translated: If that is so, then what is not of the nature of view? It is any afflicted wisdom concomitant with attachment, etc.

original: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir //
analyzed: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir //
translated: Because it is concomitant with that view.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is because it is concomitant with ignorance.

original: ji ltar na lta ba ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lta ba ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: How is view associated with ignorance?

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rmongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa'i nang na 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rmongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa'i nang na 'byung la /
translated: Delusion that has the characteristic of ignorance occurs among the mental factors that are the great grounds.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa thams cad kyang mang po pa rnams dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa thams cad kyang mang po pa rnams dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur pas /
translated: And since all the great grounds are associated with the great grounds,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i lta ba shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid dang ma rig par mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i lta ba shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid dang ma rig par mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: it is understood that the view of the transitory collection and so on, which are the nature of wisdom, are associated with ignorance.

original: de lta bas na shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis mtshungs @291a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis mtshungs @291a * //
translated: Thus two substances of wisdom are not associated.

original: par mi ldan pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni shes rab ma yin no //
analyzed: par mi ldan pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni shes rab ma yin no //
translated: Therefore ignorance is not wisdom.

original: ma rig pas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi 'dag go zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa'i tshul gyis ma rig pa shes rab las don gzhan du gyur pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: ma rig pas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi 'dag go zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa'i tshul gyis ma rig pa shes rab las don gzhan du gyur pa yin par ston to //
translated: Wisdom that is afflicted by ignorance is impure. This is taught by way of example to demonstrate that ignorance is a different object than wisdom.

original: shes rab de nyid shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par yang rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par bstan pas ma rig pa shes rab las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab de nyid shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par yang rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par bstan pas ma rig pa shes rab las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
translated: This is because ignorance is taught to be a secondary affliction of wisdom, and thus ignorance is a different object of negation than wisdom,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags bzhin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags bzhin no //
translated: just like attachment.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar sems kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags rigs tha dad pa gzhan yin pa ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar sems kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags rigs tha dad pa gzhan yin pa ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said in more detail: Just as the secondary affliction of the mind, attachment, is a different type.

original: 'dres na rnam par mi 'dag ces bya ba ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can bar bar du 'byung ba dang 'dres na skad cig ma gzhan las byung ba'i shes rab dge ba rnam par mi 'dag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dres na rnam par mi 'dag ces bya ba ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can bar bar du 'byung ba dang 'dres na skad cig ma gzhan las byung ba'i shes rab dge ba rnam par mi 'dag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it were mixed, it would not be purified. This means that if wisdom that is afflicted sometimes occurs and is mixed, then the virtuous wisdom that arises in other moments would not be purified.

original: gdon mi za bar 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa yin nam ci zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa yin nam ci zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said, Undoubtedly, it is completely bound by attachment, which means that it is associated with attachment.

original: de ni 'dod chags kyis de ltar nye bar bcom pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kun du spyod pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags kyis de ltar nye bar bcom pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kun du spyod pas ma yin gyi /
translated: It is said, It is completely destroyed by attachment, but not by the practice of attachment.

original: de ni bag chags bzhag pas nye bar bcom pa yin la rnal 'byor ba bag chags de ste gnas ngan len de rnam par bzlog par ni sems de rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bag chags bzhag pas nye bar bcom pa yin la rnal 'byor ba bag chags de ste gnas ngan len de rnam par bzlog par ni sems de rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is completely destroyed by the establishment of the latent afflictions. The yogi who turns away from that latent affliction, that negative reflex action, liberates the mind.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab rnam par mi 'dag ces bya ba ni de'i phyir shes rab ma rig pa yin yang nyes pa med do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab rnam par mi 'dag ces bya ba ni de'i phyir shes rab ma rig pa yin yang nyes pa med do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Similarly, it is said, The wisdom that is afflicted by ignorance is not purified, which shows that even though wisdom is ignorance, there is no fault.

original: yongs su rtog pa la ni su zhig zlog / ces bya ba ni de ni rtog pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa la ni su zhig zlog / ces bya ba ni de ni rtog pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Who can stop the imagination? It is mere imagination.

original: lung la mi ltos pa yin no zhes bya bar ston to //🔽gang yang nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa yin no snyam du sems pa zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len to //
analyzed: lung la mi ltos pa yin no zhes bya bar ston to // gang yang nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa yin no snyam du sems pa zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not dependent on scripture.🔽The Bhadanta🔽says that all defilements are ignorance.

original: 'di snyam du ma rig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spyi'i @291b ming yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ma rig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spyi'i @291b ming yin gyi /
translated: He thinks that ignorance is the general name for all defilements.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma gtogs par ma rig pa ni med do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma gtogs par ma rig pa ni med do snyam du sems so //
translated: Apart from the defilements such as attachment, there is no such thing as ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir snyam du sems she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam du sems she na /
translated: Why does he think that?🔽Because the Buddha said in a Sutra:

original: sangs rgyas kyis tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che chen po rab tu mi shes shing rab tu mi shes te de lta bas na ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i mdo de'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che chen po rab tu mi shes shing rab tu mi shes te de lta bas na ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i mdo de'i phyir te /
translated: “Venerable Mahakatyayana, it is not known, not known, and therefore it is called ignorance.”

original: nyon mongs pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yang log par 'dzin pa'i phyir mi shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yang log par 'dzin pa'i phyir mi shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni yin no //
translated: The defilements such as the afflicted view of the self are also by nature a lack of knowledge, because they are mistaken graspings.

original: de'i yang 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni btsun pa de'i yang dag pa smos pa 'di nyid kyis brtsal zhing bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i yang 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni btsun pa de'i yang dag pa smos pa 'di nyid kyis brtsal zhing bkag pa yin te /
translated: The root text continues, “Because of this, it is not tenable to say that ignorance is a separate mental factor.”

original: de'i gzhung lugs zhes bya ba zhig khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de'i gzhung lugs zhes bya ba zhig khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: The Vaibhāṣika position is being refuted.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: smras pa / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin na kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du yang logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin na kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du yang logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If ignorance were the nature of all the mental afflictions, it would not be explained separately among the fetters and so on.

original: kun du sbyor ba lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: The fetter of ignorance would not be explained separately as the fetter of ignorance among the fetters of attachment and so on, because it would not be distinct from the remaining fetters.🔽The sutras state, “The fetters of attachment and aversion,”🔽and then later,

original: 'dod chags kyi 'ching ba dang zhe sdang gi 'ching ba zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'ching ba dang zhe sdang gi 'ching ba zhes gsungs nas /
translated: “The fetters of attachment and aversion are abandoned.”

original: gti mug gi 'ching ba zhes bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs nas /
analyzed: gti mug gi 'ching ba zhes bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs nas /
translated: The term “bond of delusion” and the term “the negative tendency of attachment to pleasure” would not be stated separately.

original: ma rig pa'i phra rgyas zhes bya ba dang / chu bo dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i chu bo zhes bya ba dang / sbyor ba dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba logs shig tu bshad par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du yang ma reg pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa bshad do
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phra rgyas zhes bya ba dang / chu bo dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i chu bo zhes bya ba dang / sbyor ba dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba logs shig tu bshad par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du yang ma reg pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa bshad do
translated: The term “the negative tendency of ignorance” and the term “the river of ignorance” among the four rivers and the term “the fetter of ignorance” among the four fetters would not be stated separately.

original: // ci'i phyir phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa med ce na /🔽lta ba dang lta bar ram /
analyzed: // ci'i phyir phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa med ce na / lta ba dang lta bar ram /
translated: Why are they not mutually concomitant?

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags su mtshungs par ldan pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags su mtshungs par ldan pa ni med do //
translated: There is no concomitance of view with view or of attachment with attachment.

original: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa nyid yin pas lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan par yang bshad de /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa nyid yin pas lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan par yang bshad de /
translated: But ignorance is explained as concomitant with view and so on because it is a universal mental affliction.

original: sa mang po pa'i ni mtshungs par ldan par nges pa'i phyir ro //🔽sems kyang ma rig pas nye bar @292a * //
analyzed: sa mang po pa'i ni mtshungs par ldan par nges pa'i phyir ro // sems kyang ma rig pas nye bar @292a * //
translated: because the universal mental factors are definitely concomitant.

original: nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa kho nar bshad par 'gyur te /🔽ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa nyid smos pa kho nas 'dod chags la sogs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa nyid grub pa'i phyir 'di skad du 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa kho nar bshad par 'gyur te / ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa nyid smos pa kho nas 'dod chags la sogs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa nyid grub pa'i phyir 'di skad du 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems
translated: And the mind is explained as being afflicted only by ignorance.🔽Because it is stated that the mind is afflicted by ignorance alone, it is established that the mind is afflicted by attachment and so on.

original: zhes ni bshad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes ni bshad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it is not explained that the mind is afflicted by attachment.

original: 'on te bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir de skad du bshad do zhes bya bar 'dod na zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal gyis zhes nyon mongs pa thams cad smos par thal na mi rung bas 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid kyi ma rig pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni mi 'dag go zhes khyad par du bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir de skad du bshad do zhes bya bar 'dod na zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal gyis zhes nyon mongs pa thams cad smos par thal na mi rung bas 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid kyi ma rig pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni mi 'dag go zhes khyad par du bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you maintain that this is said in order to specify, then you must specify that the mind that is defiled by ignorance having the characteristic of attachment is not purified.

original: gal te 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you accept that,

original: 'o na ni sems la yang khyad par du brjod par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni sems la yang khyad par du brjod par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: then you must not specify the mind,

original: 'di skad du ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems ni rnam par mi 'dag go zhes bya ba kho na zhig brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems ni rnam par mi 'dag go zhes bya ba kho na zhig brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and you must say only that the mind that is defiled by ignorance is not purified.

original: gsal ba dang shes rab dang ye shes zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: gsal ba dang shes rab dang ye shes zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Clear, insight, and wisdom have the same meaning.

original: ma rig pa la ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yang mi gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin gsal ba ma yin pa don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yang mi gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin gsal ba ma yin pa don gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is meant by “non-clarity” is that which is not clarity.

original: mig la sogs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The same fault would also apply to the eye, etc.

original: 'o na ni gsal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni gsal ba med pa yin no //
translated: Well then, it is the absence of clarity.

original: de lta na ni ci'ang ma yin par 'gyur te rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni ci'ang ma yin par 'gyur te rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If that were so, it would be nothing at all, and that is not reasonable.

original: 'on te gsal ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa chos gzhan zhig yin no zhe na yang ma rig pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du de ci yin pa 'di mi shes so //
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa chos gzhan zhig yin no zhe na yang ma rig pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du de ci yin pa 'di mi shes so //
translated: If it is another quality that is the opposite of clarity, then just as with ignorance, we do not know what it is.

original: chos rnams bstan pa de lta bu yang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni las kyis rab tu phye ba de lta bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos rnams bstan pa de lta bu yang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni las kyis rab tu phye ba de lta bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is such a teaching of the Dharma, etc. means that there is such a teaching of the Dharma that is distinguished by action.

original: de lta bas na ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i chos gsal ba ma yin pa de 'ga' zhig yod de /
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i chos gsal ba ma yin pa de 'ga' zhig yod de /
translated: Therefore, the nature of ignorance is the non-clarity of the mind, which is the opposite of knowledge.

original: de'i las ni rig pa dang mi mthun pa nyid @292b yin no zhes las kyi byed pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i las ni rig pa dang mi mthun pa nyid @292b yin no zhes las kyi byed pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: Its action is the opposite of knowledge.🔽For example, what is the eye? It is the clarity of form that is the basis of eye-consciousness.

original: dper na mig gang zhe na gzugs dang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba go 'di bstan pa ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na mig gang zhe na gzugs dang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba go 'di bstan pa ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is the clarity of form not distinguished by its own nature? No, it is not.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not directly perceived and because it is always inferred from eye-consciousness.

original: nga'o snyam du sems can 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni mi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: nga'o snyam du sems can 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni mi shes pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement “sentient beings engage in the thought ‘I am’” is not understood.

original: gnas brtan des kyang 'di'i brjod par bya ba ni dmigs ma phyed do //
analyzed: gnas brtan des kyang 'di'i brjod par bya ba ni dmigs ma phyed do //
translated: The elder also did not distinguish the object of expression here.

original: mdo sde pa rnams kyis ni 'jug pa zhes bya ba ma rig pa rnam pa gzhan zhig yin par brjod do //
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyis ni 'jug pa zhes bya ba ma rig pa rnam pa gzhan zhig yin par brjod do //
translated: The Sautrantikas say that engagement is a different type of ignorance.

original: mdo las gsungs pa gang yin pa de yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa gang yin pa de yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is that it is the ignorance that is the root of cyclic existence.

original: btsun pa chos skyob kyi bsam pa ni sred pa la sogs pa logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'di ni ma rig pa rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan zhig smos pa yin no snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa chos skyob kyi bsam pa ni sred pa la sogs pa logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'di ni ma rig pa rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan zhig smos pa yin no snyam pa yin no //
translated: Bhadanta Dharmatrata thinks that since craving and so on are separately mentioned, engagement is a different type of ignorance.

original: slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
translated: Vasubandhu explains:

original: 'jug pa de yod kyang /
analyzed: 'jug pa de yod kyang /
translated: Even though engagement exists,

original: mdo las 'jug pa bshad pa yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: mdo las 'jug pa bshad pa yod kyang ngo //
translated: it is not mentioned in the sutra.

original: gcig gi tshig smos pa ni de'i rigs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi tshig smos pa ni de'i rigs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sutra mentions one type of ignorance in order to teach its type.🔽How do you know that engagement is this ignorance?

original: de ma rig pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las te ma rig pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gtan tshigs gang gis yongs su chod /
analyzed: de ma rig pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las te ma rig pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gtan tshigs gang gis yongs su chod /
translated: What is the reason that it is ignorance?

original: btsun pa chos skyob kyis rang gi bsam pa dgrol ba'i phyir 'di ltar 'di nyon mongs pa gzhan yin no zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: btsun pa chos skyob kyis rang gi bsam pa dgrol ba'i phyir 'di ltar 'di nyon mongs pa gzhan yin no zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The Venerable Dharmatrāta says: “Because it is not possible to say that this is a different defilement.”

original: ci'i phyir mi nus she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi nus she na /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rnams logs shig tu bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rnams logs shig tu bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because craving, view, and pride are explained separately.

original: slob dpon gyis nga rgyal gzhan yang yod pa kho na ma yin nam zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis nga rgyal gzhan yang yod pa kho na ma yin nam zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Master says: “Isn’t there another pride?”

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las gzhan pa drug po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig ste 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni de yin gyi /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las gzhan pa drug po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig ste 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni de yin gyi /
translated: Any one of the six types of pride other than pride thinking “I am,” is called “pride of thinking ‘I am.’”

original: ma rig pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is not ignorance.

original: 'di la dpyad par chad na brjod pa mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma @293a * //
analyzed: 'di la dpyad par chad na brjod pa mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma @293a * //
translated: If we were to analyze this, it would lead to too many words.

original: rig pa'i yan lag 'di la dpyad par chad na gzhung mang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig pa'i yan lag 'di la dpyad par chad na gzhung mang por 'gyur te /
translated: If we were to analyze this member of ignorance, it would lead to too many words.

original: ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: It is just as we have explained.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni gzhag ste de tsam kho nas chog go //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni gzhag ste de tsam kho nas chog go //
translated: Therefore, this should be set aside, and that much is enough.

original: yang na nga rgyal gzhan kho na yin gyi ma rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dpyad par chad na lan dang yang lan smos pas brjod pa mang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na nga rgyal gzhan kho na yin gyi ma rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dpyad par chad na lan dang yang lan smos pas brjod pa mang por 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, if you were to analyze this matter, saying, “Why is it that pride is one thing and ignorance is another?” and so on, then there would be a lot of back-and-forth discussion.

original: de lta bas na dpyad pa 'di ni gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bas na dpyad pa 'di ni gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement “This should be set aside” is that this matter should not be analyzed.

original: yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i yan lag bstan zin pa'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi yan lag yin la /
analyzed: yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i yan lag bstan zin pa'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi yan lag yin la /
translated: The statement “Name-and-form” is made immediately after the member of ignorance, and the member of volitional formations should be explained immediately after that.

original: de'i 'og tu yang rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan par bya dgos na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan par bya dgos na /
translated: After that, the member of consciousness should be explained.

original: ci ste 'di dag las 'das nas nye bar 'god ce na //
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag las 'das nas nye bar 'god ce na //
translated: Why are these members omitted and not explained?

original: 'di nyid ni slob dpon gyis //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni slob dpon gyis //
translated: The Master has already explained this:

original: bshad zin 'chad par 'gyur ba gzhan //
analyzed: bshad zin 'chad par 'gyur ba gzhan //
translated: “The other members will be explained later.”

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what will be explained.

original: gzugs ni rgya cher bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
analyzed: gzugs ni rgya cher bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni / gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
translated: Form is the extensive explanation.

original: lnga dang rnam rig byed min nyid //🔽ces bya ba der ro //
analyzed: lnga dang rnam rig byed min nyid // ces bya ba der ro //
translated: Form is the five sense faculties, the five objects, and nonindicative form.

original: ming dang dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ming gi dbang dang / dbang po'i dbang dang don gyi dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la gzhol bas na ming ngo //
analyzed: ming dang dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ming gi dbang dang / dbang po'i dbang dang don gyi dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la gzhol bas na ming ngo //
translated: Name is that which is applied to objects such as form by the power of names, faculties, and objects.

original: ming gang gi dbang gis she na zhes bya ba ni ming rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: ming gang gi dbang gis she na zhes bya ba ni ming rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir 'dri ba yin no //
translated: What is the name by the power of which?

original: slob dpon gyis 'jig rten na grags pa gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'jig rten na grags pa gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par smos te /
translated: The master says, that which is renowned in the world.🔽This is because there are two types of names.

original: ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba ni spyi go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba ni spyi go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Ox and horse are names that cause the general to be understood.

original: gzugs dang ro zhes bya ba ni don gcig go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro zhes bya ba ni don gcig go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Form and taste are names that cause the same object to be understood.

original: de lta bas na tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: Thus the four aggregates of feeling and so on are called name.

original: 'di ltar ming de'i dbang ste ming du 'dogs pa'i dbang gis don mngon sum ma yin pa dag la yang ming 'di'i don ni 'di yin no zhes gzhol zhing 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming de'i dbang ste ming du 'dogs pa'i dbang gis don mngon sum ma yin pa dag la yang ming 'di'i don ni 'di yin no zhes gzhol zhing 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Name is the basis for the designation of objects that are not directly perceptible, since one engages in them by the power of name, by the power of the designation of this name for this object.

original: dbang po don gyi dbang gis ni gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum dag la gzhol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po don gyi dbang gis ni gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum dag la gzhol bar 'gyur te /
translated: Form and so on are directly perceptible, since one engages in them by the power of the sense faculties.

original: skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @293b go //🔽don gyi dbang gis ni ming la yang 'di'i ming ni 'di'o zhes gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @293b go // don gyi dbang gis ni ming la yang 'di'i ming ni 'di'o zhes gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “they arise.”🔽Name is also engaged by the power of the object, since one engages in name by thinking, “This is the name of that object.”

original: de yang ci'i phyir ming nyid yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni ming du 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ming de yang rgyu gang gis ming nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir ming nyid yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni ming du 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ming de yang rgyu gang gis ming nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it called name?

original: don de dang de dag la ming de gzhol bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar don de dag la phung po bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi ming gzhol bar byed cing 'jug par byed pas de lta bas na 'di ni ming nyid yin te /
analyzed: don de dang de dag la ming de gzhol bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar don de dag la phung po bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi ming gzhol bar byed cing 'jug par byed pas de lta bas na 'di ni ming nyid yin te /
translated: Because names are directed toward those objects.🔽Name is so called because it directs one to those objects, since it causes one to engage in the characteristics of the four aggregates.

original: gzhol bar byed pas ni ming nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhol bar byed pas ni ming nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Name is so called because it directs one to those objects.

original: 'dir lus bor nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'chi ba'i tshe lus bor nas /
analyzed: 'dir lus bor nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'chi ba'i tshe lus bor nas /
translated: Here, when one discards the body, etc.🔽When one dies and discards the body, the formless aggregates of feeling, etc., are called name, because they direct one to another birth.

translated: As it is said, “When one dies and passes away, relatives burn the body with fire,🔽or they cast it in water,

original: sems zhes bya ba dang / yid ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dad pas yongs su bsgos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab kyis yongs su bsgos pa gang yin pa de ni tshe phyi ma la gang du 'gro ba dang /

analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba dang / mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //

analyzed: skye mched drug ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: mig la sogs pa gzugs dang ba //

original: khungs ni reg pa'i tshogs drug ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: khungs ni reg pa'i tshogs drug ces bya ba yin te /
translated: The source is the six collections of contact.

original: gzhan pa nyid ma yin na dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa dag bshad zin pas /
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid ma yin na dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa dag bshad zin pas /
translated: If they were not different, then the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses would have already been explained.

original: reg pa'i tshogs drug ces bzlas par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: reg pa'i tshogs drug ces bzlas par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And the six collections of contact would not be repeated,

original: de'i phyir drug tshan drug nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //🔽tshor ba dang sred pa dag kyang chos kyi skye mched las logs shig na yod par 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba ni gal te logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir logs shig na yod par 'gyur na ni tshor ba dang sred pa dag kyang chos kyi skye mched
analyzed: de'i phyir drug tshan drug nyid nyams par 'gyur ro // tshor ba dang sred pa dag kyang chos kyi skye mched las logs shig na yod par 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba ni gal te logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir logs shig na yod par 'gyur na ni tshor ba dang sred pa dag kyang chos kyi skye mched
translated: so the six collections of contact would be reduced to six.🔽And feeling and craving would exist separately from the phenomena element.

original: las logs shig tu bstan pas tshor ba dang sred pa de gnyis kyang chos kyi skye mched las gzhan yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: las logs shig tu bstan pas tshor ba dang sred pa de gnyis kyang chos kyi skye mched las gzhan yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If they existed separately because they are taught separately, then feeling and craving would exist separately from the phenomena element because they are taught separately from the phenomena element.

original: de gnyis ni chos kyi skye mched kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir logs shig na yod par yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de gnyis ni chos kyi skye mched kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir logs shig na yod par yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But since those two are included in the phenomena element, they are not asserted to exist separately.

original: de ni nyes pa med de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bshad pa de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bshad pa de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: That is not a fault.

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: That is not a fault because there are phenomena that are not included in those three,

original: tshor ba dang sred pa las ma gtogs pa chos kyi skye mched 'du shes la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir te yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang sred pa las ma gtogs pa chos kyi skye mched 'du shes la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir te yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that are not included in feeling and craving, such as the nature of discernment and so on that are included in the phenomena base.🔽That is not so.

original: de lta bur med do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di skad du gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa yin no zhes smra ba khyod kyi ltar na de lta bur reg par gyur pa gsum las logs shig na med kyang dgos pa'i dbang gis mdo 'di
analyzed: de lta bur med do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di skad du gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa yin no zhes smra ba khyod kyi ltar na de lta bur reg par gyur pa gsum las logs shig na med kyang dgos pa'i dbang gis mdo 'di
translated: This is said in response to the assertion that contact is the coming together of three.

original: las lhag ma gang zhig la reg pa'i tshogs drug go zhes smos su rung @294b ba reg par gyur pa dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa gsum las reg par gyur pa dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa gzhan gsum ni med do //
analyzed: las lhag ma gang zhig la reg pa'i tshogs drug go zhes smos su rung @294b ba reg par gyur pa dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa gsum las reg par gyur pa dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa gzhan gsum ni med do //
translated: The three—the faculty, the object, and the consciousness—that have become contact are contact. The other three—the faculty, the object, and the consciousness—that have not become contact do not exist.

original: de lta bas na tshor ba dang sred pa dag ni logs shig na med du zin kyang gdul bya'i don gyi dbang gis logs shig tu bstan par rigs kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba dang sred pa dag ni logs shig na med du zin kyang gdul bya'i don gyi dbang gis logs shig tu bstan par rigs kyi /
translated: Therefore, although feeling and craving do not exist separately, it is reasonable that they are taught separately for the sake of those to be trained.

original: 'dus pa tsam reg pa yin par smra ba khyod kyi ltar na ni dgos pa gang gis kyang reg pa'i tshogs drug ces logs shig tu bstan par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus pa tsam reg pa yin par smra ba khyod kyi ltar na ni dgos pa gang gis kyang reg pa'i tshogs drug ces logs shig tu bstan par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But according to you, who say that mere aggregation is contact, it is not reasonable for the six collections of contact to be taught separately for any purpose.

original: 'di ltar reg pa'i tshogs drug ces smos pas dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa gsum bshad zin pa'i phyir de rnams mi smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar reg pa'i tshogs drug ces smos pas dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa gsum bshad zin pa'i phyir de rnams mi smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because the three—the faculty, the object, and the consciousness—are already explained by the statement “the six collections of contact.” Therefore, they should not be mentioned separately.

original: de'i phyir / chos kyi rnam grangs drug tshan drug / ces bya ba mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos kyi rnam grangs drug tshan drug / ces bya ba mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the six groups of six dharmas would not be established.

original: kho bo'i ltar na ni reg pa dang tshor ba dang sred pa drug tshan smos kyang de rnams las ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched la sogs pa'i don dang / dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i drug tshan yod pa'i phyir 'grub ste /
analyzed: kho bo'i ltar na ni reg pa dang tshor ba dang sred pa drug tshan smos kyang de rnams las ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched la sogs pa'i don dang / dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i drug tshan yod pa'i phyir 'grub ste /
translated: But according to us, even though the six groups of contact, feeling, and craving are mentioned, the meaning of the sense bases, etc., which are not included in those, and the six groups of faculties and consciousness are established because they exist.

original: de lta bas na reg pa drug tshan zhes logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir reg pa zhes bya ba sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na reg pa drug tshan zhes logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir reg pa zhes bya ba sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, because the six groups of contact are taught separately, it is established that there is another factor called contact that is concomitant with the mind.

original: ji ste mdo 'di las /
analyzed: ji ste mdo 'di las /
translated: If you say that this sūtra

original: nang gi drug dang phyi yi drug / ces 'byung bas dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa med pa dag kyang bstan te /
analyzed: nang gi drug dang phyi yi drug / ces 'byung bas dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa med pa dag kyang bstan te /
translated: teaches the six internal and the six external sense bases, then it would also teach the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses that do not exist.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum reg par gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di lhag ma bstan pa'i phyir 'di las reg pa'i tshogs drug ces smos pa yin no zhes smra bar gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum reg par gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di lhag ma bstan pa'i phyir 'di las reg pa'i tshogs drug ces smos pa yin no zhes smra bar gyur na /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the remainder, the root text states, “from this, the six collections of contact.”

translated: Even if the faculties and objects exist without consciousness,
