analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: they are similar to those that are associated with consciousness.

original: dbang po dang don med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni med de /
analyzed: dbang po dang don med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni med de /
translated: Consciousness without faculties and objects does not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gdon mi za bar dbang po dang / don dang bcas pa yin la rnam par shes pa de yang 'di las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces 'byung bas bstan zin to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gdon mi za bar dbang po dang / don dang bcas pa yin la rnam par shes pa de yang 'di las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces 'byung bas bstan zin to //
translated: Consciousness definitely possesses faculties and objects, and that consciousness is indicated by the root text stating, “from this, the six collections of contact.”

original: @295a * // de lta bas na rnam par shes pa ni tshogs drug ces 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa gsum bstan zin pas yang reg pa'i tshogs drug ces reg pa smos zin pa smos pa ni don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @295a * // de lta bas na rnam par shes pa ni tshogs drug ces 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa gsum bstan zin pas yang reg pa'i tshogs drug ces reg pa smos zin pa smos pa ni don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the three—the faculty, the object, and the consciousness—are already indicated in the statement, “Consciousness is the group of six,” it is meaningless to mention contact again in the statement, “The group of six contacts.”

original: de'i phyir reg pa ni 'dus pa las gzhan yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa ni 'dus pa las gzhan yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that contact is different from the mere assembly.

original: 'dir slob dpon dpal len gyis mig dang gzugs thams cad kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin zhes bya bar rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon dpal len gyis mig dang gzugs thams cad kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin zhes bya bar rgyas par smos te /
translated: Here, the master Haribhadra says, “Not all eyes and all forms are the cause of all eye consciousnesses.”

original: thams cad kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs sngar byung ba dag rgyu yin gyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba dag ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs sngar byung ba dag rgyu yin gyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba dag ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Not all” means that past eyes and forms are the cause, but those that arise simultaneously with consciousness are not.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang 'bras bu ma yin zhes bya ba 'di mig dang gzugs sngar byung ba dag gi phyis byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba dag gi ni ma yin pas de'i phyir reg pa'i tshogs drug ces 'byung ba'i mdo 'di
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang 'bras bu ma yin zhes bya ba 'di mig dang gzugs sngar byung ba dag gi phyis byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba dag gi ni ma yin pas de'i phyir reg pa'i tshogs drug ces 'byung ba'i mdo 'di
translated: This sutra states that the six collections of contact exist because the eye and form that arise later are the cause of eye consciousness that arises later, but they are not the cause of eye consciousness that arises simultaneously.🔽Therefore this sutra states that those consciousnesses, faculties, and objects that are cause and effect are posited as the entity of contact.

original: las gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang yul de dag reg pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go zhes zer te 'di ni gzhan du bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang yul de dag reg pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go zhes zer te 'di ni gzhan du bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not taught elsewhere.🔽The response is it is not recited in that way.

original: de skad du mi 'don to zhes bya ba ni de skad du 'don par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de skad du mi 'don to zhes bya ba ni de skad du 'don par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not recited in that way means it is not recited in that way.🔽If that is so, how is it recited? It is recited as this:

original: 'o na ji skad du 'don zhe na chos 'di dag 'brel pa dang / 'dus pa dang / tshogs pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni reg pa'o zhes 'don to //
analyzed: 'o na ji skad du 'don zhe na chos 'di dag 'brel pa dang / 'dus pa dang / tshogs pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni reg pa'o zhes 'don to //
translated: That which arises from the connection, assembly, and convergence of these phenomena is contact.

original: yang na ni 'di /
analyzed: yang na ni 'di /
translated: Or else,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin //
translated: the cause is imputed as the effect.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'brel cing 'dus la tshogs pa la 'bras bu reg pa btags te /🔽dper na / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'brel cing 'dus la tshogs pa la 'bras bu reg pa btags te / dper na / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: Contact is nominally ascribed to the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said, “The appearance of buddhas is blissful.”

original: 'di la rgyu skye ba'i rnam pa ha cang mang por 'phro ba yod pas /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu skye ba'i rnam pa ha cang mang por 'phro ba yod pas /
translated: Here, the cause is the appearance of buddhas.

original: rgyu skye ba'i rnam pa ha cang mang por 'phro ba yin no //🔽tshig bla dgas zhes bya ba ni ming yin no zhes bya ba 'dis lhag par brjod pas na tshig bla dags te tshig ni ming la 'jug la /
analyzed: rgyu skye ba'i rnam pa ha cang mang por 'phro ba yin no // tshig bla dgas zhes bya ba ni ming yin no zhes bya ba 'dis lhag par brjod pas na tshig bla dags te tshig ni ming la 'jug la /
translated: The cause is the appearance of buddhas.🔽The term “predominant” means name.

original: ming gis @295b ni don rjod par byed pas tshig bla dags ni ming yin no //
analyzed: ming gis @295b ni don rjod par byed pas tshig bla dags ni ming yin no //
translated: The term “predominant” means name because it is said that the predominant is name. The term “predominant” is a word that is applied to name.🔽Name is the predominant because it expresses meaning.

original: ming de lhag par te phal cher yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'di'i dmigs pa yin pas de'i phyir tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya'o zhes grag ste /
analyzed: ming de lhag par te phal cher yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'di'i dmigs pa yin pas de'i phyir tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya'o zhes grag ste /
translated: It is said that contact that is predominant is contact that is predominant because name is the predominant object of mental consciousness.

original: reg pa dang 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
analyzed: reg pa dang 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
translated: Contact and contact that is predominant are the same.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas sngon po yang rnam par shes zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba yang rnam par shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas sngon po yang rnam par shes zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba yang rnam par shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mental consciousness is said to cognize blue and it is said to cognize the object to be expressed.

original: sngon po'o zhes bya bar yang rnam par shes zhes bya ba ni don 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po'o zhes bya bar yang rnam par shes zhes bya ba ni don 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is said to cognize “blue” because it cognizes the name of this object.

original: gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin //
analyzed: gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin //
translated: One is distinguished by its basis.

original: zhes bya ba ni dang po ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dang po ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The first is distinguished by its basis.

original: thogs pa'i rten can gyi reg pa'am thogs pa'i reg pa ni thogs pa'i reg pa yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa'i rten can gyi reg pa'am thogs pa'i reg pa ni thogs pa'i reg pa yin no //
translated: Contact that has a resistant basis or contact that is resistant is contact that is resistant.

original: dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin //
analyzed: dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin //
translated: One is distinguished by its object.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi dmigs pa can nam tshig bla dags la reg pa ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi dmigs pa can nam tshig bla dags la reg pa ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa yin no //
translated: Contact that has a conventional object or contact that is conventional is contact that is conventional.

original: tshig gi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi dbang du byas shing tshig nges par gzung nas gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug gi lnga po mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni tshig gi dbang
analyzed: tshig gi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi dbang du byas shing tshig nges par gzung nas gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug gi lnga po mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni tshig gi dbang
translated: The phrase “from the perspective of words” means that mental consciousness engages objects such as form from the perspective of words and in dependence on words.

original: du byas nas don rnams la 'jug pa ma yin te /🔽de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid tshig bla dags yin te tshig la 'jug pa ni tshig bla dags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: du byas nas don rnams la 'jug pa ma yin te / de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid tshig bla dags yin te tshig la 'jug pa ni tshig bla dags zhes bya'o //
translated: The five sense consciousnesses do not engage objects from the perspective of words.🔽Therefore, mental consciousness alone is called “the nominal” because it engages words.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa ste /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa ste /
translated: Contact associated with that mental consciousness is contact that is nominal.

original: des ni reg pa gnyis pa 'di ni mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu phye ba yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des ni reg pa gnyis pa 'di ni mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu phye ba yin zhes bya'o //
translated: This second type of contact is distinguished by its association.

original: rig pa dang ma rig pa dang gzhan reg ces bya ba ni rig pa dang ma rig pa dang gzhan ni rig dang ma rig dang gzhan reg ste /
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa dang gzhan reg ces bya ba ni rig pa dang ma rig pa dang gzhan ni rig dang ma rig dang gzhan reg ste /
translated: Contact associated with knowledge, ignorance, and other states is contact associated with knowledge, ignorance, and other states.

original: rig pa dang ; ma rig pa dang / de gnyis las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rig pa dang ; ma rig pa dang / de gnyis las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called knowledge, ignorance, and neither knowledge nor ignorance.

original: rig pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab po //
translated: Knowledge is uncontaminated wisdom.

original: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab po //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab po //
translated: Ignorance is defiled wisdom.

original: rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa ni shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang @296a * //
analyzed: rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa ni shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang @296a * //
translated: Neither knowledge nor ignorance is any virtuous contaminated wisdom

original: yin pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yin pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab gang yin pa ste /
translated: or any unobscured neutral wisdom.

original: reg pa de dag kyang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa de dag kyang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: These contacts should be understood in the same order.

original: ma rig pa'i reg pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ma rig pa'i reg pa nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang dang yang kun du 'byung zhing rtag tu kun du 'byung ba ni phyogs gcig yin te de smos pas reg pa
analyzed: ma rig pa'i reg pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ma rig pa'i reg pa nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang dang yang kun du 'byung zhing rtag tu kun du 'byung ba ni phyogs gcig yin te de smos pas reg pa
translated: The contact of ignorance is the contact that is concomitant with all the afflictions. It occurs frequently and always occurs.

original: gnyis su 'gyur te gnod sems dang rjes su chags pa'i reg pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su 'gyur te gnod sems dang rjes su chags pa'i reg pa yin no //
translated: The contact of the two is the contact of malice and the contact of attraction.

original: bde ba myong 'gyur la sogs gsum //🔽zhes bya ba ni bde ba myong ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba myong 'gyur la sogs gsum // zhes bya ba ni bde ba myong ba'o //
translated: The three beginning with that which is to be experienced as pleasure.

original: bde ba myong bar rung ba ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar rung ba ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That which is to be experienced as pleasure is that which is to be experienced as pleasure.🔽That which is suitable to be experienced as pleasure is that which is to be experienced as pleasure.

original: yang na 'di la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or, that which is to be experienced as pleasure exists in this, thus it is that which is to be experienced as pleasure.

original: 'di dag la de dag la sogs pa yod pas na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la de dag la sogs pa yod pas na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is to be experienced as pleasure, etc. exist in these, thus they are that which is to be experienced as pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba dang mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor bar bya ba dang mthun pa ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor bar bya ba dang mthun pa ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because it is conducive to pleasure is that which is to be experienced as pleasure.

original: yang na de myong bar bya ba'am myong bar nus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na de myong bar bya ba'am myong bar nus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, it is that which is to be experienced as pleasure, or that which is capable of being experienced as pleasure.

original: myong bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni las tsam du ston to //
analyzed: myong bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni las tsam du ston to //
translated: That which is to be experienced as pleasure is taught as mere action.

original: myong bar nus pa zhes bya ba ni 'os par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: myong bar nus pa zhes bya ba ni 'os par ston pa yin no //
translated: That which is capable of being experienced as pleasure is taught as suitable.

original: de dag ni rig pa bcu drug yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du drug dang / yang thogs pa'i reg pa dang / tshig bla dags kyi reg pa dang / rig pa dang ma rig pa'i reg pa dang /🔽rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa dang / reg pa gnyis po gnod sems dang / rjes su chags pa'i reg pa dang / reg pa gsum po bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de dag ni rig pa bcu drug yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du drug dang / yang thogs pa'i reg pa dang / tshig bla dags kyi reg pa dang / rig pa dang ma rig pa'i reg pa dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa dang / reg pa gnyis po gnod sems dang / rjes su chags pa'i reg pa dang / reg pa gsum po bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: These are the sixteen contacts.🔽The six from eye contact to mind contact, contact through resistance, contact through designation, contact through knowledge, contact through non-knowledge, contact through neither knowledge nor non-knowledge, contact through the two kinds of contact, contact through malice, contact through attachment, contact through the three kinds of contact, contact through the experience of pleasure, contact through the experience of pain, and contact through the experience of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i rig pa dang bcu drug go //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i rig pa dang bcu drug go //
translated: These are the sixteen contacts.

original: reg pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: reg pa bshad zin to //
translated: Contacts have been explained.🔽The Explanation of Feeling

original: tshor ba brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la tshor ba la yang tshor ba myong ba zhes bshad ma zin nam /
analyzed: tshor ba brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la tshor ba la yang tshor ba myong ba zhes bshad ma zin nam /
translated: The explanation of feeling should be given next, but isn't the experience of feeling already explained in the phrase the experience of contact?

original: 'on te bshad zin pa yang 'chad na ni /
analyzed: 'on te bshad zin pa yang 'chad na ni /
translated: If it is necessary to explain it again,

original: bshad zin pa 'chad @296b par 'gyur ba gzhan zhes 'byung bas bshad zin pa gang yin pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mi bshad do zhes bya ba 'di brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: bshad zin pa 'chad @296b par 'gyur ba gzhan zhes 'byung bas bshad zin pa gang yin pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mi bshad do zhes bya ba 'di brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Since it says, “other things that have been explained and will be explained,” it should not be said that “what has been explained and what will be explained is not explained.”

original: rnam par ston pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: rnam par ston pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault because it is taught.

original: sngar ni mtshan nyid bshad la /
analyzed: sngar ni mtshan nyid bshad la /
translated: Previously the characteristics were explained,

original: da ni rnam pa 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni rnam pa 'chad pa yin no //
translated: but now the aspects are explained.

original: skyes zin pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bskyed par bya ba'i chos skyes zin pa la ni skyed par byed pa'i chos kyi nus pa med de lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes zin pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bskyed par bya ba'i chos skyes zin pa la ni skyed par byed pa'i chos kyi nus pa med de lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With regard to the phrase “with regard to that which has arisen,” the power of a phenomenon that generates that which is to be generated does not exist with regard to that which has already arisen, because they arise simultaneously.

original: dam bcas pa dang bye brag med //
analyzed: dam bcas pa dang bye brag med //
translated: The proof is not distinguished from the thesis.

original: ces bya ba ni sgrub pa 'di dam bcas pa dang khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sgrub pa 'di dam bcas pa dang khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the proof is not distinguished from the thesis.

original: gal te sgrub pa dam bcas pa dang khyad par med pa nyid ni mi 'dod na 'o na ni phan tshun du skyed par byed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa dam bcas pa dang khyad par med pa nyid ni mi 'dod na 'o na ni phan tshun du skyed par byed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: If you do not accept that the thesis and the proof are not different, then it follows that they are mutually productive.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What does that mean?

original: ji ltar na lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por 'grub ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar na lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por 'grub ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: How can two co-existent things be established as the thing that is produced and the thing that produces?

original: 'dis ni lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yod do zhes dam bca' ba ni sngar khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo zhes dam bcas pa'i skyon brjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yod do zhes dam bca' ba ni sngar khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo zhes dam bcas pa'i skyon brjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the fault of the thesis is that the assertion that the two co-existent things are the thing that is produced and the thing that produces contradicts your former assertion.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sngar khas blangs pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sngar khas blangs pa ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase “because we accept it” shows that you formerly accepted it.

original: 'dod pa 'di ni mdo las mi bzhed ces bya ba ni chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di ni mdo las mi bzhed ces bya ba ni chos mngon pa las /
translated: The phrase “this assertion is not accepted in the sutras” shows that the Abhidharma🔽does not accept it.

original: lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
translated: The phrase “whatever is co-existent is a mutual effect” shows that the Abhidharma🔽does not accept it.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i 'dod pa 'di ni mdo las mi bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i 'dod pa 'di ni mdo las mi bzhed pa yin no //
translated: This assertion is not accepted in the sutras.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir mig gi 'dus te reg pa la brten nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skye zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir mig gi 'dus te reg pa la brten nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skye zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says: “In dependence on contact at the eye, feeling that arises from contact at the eye is produced.”

original: mdo tshad mar byed pas phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa bcom nas lhan cig 'byung ba dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gzhom par 'dod nas skyed par byed pa'i chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mdo tshad mar byed pas phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa bcom nas lhan cig 'byung ba dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gzhom par 'dod nas skyed par byed pa'i chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The opponent, who accepts the authority of the sutras, rejects the idea that they are reciprocal effects, and then, in order to refute the idea that co-existent things are cause and effect, says, “It is also unreasonable to say that they are co-existent because they are contradictory to the principle of causality.”

original: skyed par byed pa'i chos ni gang 'dus pa tha dad pa 'di yin par grags te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i chos ni gang 'dus pa tha dad pa 'di yin par grags te /
translated: The principle of causality is well known to be the principle that things arise in sequence,

original: dper na sa bon snga la myu gu 'phyi ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //🔽de la @297a * //
analyzed: dper na sa bon snga la myu gu 'phyi ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //🔽de la @297a * //
translated: as, for example, when the seed comes first and the sprout comes later.

original: yang dbang po dang don dag snga la rnam par shes pa'i phyi zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po la dbang po dang don dag byung la rnam par shes pa ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dbang po dang don dag snga la rnam par shes pa'i phyi zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po la dbang po dang don dag byung la rnam par shes pa ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The order of the sense faculty and object preceding that of consciousness is as follows: the sense faculty and object occur in the first moment and consciousness occurs in the second moment.

original: 'o na ni myu gu dang grib ma dag ji ltar zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni myu gu dang grib ma dag ji ltar zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: If this is so, then how is it that a sprout and its shadow are simultaneous?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dag la bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dag la bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: The relationship of that which is generated and that which generates is present between simultaneous factors.

original: myu gu ni skye ba kho na'i tshe grib ma skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: myu gu ni skye ba kho na'i tshe grib ma skyed par byed kyi /
translated: A sprout generates its shadow only when it arises.

original: skad cig ma dang po la myu gu grib ma med par 'byung la /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po la myu gu grib ma med par 'byung la /
translated: A sprout arises in the first moment without a shadow,

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la grib ma dang bcas pa ni ma yin pa ltar reg pa dang tshor ba dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la grib ma dang bcas pa ni ma yin pa ltar reg pa dang tshor ba dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: and in the second moment it arises with a shadow. Contact and feeling are similar to this.

original: grib ma dang myu gu 'di gnyis kyi rgyu yang tshogs pa snga ma yin no zhes brjod par lta nus te /
analyzed: grib ma dang myu gu 'di gnyis kyi rgyu yang tshogs pa snga ma yin no zhes brjod par lta nus te /
translated: It is possible to say that the cause of both the shadow and the sprout is the same, namely, the prior collection of causes.

original: don 'di ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu bstan par bshad zin pas yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: don 'di ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu bstan par bshad zin pas yang mi brjod do //
translated: This point has already been explained in the explanation of the simultaneous cause, so it will not be discussed again.

original: gzhan dag na re reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len to //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len to //
translated: Others say that feeling occurs after contact.

original: gsum 'dus pa de ni reg pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa dang / skyed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa de ni reg pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa dang / skyed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The coming together of the three is contact.

original: skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don ni skad cig ma dang po yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don ni skad cig ma dang po yin no //
translated: The first moment is the faculty and the object.

original: rnam par shes pa dang skye ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang skye ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second moment is the arising of consciousness.

original: tshor ba skye ba ni skad cig ma gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba skye ba ni skad cig ma gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third moment is the arising of feeling.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the case that all consciousnesses have feeling, because there is no feeling in the second moment of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: And it is not the case that all consciousnesses are contact.

original: skad cig ma snga ma ste gnyis pa la reg pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir tshor ba'i skad cig ma gsum pa la rnam par shes pa reg pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma ste gnyis pa la reg pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir tshor ba'i skad cig ma gsum pa la rnam par shes pa reg pa ma yin no //
translated: In the second moment, which is the moment of feeling, consciousness is not contact, because contact is defined in the second moment.

original: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: The feeling that exists in the subsequent contact arises from the cause of the prior contact.

original: da ltar skad cig ma gnyis par reg pa'i ngo bor bshad pa gang yin pa de la yod pa'i tshor ba ni reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: da ltar skad cig ma gnyis par reg pa'i ngo bor bshad pa gang yin pa de la yod pa'i tshor ba ni reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: The feeling that exists in the contact that is explained as having the nature of the second moment arises from the cause of the prior contact.

original: skad cig ma @297b dang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu can du byung ba yin la gzhan la yod pa'ang reg pa de sngon du 'gro ba yin pas de ltar rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma @297b dang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu can du byung ba yin la gzhan la yod pa'ang reg pa de sngon du 'gro ba yin pas de ltar rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It arises as having the prior consciousness as its cause, and the contact that exists in the other moment is preceded by that contact. Thus, all consciousnesses have feeling.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang reg pa yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa de dag kyang tshor ba dang bcas pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang reg pa yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa de dag kyang tshor ba dang bcas pa yin pas so //
translated: This is because those contacts are also accompanied by feeling.🔽Those two are contacts with different objects,

original: dmigs pa tha dad pa dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di dag la dmigs pa tha dad pa yod pas 'di gnyis ni dmigs pa tha dad pa dag ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pa dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di dag la dmigs pa tha dad pa yod pas 'di gnyis ni dmigs pa tha dad pa dag ste /
translated: because they have different objects.

original: snga ma'i dmigs pa ni gzugs so //
analyzed: snga ma'i dmigs pa ni gzugs so //
translated: The object of the former is form.

original: phyi ma'i ni sgra'o //🔽dmigs pa tha dad pa de gnyis reg pa phyi ma sgra la dmigs pa la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: phyi ma'i ni sgra'o // dmigs pa tha dad pa de gnyis reg pa phyi ma sgra la dmigs pa la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: The object of the latter is sound.🔽It is illogical to say that the feeling that exists in the later contact that has sound as its object arises from the cause of the earlier contact,

original: gzugs la dmigs pa'i rgyu can 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa'i rgyu can 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: the feeling that has form as its object.🔽How is that?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni nyes pa ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni nyes pa ston pa yin te /
translated: This shows the fault.

original: rigs mi 'dra ba la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: rigs mi 'dra ba la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
translated: It is illogical to say that feeling arises from contact that has a different type of object.

original: gzugs kyi rnam pa la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gzhan la dmigs par 'gyur zhing sgra la dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam pa la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gzhan la dmigs par 'gyur zhing sgra la dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Feeling that arises from contact that focuses on form may focus on another object, such as sound.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Because its cause is incomplete, its result does not arise.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gzugs la dmigs pa kho na'i tshor bar byung bar 'gyur ba de'i reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar rigs kyi
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gzugs la dmigs pa kho na'i tshor bar byung bar 'gyur ba de'i reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar rigs kyi
translated: When feeling that arises from contact that focuses on form focuses on form alone, it is logical to say that the feeling that exists in the later contact arises from the cause of the earlier contact.

original: / gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa la sgra la dmigs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba de'i tshe 'di ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: / gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa la sgra la dmigs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba de'i tshe 'di ji ltar rung ste /
translated: But when feeling that focuses on sound arises from contact that focuses on form, how could that be logical?

original: 'bras bu ni 'jig rten na rgyu dang mthun par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'jig rten na rgyu dang mthun par snang ngo //
translated: Because in the world, a result appears in accordance with its cause.

original: 'on te gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni sgra la dmigs pa'i reg pa dang mtshungs par ldan yang gzugs la dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na yang de'i phyir yang na sems gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa de las gzhan🔽pa la dmigs par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni sgra la dmigs pa'i reg pa dang mtshungs par ldan yang gzugs la dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na yang de'i phyir yang na sems gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa de las gzhan pa la dmigs par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: The mind that is concomitant with that would have a different object.

original: sgra la dmigs pa'i sems de las gzhan pa la dmigs pa @298a * //
analyzed: sgra la dmigs pa'i sems de las gzhan pa la dmigs pa @298a * //
translated: The mind that has sound as its object is concomitant with that feeling.🔽The mind that has form as its object is concomitant with that feeling.

original: ste / gzugs la dmigs pa gang las skyes pa de dang dmigs pa mtshungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ste / gzugs la dmigs pa gang las skyes pa de dang dmigs pa mtshungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase “that which arises from that which has a different object.”

original: 'di de dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes kyang 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: 'di de dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes kyang 'di skad brjod de /
translated: The phrase “concomitant with that” is also stated in this way.

original: 'dra bar ldan pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dra bar ldan pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: Concomitance is equivalent to similarity.

original: gal te rten mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rten mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that it is because they have the same support,

original: ji ltar rna ba'i rten can du gyur pa gzugs la dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rna ba'i rten can du gyur pa gzugs la dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: how could the mind that has sound as its object have form as its object, since it has the ear as its support?

original: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it not be so?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rten dang lhan cig yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rten dang lhan cig yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because minds and mental factors engage the same object as their support.

original: de lta bas na tshor ba ni gang la dmigs su zin kyang nyes pa yod par rab tu bstan te /🔽re zhig gal te gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dmigs pa gzhan sgra la dmigs na yang gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa de bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba nas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba ni gang la dmigs su zin kyang nyes pa yod par rab tu bstan te / re zhig gal te gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dmigs pa gzhan sgra la dmigs na yang gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa de bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba nas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar
translated: Thus, it is clearly taught that there is a fault in any object of observation.

original: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the feeling that arises from contact that observes form observes another object of observation, such as sound, then that contact that observes form would not be contact that experiences pleasure, up to and including contact that experiences neither pleasure nor pain.

original: tshor ba dang dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir de ltar bstan par rung ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir de ltar bstan par rung ngo //
translated: This is because it is suitable to teach that feeling and its object of observation are the same.

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te de ltar nyes pa yod na 'o na ni de'i tshe ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te de ltar nyes pa yod na 'o na ni de'i tshe ste /
translated: If there is a fault in that, then at that time,

original: gang gi tshe zhe na sgra la dmigs pa'i tshe reg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa tshor ba med pa yin la sgra la dmigs pa de snga rol gyi rnam par shes pa tshor ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa ma yin te
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na sgra la dmigs pa'i tshe reg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa tshor ba med pa yin la sgra la dmigs pa de snga rol gyi rnam par shes pa tshor ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa ma yin te
translated: If you ask when, it is when the consciousness that is the object of sound is not feeling, then the consciousness that is the object of sound that precedes it is not contact, because it is associated with feeling.

original: / de ltar na nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de ltar na nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the error is not committed.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te sngar 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa tshor ba dang bcas pa reg pa yin par gyur na de lta na ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin pas ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te sngar 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa tshor ba dang bcas pa reg pa yin par gyur na de lta na ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin pas ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, if the consciousness that arises earlier and is associated with feeling were contact, then since feeling would be conditioned by contact, the error explained would occur.

original: yang ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa cung zad cig ni tshor ba dang bcas pa yin la cung zad cig ni reg pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa cung zad cig ni tshor ba dang bcas pa yin la cung zad cig ni reg pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that some consciousness is associated with feeling but is not contact?

original: rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conditions are incomplete.

original: rkyen ma tshang ba ni gegs byed par gnas te /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba ni gegs byed par gnas te /
translated: The incomplete conditions are the obstruction.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen thams cad tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg par gyur pa'i rnam par @298b shes pa skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen thams cad tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg par gyur pa'i rnam par @298b shes pa skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: All similar and immediately antecedent conditions are not capable of producing consciousness that is contact that is a condition for feeling.

original: de lta na de'i lugs kyis dmigs pa tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gcig tu tshor ba med pa yin la de skyed par byed pa ni reg par gyur pa ma yin no //🔽gal te gzugs la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs la dmigs pa kho na'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: de lta na de'i lugs kyis dmigs pa tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gcig tu tshor ba med pa yin la de skyed par byed pa ni reg par gyur pa ma yin no // gal te gzugs la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs la dmigs pa kho na'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: Thus, according to his system, consciousness that has a different object is not associated with feeling, and that which produces it is not contact.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye na de ni tshor ba dang bcas pa yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa sngar skyes pa de yang reg pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye na de ni tshor ba dang bcas pa yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa sngar skyes pa de yang reg pa yin no //
translated: If visual consciousness that has form as its object arises immediately after visual consciousness that has form as its object, or if mental consciousness arises, then it is associated with feeling, and the visual consciousness that arose previously is contact.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba dang sa mang po'i nges pa nyams pa yin zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang tshor ba dag rnam grangs kyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba dang sa mang po'i nges pa nyams pa yin zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang tshor ba dag rnam grangs kyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then the definition of the universal mental factors is violated, because contact and feeling would be synonyms.

original: sa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three realms are:

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: The realm of investigation and analysis is the desire realm and the first concentration.

original: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no //
analyzed: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no //
translated: The realm of no investigation but only analysis is the special concentration.

original: rtog pa'ang med dpyod pa'ang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar ro //
analyzed: rtog pa'ang med dpyod pa'ang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar ro //
translated: The realm of neither investigation nor analysis is from the second concentration up to the peak of cyclic existence.

original: dge ba'i sa ni chos dge ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i sa ni chos dge ba ste /
translated: The virtuous realm is virtuous phenomena.

original: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Unvirtuous and neutral phenomena are similar.

original: slob pa'i sa ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so //🔽mi slob pa'i sa ni mi slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: slob pa'i sa ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so // mi slob pa'i sa ni mi slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The realm of training is the uncontaminated phenomena of those in training.🔽The realm of no more training is the uncontaminated phenomena of those who no longer require training.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i sa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i sa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The realm of neither training nor no more training is contaminated phenomena.

original: sems las byung ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas ni 'dir mi smos so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas ni 'dir mi smos so //
translated: Unconditioned phenomena are not mentioned here because this is the section on mental factors.

original: de la gang dag sa 'di dag na yod pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad do //
analyzed: de la gang dag sa 'di dag na yod pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad do //
translated: “Those that exist on these stages” is an elaboration.🔽

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni sems las byung ba gang dag go //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni sems las byung ba gang dag go //
translated: Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.

original: sa 'di dag thams cad na yod pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa nas slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i sa'i bar na yod pa de dag ni sa mang po pa tshor ba dang🔽sems pa la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa yin no //🔽gang dag dge ba @299a * //
analyzed: sa 'di dag thams cad na yod pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa nas slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i sa'i bar na yod pa de dag ni sa mang po pa tshor ba dang sems pa la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa yin no // gang dag dge ba @299a * //
translated: Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.🔽Those that exist on all these stages are called the universal mental factors.

original: kho na la yod pa de dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin te dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kho na la yod pa de dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin te dad pa la sogs pa'o //

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzhan dag na re sa mang po pa la sogs pa de dag kyang gang dag gang na yod pa de dag de na rnam grangs kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzhan dag na re sa mang po pa la sogs pa de dag kyang gang dag gang na yod pa de dag de na rnam grangs kyis yin gyi /

original: thams cad cig car ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: thams cad cig car ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: They do not all exist simultaneously.

original: dper na tshor ba lta bu sa thams cad na yod kyang 'du shes dang sems pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang cig car ma yin la reg pa yang tshor ba la sogs pa dang de dang 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: dper na tshor ba lta bu sa thams cad na yod kyang 'du shes dang sems pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang cig car ma yin la reg pa yang tshor ba la sogs pa dang de dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: For example, although feeling exists in all the stages, it does not exist simultaneously with perception, intention, contact, or attention.

original: de bzhin du dge ba la rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba la rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the virtuous mental factors such as investigation and so on do not exist simultaneously.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di skad du 'di ni phung po lnga las ji skad du bris pa de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di skad du 'di ni phung po lnga las ji skad du bris pa de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o zhes zer te /

original: 'di lta ste /

translated: For example,

original: 'dun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dun pa gang zhe na /

original: bsam pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa ste /

original: ma bsams pa la 'dun pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bsams pa la 'dun pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The author thinks: If one does not reflect, one does not have any aspiration.

original: mos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is resolution?

original: nges pa'i dngos po la de kho na bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i dngos po la de kho na bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the holding of a determined thing as it is.🔽What is memory?

original: dran pa gang zhe na 'dris pa'i dngos po la mi brjed pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa gang zhe na 'dris pa'i dngos po la mi brjed pa ste /
translated: It is the non-forgetting of an object of experience.

original: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
translated: It is the mental expression.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration?

original: brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind on an object of concentration.

original: shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: de nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: It is the discernment of that itself.

original: rig pa dang ma rig pas bskyed pa dang / de las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu la sogs pa phung po lnga'i gzhung las 'byung ba yin par blta'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pas bskyed pa dang / de las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu la sogs pa phung po lnga'i gzhung las 'byung ba yin par blta'o //
translated: It should be understood as it is explained in the Five Skandhas: It is the knowledge that produces the knowledge of the known and the knowledge of the knower, and it is other than that.

original: de las ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / sems pa dang lnga ni kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de las ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / sems pa dang lnga ni kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Among these, five are omnipresent: feeling, perception, contact, attention, and volition.

original: 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang ldan @299b yul so sor nges pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang ldan @299b yul so sor nges pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bshad do //

original: rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa las ni ma bton te sa mang po pa rnams dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa mang po pa rnams so zhes rnam pa bzhi zhig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa las ni ma bton te sa mang po pa rnams dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa mang po pa rnams so zhes rnam pa bzhi zhig 'byung ngo //
translated: The phrase “they are mentioned in the sūtras and so on” means that they are mentioned in the sūtras and so on, but they are not mentioned in the root text of the Abhidharmakoś

original: lhan cig skyes pa zhes gsungs kyi reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa zhes ni ma gsungs na zhes bya ba ni khyad par mdzad pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa 'di dag phan tshun lhan cig skyes pa yin gyi reg pa dang ni ma yin no zhes
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa zhes gsungs kyi reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa zhes ni ma gsungs na zhes bya ba ni khyad par mdzad pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa 'di dag phan tshun lhan cig skyes pa yin gyi reg pa dang ni ma yin no zhes
translated: It is said to be coemergent, but it is not said to be coemergent with contact.

original: bya ba'i don du yongs su bzung nas mdo'i lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i don du yongs su bzung nas mdo'i lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning: “In order to make a distinction, the meaning of this sutra passage should be explained as follows: these feelings, etc. are mutually coemergent, but not coemergent with contact.”

original: byams pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig ces bya ba ni sgra 'di cig car 'byung ba la bya bar nges pa med kyi /
analyzed: byams pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig ces bya ba ni sgra 'di cig car 'byung ba la bya bar nges pa med kyi /
translated: The phrase “accompanied by love” means that the term “accompanied” does not definitely refer to simultaneous occurrence.

original: de ma thag pa la yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ma thag pa la yang mthong ngo //
translated: It is also seen to refer to immediate succession.

original: byams pa dang dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni phrad pa med de /
analyzed: byams pa dang dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni phrad pa med de /
translated: Love and the mindfulness enlightenment factor do not meet.

original: byams pa ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: byams pa ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is because love is definitely contaminated,

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gcig tu zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gcig tu zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the mindfulness enlightenment factor is definitely uncontaminated.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni khongs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni khongs su mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, this is not included.

original: 'dres pa yin zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dres pa yin zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: “Mixed” means “arisen together.”🔽From that very sūtra:

original: mdo de nyid las zhes bya ba ni gang kho na las /
analyzed: mdo de nyid las zhes bya ba ni gang kho na las /
translated: This means from the sūtra that states:

original: tshor ba gang yin pa dang sems pa gang yin pa dang 'du shes gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i mdo de las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshor ba gang yin pa dang sems pa gang yin pa dang 'du shes gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i mdo de las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Whatever feeling there is, whatever conception there is, whatever volition there is,” and so on.🔽It does not know that:

original: de mi shes so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci re zhig 'di tshor ba la sogs pa de dag gi dmigs par nges shing dmigs pa la nges pa ste /🔽dmigs pa gang kho na myong bar byed pa de kho na rnam par shes pas rnam par @300a * //
analyzed: de mi shes so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci re zhig 'di tshor ba la sogs pa de dag gi dmigs par nges shing dmigs pa la nges pa ste / dmigs pa gang kho na myong bar byed pa de kho na rnam par shes pas rnam par @300a * //
translated: This means: Is it that the object of those such as feeling is ascertained and the object is ascertained,

original: shes par byed pa'i bar zhig yin nam /
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i bar zhig yin nam /
translated: such that whatever object is experienced is also cognized by consciousness?

original: 'on te skad cig ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma nges pa ste /
translated: Or is the object not ascertained?

original: skad cig ma gang kho na la tshor ba byed pa de kho na la rnam par byed pa'i bar yin zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma gang kho na la tshor ba byed pa de kho na la rnam par byed pa'i bar yin zhe na /
translated: If feeling is present at the very moment that one engages in action, then so too is discernment.

original: bdag ni 'di dmigs pa la nges pa yin no zhes smra ste /
analyzed: bdag ni 'di dmigs pa la nges pa yin no zhes smra ste /
translated: We maintain that the self is certain with regard to its focal object.

original: de lta bas na mdo dang mi 'gal lo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mdo dang mi 'gal lo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore we do not contradict the sūtras.

original: slob dpon gyis mdo de nyid la tshe dang drod dag lhan cig pa la 'dres pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir skad cig ma nges pa yin par grub po zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis mdo de nyid la tshe dang drod dag lhan cig pa la 'dres pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir skad cig ma nges pa yin par grub po zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Vasubandhu says, “It is established that they are momentary because the sūtra itself states that life force and heat are mixed and inseparable.”

original: tshe dang drod dang chos 'di gnyis ni 'dres pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang chos 'di gnyis ni 'dres pa yin gyi /
translated: The sūtra states, “These two phenomena, life force and heat, are mixed and inseparable.

original: ma 'dres pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung bas /
translated: They are not unmixed.”

original: tshe dang drod dag lhan cig skyes pa nyid du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang drod dag lhan cig skyes pa nyid du bshad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore it is explained that life force and heat are coemergent.

original: de gnyis kyis dmigs pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis dmigs pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have a focal object.

original: de lta bas na 'di skad du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa dang rnam par shes pa rnams ni gdon mi za bar lhan cig 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di skad du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa dang rnam par shes pa rnams ni gdon mi za bar lhan cig 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is proven: feeling, discernment, intention, and consciousness definitely occur together,

original: mdo de las lhan cig 'dres pa yin par gsungs pas bshad pa'i phyir tshe dang drod lta bu'o zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo de las lhan cig 'dres pa yin par gsungs pas bshad pa'i phyir tshe dang drod lta bu'o zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: because the sūtra states that they are mixed and combined, like life and heat.

original: de yang ji ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: How is that?

original: de yang ji ltar rnam par shes pa ni yod la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rnam par shes pa ni yod la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa ma yin te /
translated: How is it that consciousness exists but the assembly of the three—the faculty, the object, and the consciousness—does not exist?

original: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa yod phan chad gdon mi za bar 'dus pa yin par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa yod phan chad gdon mi za bar 'dus pa yin par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: Therefore, since consciousness exists, you must accept that the assembly exists.

original: 'dus pa yang khyod kyi ltar na reg pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa yang khyod kyi ltar na reg pa yin no //
translated: And if the assembly exists, according to your theory, contact exists.

original: des na rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / yan na 'dus pa yin la reg pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / yan na 'dus pa yin la reg pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory to say that not all consciousnesses are contact and that there is contact that is not contact through meeting.🔽The six movements of mental satisfaction and so on are stated in the Abhidharmakośa:

original: yid bde ba'i bar rgyu ba drug / ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig gi gzugs mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i bar rgyu ba drug / ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig gi gzugs mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu'o //
translated: The eye sees forms and moves to forms that are the basis of mental satisfaction.🔽The ear hears sounds and moves to sounds that are the basis of mental satisfaction and so on.

original: rna bas sgra dag thos nas yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i sgra rnams la nye bar rgyu'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du yid kyi chos dag rnam par shes nas yid bde @300b ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams la nye bar rgyu'o zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: rna bas sgra dag thos nas yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i sgra rnams la nye bar rgyu'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du yid kyi chos dag rnam par shes nas yid bde @300b ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams la nye bar rgyu'o zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Similarly, the mind cognizes phenomena and moves to phenomena that are the basis of mental satisfaction and so on.

original: de bzhin du mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas yid mi bde ba'i gnas lta bu dang / btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas yid mi bde ba'i gnas lta bu dang / btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the eye sees forms and moves to forms that are the basis of mental dissatisfaction and equanimity.

original: gsum du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Threefold means that it has three types of natures: mental satisfaction, mental dissatisfaction, and equanimity.

original: gcig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One means that it is associated with just the mental consciousness.

original: drug tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drug tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Six means that it is differentiated by the six objects such as form.

original: gsum kar yang rnam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i rdzas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa ni gcig yin no //
analyzed: gsum kar yang rnam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i rdzas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa ni gcig yin no //
translated: It is established as threefold means that the substance of feeling that is associated with the mental consciousness is one.

original: de yid bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: de yid bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
translated: It is differentiated as three types from the perspective of the three types of natures: mental satisfaction, mental dissatisfaction, and equanimity.

original: de yang yul drug so sor tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni rnam pa drug tu dbye bas bco brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de yang yul drug so sor tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni rnam pa drug tu dbye bas bco brgyad yin no //
translated: It is differentiated as six types from the perspective of the six objects that are differentiated as individual objects. Thus there are eighteen.

original: ngo bo nyid gzhag pa med na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhag pa med na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no establishment of intrinsic nature, there would be no such thing as mental satisfaction, mental dissatisfaction, or equanimity.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa gzhan pa med na yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba de lta bur yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa gzhan pa med na yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba de lta bur yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: If there were no other associated factors, it would not be called mental application.

original: bco brgyad de las gzhan pa zhig yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bco brgyad de las gzhan pa zhig yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be something other than the eighteen.

original: dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa yul drug rnam par gzhag pa med na yid bde ba la sogs pa las rnam pa drug tha dad pa'i sgo nas yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad ces bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa yul drug rnam par gzhag pa med na yid bde ba la sogs pa las rnam pa drug tha dad pa'i sgo nas yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad ces bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no establishment of the six objects such as form, there would be no such thing as the eighteen mental applications distinguished by six types such as mental satisfaction.

original: de lta bas na gsum kar gzhag go zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsum kar gzhag go zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that all three are established.

original: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ma 'chol ba can yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ma 'chol ba can yin no //
translated: The phrase “having a non-mixed object” means having a non-confused object.

original: chos la nye bar rgyu ba gsum ni gnyi ga yin zhes bya ba gang dag gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga las ma gtogs pa chos la dmigs pa'i chos la nye bar rgyu ba de dag ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos la nye bar rgyu ba gsum ni gnyi ga yin zhes bya ba gang dag gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga las ma gtogs pa chos la dmigs pa'i chos la nye bar rgyu ba de dag ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Those that investigate phenomena that focus on phenomena that are not included among the five objects such as form are called those that focus on unmixed objects.🔽Those that focus on two objects such as form and so on,

original: gang dag gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug las gnyis dang / gsum @301a * //
analyzed: gang dag gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug las gnyis dang / gsum @301a * //
translated: those that focus on three objects,

original: nas / yul drug gi bar la dmigs pa de dag ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nas / yul drug gi bar la dmigs pa de dag ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: up to those that focus on six objects are called those that focus on mixed objects.

original: yid la brten nas rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes grag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: yid la brten nas rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes grag ces bya ba la /
translated: It is said that they are called that because they move in dependence on the mental faculty.

original: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The term it is said is used to indicate the scriptural system of others.

original: yid la brten cing gnas nas yul dag la nye bar rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes grag ste /
analyzed: yid la brten cing gnas nas yul dag la nye bar rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes grag ste /
translated: It is said that they are called that because they move and investigate objects in dependence on and abiding in the mental faculty.

original: dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term focus means to observe.

original: nye bar rgyu bar byed ces bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar rgyu bar byed ces bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: To investigate means to engage.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: tshor ba'i dbang gis yid yul dag la yang dang yang du rnam par rgyu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang gis yid yul dag la yang dang yang du rnam par rgyu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the mind moves again and again toward objects due to the power of feeling.

original: nye bar zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yang dang yang du zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yang dang yang du zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the term “again and again” is the meaning of the term “near.”

original: nye bar rgyu bar byed pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig bo //
analyzed: nye bar rgyu bar byed pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig bo //
translated: It does not cause to move near, that is, it does not cause to move toward a definite conclusion.

original: mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'o //
translated: It is not suitable, that is, it is not possible.

original: gal te yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba yid kho na la brten pa yin na bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de kho na la brten gyi mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la brten pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba yid kho na la brten pa yin na bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de kho na la brten gyi mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la brten pa ma yin na /
translated: If the mental applications of pleasure, etc., are based on the mind alone, then the pleasure of the third absorption is based on the mind alone and not on the eye faculty, etc.

original: ci'i phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'i nang dag tu ma smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'i nang dag tu ma smos she na /
translated: Why is it not mentioned among the mental applications?

original: dang po 'dod pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: dang po 'dod pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The root text states, “In the desire realm, the first is not mentioned.”

original: dang po ni dang po na'o //
analyzed: dang po ni dang po na'o //
translated: The first is the first.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na yid kyis pa'i bde ba med de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na yid kyis pa'i bde ba med de /
translated: There is no mental pleasure in the desire realm.

original: de lta bas na de ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a mental application.

original: de'i phyir lhag ma bsam gtan gsum pa na bde ba'i dbang po yid la brten pa nyid yin yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'i nang du ma smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhag ma bsam gtan gsum pa na bde ba'i dbang po yid la brten pa nyid yin yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'i nang du ma smos so //
translated: Therefore, although the faculty of pleasure in the third absorption is based on the mental faculty, it is not mentioned among the mental applications.

original: ji ltar yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba'i mi mthun par yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba yod ba de ltar bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba'i mi mthun pa'i sdug bsngal gyi nye bar rgyu ba med de /
analyzed: ji ltar yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba'i mi mthun par yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba yod ba de ltar bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba'i mi mthun pa'i sdug bsngal gyi nye bar rgyu ba med de /
translated: Just as there is a mental application of displeasure that is incompatible with the mental application of pleasure, there is no mental application of pain that is incompatible with the mental application of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pain is not based on the mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir bde ba de ni thams cad du yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba de ni thams cad du yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, pleasure is never a mental application.

original: grag ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs yin pa'o //
analyzed: grag ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs yin pa'o //
translated: The word “they say” indicates another’s theory.

original: yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: It is like a basis of mental pleasure because it generates mental pleasure.

original: rnam par shes pa ldas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni @301b mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lngas mngon par bsgrubs shing bskyed pa nyid la dgongs shing thugs la gzhag ste gsungs par
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ldas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni @301b mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lngas mngon par bsgrubs shing bskyed pa nyid la dgongs shing thugs la gzhag ste gsungs par
translated: This is stated with the intention and thought that the five collections of consciousness are established and generated,

original: zad kyi 'di dag ni yid kyis pa yin te dper na mi sdug pa lta bu sngar rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zad kyi 'di dag ni yid kyis pa yin te dper na mi sdug pa lta bu sngar rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: but they are mental since, for example, the mind observing repulsiveness is mental since it views the prior stages of the process of decay and so on.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'ang yid la mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir yid kyi sa pa yang yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'ang yid la mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir yid kyi sa pa yang yin pa bzhin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having seen forms with the eye,🔽and so on, up to

analyzed: lus kyis reg bya dag re gnas zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir de ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
